loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith used the previous loan to buy sodas, beers and fresh foods to sell.  She is a 32-year-old married woman with two children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda.  Her family goal is to educate her children up to the university level and construct a good house for the family.  She has the challenge of limited capital to invest in her business.  In her hotel she provides accommodation for 30 people per night and her desire is to have a five star hotel in the next ten years.  Edith is requesting a loan to buy beer and renovate the hotel rooms.

loans.use: to buy beer and  renovate the hotel rooms.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more  second hand  fridges to resell and procced on repairs fridges .

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en: Phorn is 31 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been selling CDs and light bulbs for more than two years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband runs an electronic repair shop. He earns about $15 daily. In order to improve her family’s finances, Phorn is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase spare parts for her husband to use in his shop. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her husband to use in his shop

loans.name: La Fidelite 2 (#1) Group

texts.en:
Victorine, age 52, is married with 3 children, ages 25 to 30 years. One of her children currently attends university. She also cares for her young niece. Victorine represents the Fidelite 2 (#1) group. She sells salted fish at a stand in the market. She has had this business for more than 10 years. She will use the loan to buy more salted fish. Her business strategy is to take a taxi and sell the fish at different locations during the week. She has found some good areas where she sells a lot of fish. 

Victorine has received four previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner. She has a good repayment record. She hopes to continue to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy salted fish

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Ms. Najma is a 54-year-old married woman and mother of four. Najma has been in the business of clothes trading for many years. Being the primary breadwinner of her family, she is a diligent worker. Her husband works as a taxi driver and pays rent for a car. He alone is unable to provide for their four children, so Najma contributes a lot to the family income through her business. Every day early in the morning, she picks up her bag of sample clothes and visits various marketplaces. She shows sample pieces of clothes to shopkeepers who then order the desired quantity. Currently, she is in her second loan cycle. Previous records show that Najma is a responsible client who makes timely payments. 

She requested a loan of Rs 30,000. Najma is going to use the loan to buy a wide variety of clothes and a larger quantity to add to her current supply. She said the material she wants to buy is slightly more expensive than what she is trading now. She is hopeful that by adding this material to her inventory she will be able to secure more clients. She desires to utilize the earned profits for the betterment of her children and family.

loans.use: To buy a wide variety of clothes

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a 50-year-old married man with 20 children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. After realizing that farming alone could not help him support his vast family, he decided to start a retail shop to earn daily income. He is challenged mainly by price fluctuations and high cost of rent for the business premises. His personal goal is educating his children, and his business goal is to expand into new market areas. James is requesting the loan to buy sugar, salt and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt and soap to sell

loans.name: Line

texts.en:
Line, a mother of two dependent school-aged children, is 33 years old and lives in northern Albania. She is educated, yet, recently she was laid off from her position and now she is looking at building a business in livestock. She loves animals and likes making cheese, and this is the reason why she decided to pursue this option. Being aware of the demand for dairy in her region, she’s convinced that she will do well in this type of industry.

Recently, Line and her family have been relocated to a new village, and all of them live in an animal stable, which has been renovated and made more for people than animals. Living under such conditions, her priority is to improve their living with the earnings she will hopefully generate.

Line is seeking lenders' appreciation in this matter.

loans.use: To buy milk cows

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 31 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su hijo Reyner a quien cuida en la casa que heredó de sus padres desde hace 20 años. Carmen es una mujer de muchos oficios, gusta mucho de trabajar y mantenerse ocupada, junto a su familia se dedica a la elaboración de ladrillos, pues desde muy niña comenzó con el negocio. Paralelo a ese trabajo también abrió desde hace 5 años una tienda de comestibles donde vende productos de primera necesidad; durante todo este tiempo le fue muy bien pues en su pueblo no existen tiendas equipadas. Durante todo este tiempo pudo abastecer su tienda con diversos productos alimenticios, pero desea seguir mejorando pues aún le faltan carnes y legumbres para que pueda abastecer la necesidad de sus clientes. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “juventud nueva generación” y este es el segundo préstamo con MFP, agradece el apoyo que recibe pues le ayudó a incrementar el capital de su negocio. Por esa razón promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Carmen, invertirá el dinero en la compra de víveres para su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Carmen is 31 years old and is a simple woman. She lives with her son Reyner who she cares for in the house she inherited from her parents 20 years ago. Carmen is a woman of many skills and she likes to work and keep herself busy. 

Together with their family they make bricks, a business in which she started from a very young age.   In parallel with this business 5 years ago she opened a grocery store where she sells essential items. It has gone well for her since there are no well-equipped shops in the town where she lives.  During this time she has been able to supply her shop with a wide range of food products, but she wants to continue improving since she still does not have meat and vegetables to meet the needs of her customers. 

She belongs to the group “next generation youth” and this is her second loan with MFP. She is grateful for the support she receives since it has helped her to increase her business capital. For this reason she promises to be punctual in making her repayments. She will use the money to buy essential items for her grocery shop.

loans.use: to buy essential items for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Tea

texts.en:
Tea is from a village in the Tetritskaro district. She is 39 years old and lives with her husband, mother-in-law and two children (eight and nine years old). The children go to the local school. Tea's husband works as an artisan and gets a monthly income. Her mother-in-law is a pensioner. 

The family is involved in an agricultural business. In particular, they have a small dairy farm of seven milk cows, whose milk is used for dairy production. Tea produces Sulguni (Georgian pickled cheese) and sells it in the capital city supermarket. Tea works hard, but the family still doesn't have enough income to make some savings and improve their living conditions. 

She requested a loan to renovate the house. The existing house is old and damaged. Tea will purchase building materials and repair it. Then, the living conditions of the family will be improved and they will be able to spend their evenings after a hard working day in a more comfortable environment. Tea hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to renovate the house

loans.name: Safar

texts.en: Safar is 38 years old. He is married and has two children. He is an internally displaced person from the city of Fuzuli, but currently he and his family live in the greater Baku region. He has been in this taxi business for four years. He loves his work and enjoys spending his time thinking of ways to improve his business. Safar now needs a loan of 1,000 Azerbaijani New Manat to buy spare parts for his car.

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Fatima's group is comprised of 2 hardworking women. Fatima is 22 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past 3 years, Fatima has been working hard to manage her small business, where she sells drinks like soda and juice. 

To help expand her business, Fatima has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a wider variety of drinks to sell, and will help Fatima to generate greater profits and use the profits to pay for her and her child's basic needs. Fatima hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Fatima is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: To buy a wider variety of drinks to sell

loans.name: Cosmas Lumori

texts.en:
Cosmas is a 40-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has 4 children between the ages of 3 and 12.  Three of them go to school.
Cosmas runs a general store, and has been in business for 4 years. He has no employees. He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the loan officers. He is taking a loan of 3,000 SDG to purchase oil, onions, flour, sapa, etc.  This business is his only source of income. In 5 years Cosmas would like to expand his business and open other branches.  His major challenges include high transportation costs. Cosmas says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more items like oil, onions, flour, sapa, etc.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
For the last 18 years Sarah has been operating a mobile food supply in Naivasha town. She is 42 years old and a single mother of three schooling children. 

Sarah has applied for her third loan from KADET LTD to enable her buy food ingredients to cook for her clients and also to use part of the loan to pay school fees for her children.

In the future, Sarah aspires to open a chain of hotels in Naivasha town.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients to cook for her clients

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 29 years old from Naivasha and is married with two children who are 13 years old and 8 years old.

Pauline has an electronics business that she has been doing for the past six years, and she has applied for her first loan from KADET Ltd. to enable her to buy more electronic equipment to add to her stock for sale.

She hopes to expand her business and open a boutique shop in the near future.

loans.use: To buy electrical equipment to add to her stock.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a single man of thirty years. He runs a electronics shop in Limuru town, where by he sells assorted electronic spare parts. He has been in this business for twelve years now and gets a monthly income of sixty nine thousands shillings. .

This will be Alex's sixth loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy electric spare parts for his shop. With the income that he will get he will open another shop in a different area.

In future he wants to be a successful business man.

loans.use: To buy electric spare parts for his shop

loans.name: Teresiah

texts.en:
Teresiah is 36 years old, widowed, and supports her three children. She has run a food stall for the past four years in the Narok market, earning a monthly income of 40,000 KES.

With her fourth loan of 50,000 KES from KADET LTD, she intends to renovate her premises and buy new aprons for her workers.

She intends to reinvest her profits and grow the business. Her future plan is to grow the business into a large-scale outlet.

loans.use: to renovate her food stall

loans.name: Bon

texts.en: Bon is 33 years old. She is married and resides with her four children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than 20 years, earning approximately $2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $3 daily. Bon is requesting a loan of $1,500 to purchase a walking tractor to use for tilling her farmland. This purchase will help her reduce farming expenses. In the future, she would like to purchase a harvester to harvest her crops and to rent to others. Moreover, she wants all of her children to earn a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase a walking tractor to till her land

loans.name: Mwanahawa

texts.en:
Mwanahawa is a married lady who lives with her life partner, but they don't have any children yet. She sells fish from her home. She has been in this business for the last three years. Mwanahawa is a very determined and honest person, well-known and liked by everyone who lives in that neighborhood.

She is applying for the loan to buy more fish, and that way provide her customers with comfort.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: La socia es la señora Beatriz, madre de 2 hijos, ella continua con su negocio de venta de leña la cual comercializa en restaurantes y  pizzerías de la ciudad. Beatriz en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para comprar leña de madera y capitalizar su actividad. Beatriz está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, para fortalecer su actividad económica la cual le permite ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en: This member is Beatriz, a mother of two children. She still runs her business selling firewood, which she sells to the town's restaurants and pizza parlors. Beatriz is currently requesting a loan in order to purchase firewood and fund her business. Beatriz is very thankful for Kiva's help in strengthening her business, which allows her to improve her family's living conditions. This member belongs to the "Kanchary" communal bank of the town of Cusco, in Peru.

loans.use: to purchase firewood.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is married and has two children. He has had a grocery store in his home and has been selling at retail for two years. It is well stocked. He is a very hard-working person, eager to succeed and help his family, as he knows that life is hard, and working is the only way to get ahead. 

He is applying for the loan in order to buy vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and tomatoes and other supplies that he wishes to supply his business with, and to continue providing good products to his customers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and tomatoes

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, 23, is a single gentleman; he lives in Msambweni. He has his own business selling fuel. He’s been in business for one year. He got a locale in the community near where he lives and sells petrol mostly to motorcycle operators.

He will use the loan he’s requesting to buy gallons of petrol for resale. He hopes to increase income and clientele. His dream is to make the business grow to generate income to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy gallons of petrol for resale

loans.name: Gongolamboto Group

texts.en:
Jamila, who is in her late 30s, is married. She has a child who is expecting to go to university. She has been running a beauty salon for ten years now. She works from 9am to 10pm daily, and she is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to restock missing salon equipment, and to pay school fees and household expenses. She has paid back all of her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to buy salon equipment and to prepare her child to go to university. Her dream is to one day be able to finish building her own house. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Gongolamboto," which totals 17 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 40 years old married and blessed with two children aged 19 and 14 years respectively. She owns a retail shop, a business she started a year ago and earns a monthly income of KES. 10,000. 

She has requested for a second loan of KES. 20,000 to purchase bales of maize flour, bags of rice and 50kgs of cooking fat for sale.

The profit she earns will aid her educate her children. Her dream is to see herself successful in all endeavors.

loans.use: To purchase bales of maize flour, bags of rice and 50kgs of cooking fat for sale at her general store.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine works to get ahead and improve her lifestyle. She has been running a beauty salon for several years, during which time she has worked hard to equip her business with everything she needs, although it is something she must stay on top of because of the constantly changing trends of the beauty world. She is one of the most frequent beneficiaries of loans from Yehu and Kiva. She tells us that they have been a help to her progress in life.

Catherine is requesting another loan through Yehu to buy a blow dryer, hairpieces, hair color, cream and everything she needs to do her work and sell products to customers. She is very hopeful of improving her income and leading a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy a blow dryer, hairpieces, hair color, cream, etc.

loans.name: Amartsengel

texts.en: Mrs. Amartsengel is 42 years old and lives with her family in Kherlen, the biggest city of the eastern province of Mongolia. She has been working as a bookkeeper in a local private company since 2008, and her husband, Namsrai, has been running a taxi business in his home town. They have two children: a 13 and 10-year-old girl and boy. Before the collapse of the Soviet era, Amartsengel had worked as a tailoress in the local community service center and her husband worked as a border guard. Amartsengel’s family lives in a small wooden house with thin walls, so their house gets even colder in the winter time. As you know, Mongolia is one of the coldest countries in the world and borders with Siberia to the north. Before the winter comes, Amartsengel is requesting a 5,000,000 MNT loan to build a new capacious house with less heat loss. She says that her new house will create a warmer atmosphere and bring happiness to her family every single day.

loans.use: To build a new capacious house with less heat loss

loans.name: Jayson

texts.en: Nowadays, life has become difficult due calamities, the high cost of commodities and low crop production. Despite this, Jayson has the strong desire and determination to improve his standard of living because he believes that, "A hard working person will never go hungry". He is 31 years old, married and has two infant-age children. He is a farmer who owns and manages a corn farming business and raises livestock to sell. Since it is the major source of his income, he aims to improve and strengthen the business so that he will increase his income and satisfy his family's needs. He plans to raise more pigs to sell in the future, but he doesn't have enough capital. Therefore, he is asking for an additional PHP 20,000 to buy feed, vaccines, vitamins and materials needed to improve his pigpen. He is hoping that someday he will improve the business and make it viable in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, vitamins and materials to improve the pigpen

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en: Chenda is 33 years old. She is married and resides with her four children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening cattle for more than 20 years, earning approximately $5 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. Chenda is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase a walking tractor to use to till her farmland and rent to others. This purchase will help her generate more income to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a walking tractor

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es:
El socio es el señor Dionicio, él sigue con su actividad económica de venta de neumáticos. Dionicio está solicitando el préstamo para comprar  mercadería como llantas y capitalizar su comercio.
Dionicio está muy agradecido con KIVA por ayudarlo en el mantenimiento de su actividad económica. El pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
This member's name is Dionicio. He continues with his economic activity selling tires. Dionicio is asking for the loan to buy merchandise such as tires, and to capitalize his business.

Dionicio is very grateful to KIVA for helping him maintain his economic activity. He belongs to the “KANCHARY” communal bank in the city of Cuzco – Peru.

loans.use: to buy tires for his business.

loans.name: Khoeurn

texts.en:
Khoeurn is 51 years old. She is widowed and resides with four children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. Khoeurn is a homemaker and her children are employed in a garment factory. Her children earn about 10 USD per day. 

Khoeurn is requesting a 1,000 USD loan to purchase construction materials to build a bathroom. Her loan will help provide hygienic living conditions for her family. In the future, Khoeurn would like to run a business and rebuild her present house to make it bigger for her family.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a bathroom

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok is 59 years old. She is widowed and resides with three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. Sok is a homemaker and her children are garment workers who earn about 9 USD daily. 

Sok is requesting a 1,400 USD loan to purchase a motorbike to help her children commute to work. This will reduce her family's transportation expenses and improve their difficulties. In the future, Sok would like to run an additional business and rebuild her present house to make it bigger and more convenient for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Glizabeth

texts.es: Glizabeth, de 46 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su hijo Jhon en la casa que heredó de su padre y donde ella vivió desde que nació. Ella vive en una zona muy concurrida y de amplias pampas donde hay ríos para regar sus sembríos, por ese motivo el trabajo en la agricultura es su principal actividad económica. Tiene 10 años de experiencia en la siembra de papa, maíz y alfalfa, cuenta con terrenos propios que le fueron heredados por parte de su padre, pero como no se abastece también arrienda otros. Sus sembríos los comercializa en la capital del país, de donde obtiene buenas ganancias. Asimismo se dedica a la crianza de animales como cuyes, ovejas, cerdos y vacas, de estas últimas extrae la leche que produce, comenta que muy pronto tendrán becerros que aumentarán su ganado, gracias a la venta de sus animales puede cubrir ciertos gastos como el pago de los estudios universitarios de su único hijo, por quien sale adelante. Este es el crédito número 2 con MFP, por lo que promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, pues durante todo estos años el dinero le ayudó en dinamizar su negocio y por ende sus ingresos, además le agrada pertenecer a su asociación donde las personas son solidarias. Glizabeth, invertirá el dinero en la compra de semilla y fertilizantes para su siembra de alfalfa que le servirá para la alimentación de sus animales.
texts.en: Glizabeth is 46 years old and a humble woman. She lives with her son Jhon in the house she inherited from her father and where she has lives since she was born. She lives in a very busy plpace with wide open fields with rivers to irrigate her crops with. That is why farming is her main financial activity. She has 10 year experience planting potatoes, corn and alfalfa. She has her own land she inherited from her father, but since it isn't enough she also rents more. She sells her crops in the country's capital where she makes good profits. She also raises animals, such as guinea pigs, sheep, pigs and cows. From the cows she gets milk. She remarks that soon she will have calves that will increase her cattle. Thanks to selling her animals she can cover certain expenses she has, such as paying for her only son's college tuition, for whom she is getting ahead. This is her second loan with MFP, and she promises to make her payments on time. During these last few years the money has helped her dynamize her business and therefore her income. She also likes belonging to her association where the people are supportive.Glizabeth will invest the money in buying seeds and fertilizers for her alfalfa, which will feed her animals.

loans.use: to buy alfalfa seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy jewellery-making items for jewellery-making and selling business

loans.name: Robelito

texts.en:
Robelito is 30 years old and married with two infant children. He lives happily with his family in a rural community where they plant corn and vegetables and raise livestock to sell. Robelito hopes to improve his hog-raising business to generate sufficient income for his family.

Robelito is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to buy feed, vitamins, and additional pigs to raise. He hopes to improve his hog-raising business to earn and save more income for the future of his children. Robelito believes that his loan will make it possible to improve his business and become successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy pig feed, vitamins, and pigs to raise

loans.name: Phon

texts.en: Phon is 41 years old. She is married and resides with two children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries and gasoline for more than a year, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a security guard who earns about $3 each day. Phon is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase construction materials to build a new house. This money will help her provide better living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a new house

loans.name: Jackeline Brenda

texts.es: La Sra. Jackeline   es conviviente, tiene 20 años de edad y tiene una hija de 9 meses. Jackeline  estudia enfermería  en una universidad privada, Jackeline Trabaja en el negocio de su mamá que es una cabina de internet donde ella trabaja medio tiempo, su sueño de jackeline es culminar la carrera y ser un  profesional de exito y nos cuenta que su motivacion para lograr sus objetivos es su hija, con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un  préstamo para pagar su matrícula y pensión, Jackeline cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y agradece a  Edaprospo y kiva por el préstamo otorgado.
texts.en: Jackeline is in a common law marriage. She is 20 years old and has a 9 year old daughter. Jackeline studies nursing at a private unviersity. She works in her mother's business, which is a internet cafe. She works there part time. Jackeline's dream is to finish her major and be a succes in her career. She tells us that her motivation to meet her goals is her daughter. In order to keep growing, she has asked for a loan to pay for school registry and tuition. Jackeline will meet her goals with a lot of work and dedication. She is grateful to Edaprospo and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: to pay for school regsitry and tuition

loans.name: Levita Gina

texts.en:
Levita Gina is a determined mother of five. She untiringly earns income to provide enough sustenance for her family. She is married to Elmer, her partner in the junkshop business. They buy scrap materials such as cans, bottles, and old newspapers to re-sell them at a higher price. This way the couple gains about PHP 10,000 each month, which goes for their meals and school fees for her children. Three of her children are in elementary school and the others are too young to study. 

Levita Gina would like to increase her income and needs a loan of PHP 50,000 to have additional capital to maintain the business. Her loan will be used to buy more metals, old newspapers, empty bottles and jars to re-sell for profit.

Someday, Levita Gina would like to keep growing as a succesful entrepreneur and give the best education to her children. With the good funds she earns, she will also improve the family's poor living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more metals, old newspapers, empty bottles and jars to re-sell for profit

loans.name: Huong's Group

texts.en:
Huong was born in 1977. She has two children who are studying at primary and high school. Her husband sells beef in the market and earns an income of about 3,500,000 VND per month. Huong sells pork in the market and earns 3,500,000 VND each month. Huong has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2012. 

Huong is requesting a 5,014,000 VND loan to buy more kinds of pork to sell in her stall. She plans to let her children stay in school to receive a higher education and also buy a television for her little house. Her fellow group member is Than who is 50 years old and has two children. Than sells newspapers and magazines for a living and is requesting a 6,322,000 VND loan to buy more magazines to sell.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of pork to sell at her stall

loans.name: Giovana

texts.es: Giovana, de 29 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo Elmer y su hijo Enso al que cuidan en una casa alquilada desde hace 2 años. Por más de 10 años comenzó a fabricar ladrillos junto a sus hermanos, con los que se asoció para la fabricación de los millares de ladrillos cubriendo los gastos a medias por cada uno de los socios. Ella trabaja todos los días de la semana, menos los miércoles y domingos que son días de feria en la localidad, ahí Giovana incursionó en la venta de carbón donde le va bien, “a diferencia de los ladrillos el carbón se gana bien pero no rota constantemente, por esa razón me dedico más a la fábrica”, comenta. Es por esa razón que desea mejorar la cantidad de ladrillos que produce para obtener mejores ganancias. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “juventud nueva generación” y este es el segundo préstamo con MFP, agradece el apoyo que recibe pues le ayudó a incrementar el capital de su negocio. Por esa razón promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Giovana, invertirá el dinero en la compra de ramas y tierra para la elaboración de ladrillos.
texts.en:
Giovana is 29 years old and is a hard-working woman. She lives with her husband Elmer and her son Enso who she has been caring for in a rented house for 2 years.  

Over 10 years ago she started making bricks together with her siblings, with whom she united to start producing thousands of bricks with the expenses being covered by each of the members a they could. She works every day of the week except for Wednesdays and Sundays which are holidays where she lives. 

Giovana also started selling coal which is going well for her. "Unlike with bricks, with coal you can earn good money, but it's not always in demand, that's why I focus on making bricks" she comments.

For this reason she wants to increase the amount of bricks she produces to gain a better income. 

She is a member of the group “next generation youth” and this is her second loan with MFP. She is grateful for the support she receives since it has helped her to increase her business capital. For this reason she promises to make her repayments punctually. Giovana will use the money to buy wooden sticks and mud to make bricks.

loans.use: to buy wooden sticks and mud to make bricks.

loans.name: Mahina

texts.ru: Махина родилась в 1982 году. Она проживает в района Варзоб. Махина замужем. Она занимается шитьем национальных платьев у себя дома. В этой области Махина имеет богатый опыт. Она просит кредит для покупки тканей.
texts.en:
Mahina was born in 1982. She lives with her husband in Varzob, Tajikistan. She's a very experienced dressmaker and earns a living by sewing dresses. 

Mahina is asking for a loan in order to purchase some cloth and fabric.

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor, de  22 años es un hombre soltero. Vive en compañía de su hija Juliet en la casa que alquila desde hace un año. Hace un año vivía junto a sus padres, tomo la decisión de independizarse y vivir junto a su pequeña hija por quien trabaja muy duro con el objetivo de brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Su principal actividad económica se centra en la fabricación de ladrillos, “desde niño aprendí el oficio, mis padres y demás parientes se dedican a este oficio”, comenta. Es así que desde hace 3 años, se independizó de sus padres y comenzó por el mismo a emprender el negocio; en la actualidad cuenta con un horno propio del que saca el mayor provecho pues es su único ingreso económico. Al mes realiza un promedio de 9 millares de ladrillos, los que vende en la misma fábrica pues la zona donde trabaja Víctor, es muy conocida por la elaboración de ladrillos y ya tienen clientes fijos que llegan a negociar el producto. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “juventud nueva generación” y este es el segundo préstamo con MFP, agradece el apoyo que recibe pues le ayudó a incrementar el capital de su negocio. Por esa razón promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Víctor, invertirá el dinero en la compra de ramas y aserrín para la elaboración de los ladrillos.
texts.en: 22-year-old Victor is a single man. He lives with his daughter Juliet in a house he's been renting for a year. He lived with his parents until a year ago, when he decided to become independent and live with his little girl. He works very hard so that he can improve his daughter's living conditions. His main business is focused on making bricks. "I've learned the trade ever since I was a child; my parents and other relatives are in this line of work", he says. That's why he became independent from his parents and started a business of his own three years ago. He currently has his own oven, which he uses to his full advantage, since it's his only source of income. He makes an average of 9,000 bricks a month, and he sells them at his own factory. The area where Victor works is very well-known for its brick manufacturing businesses, and they already have regular customers who come to negotiate the product. He belongs to the "Juventud Nueva Generación" communal bank and this is his second loan with MFP. He gives thanks for the support he's getting, because it helped him increase his working capital. For that reason he pledges to make his repayments in a timely manner. Victor will use the money to purchase branches of wood and sawdust in order to make the bricks.

loans.use: to purchase branches of wood and sawdust for making bricks.

loans.name: Gulraftor

texts.ru: Гулрафтор родилась в 1987 году. Она проживает в района Варзоб. Гулрафтор приятная и хорошая молодая девушка. Она уже три года как занимается торговлей на рынке. Гулрафтор арендует торговую точку, где занимается торговлей хлеба. Она берет кредит для покупки муки и масла. Гулрафтор хочет печь лепешки для продажи. Таким образом она сможет увеличить оборот и ассортимент свое товара (хлебобулочных изделий).
texts.en:
Gulraftor was born in 1987 and lives in Varzob, Tajikistan. She's a very nice and kind young woman. For the past three years, Gulraftor has worked as a salesperson on the local market. She rents a sales point which she uses to sell bread from. 

Gulraftor wants to start baking flapjacks for sale and, therefore, is asking for a loan in order to purchase flour and butter. This way, she will be able to increase her sales volume and the variety of her products.

loans.use: to purchase flour and butter.

loans.name: Naby

texts.ru: Наби 50 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Она окончил Таджикский Государственный Университет по специальности экономиста. Он работает бухгалтером в фермерской хозяйстве для того, чтобы обеспечить семью. Его жена работает методистом в организации. Его старший сын является студентом 3 курса Медицинского Университета. Наби не в состоянии оплатить за учебы сына. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы сына. Наби и его сын ждут вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Naby is fifty years old. He's married and is raising three children. He graduated in economics from Tajikistan State University and works as an accountant for a private farm in order to provide for his family. Naby's wife works as a guidance counselor. Their oldest son is a third year student in medical school and they don't have enough money to pay for his tuition. 

Therefore, Naby is asking for a loan so that he can cover the tuition costs. They thank you for your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for his son’s education.

loans.name: La Fidelite 2 (#2) Group

texts.en:
Serge is 45, single, and has 3 children ages 6 to 18. All of his children currently attend school. He is representing the La Fidelite 2 (#2) Group. Serge owns a laundry business and has been operating for over 10 years! He will use the loan to buy another washing machine. 

Serge's business strategy is to do better work than his competitors. He believes he does a better job at cleaning and folding the clothes.
 
Serge has received 4 previous loans from HOPE Congo, Kiva's partner, and has a good repayment record. He plans to open other laundry shops around Brazzaville and hopes his children will be able to go to college in the future.

loans.use: to pay for a new washing machine.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia, de 59 años, es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora.  Es separada del padre  de 03 hijos,  quienes son su principal motivo para segur trabajando y lograr así brindarles una calidad de vida.  Ellos viven juntos en su casa propia que pudo comprar en base a esfuerzo y muy sacrificio. El negocio que tiene Julia es la venta de comidas como desayunos en las mañanas y menús en las tardes, entre otros. Todos las mañanas  abre su puesto de venta, siendo un local alquilado en el mercado central y oferta todos sus comidas preparadas, además de refrescos, atendiendo muy amablemente a sus clientes quienes son en su mayoría sus propios vecinos comerciantes, y la recomiendan a otros personas que con el tiempo se vuelven sus clientes habituales.
Se inició hace más de 20 años, con un préstamo particular, comprando y vendiendo en pocas cantidades, para luego ir aumentando de acuerdo a la demanda de sus comidas, y hasta el momento lo realiza ella sola.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja, y que casi siempre acaba todo lo que prepara para vender.
Además comenta le gusta su negocio pues conoce de cocina y se decidió a empezar por la necesidad de contar con un ingreso propio y tener un oficio pues la pensión para sus hijos no les alcanzaba y tenía apuros económicos. Ahora viendo los buenos resultados desea continuar con su negocio. Este es el crédito número 02 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se siente segura de avanzar con su negocio.  Por su parte ella se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo.  Además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos son muy responsables y solidarios. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevo soles, lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes e insumos para la preparación de comidas y ponerlas a la venta en su negocio, buscando precios cómodos por sus compras, así continuar con éste  negocio y aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
59-year-old Julia is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She's separated from the father of her three children. Her children are the main reason for her to keep on working and therefore be able to improve their living conditions. They live together in a house that she owns and was able to purchase with hard work and a lot of sacrifice. Julia's business is selling food such as breakfast in the mornings and meals in the afternoons, etc. Every morning she opens her stall, which she rents in the central market, and there she offers all her prepared food and also refreshments. She tends to her customers very kindly. They're mostly her own seller neighbors, who recommend her to other people that eventually become her regular customers.
She got her start over 20 years ago with a private loan. She used to buy and sell in small quantities and then she gradually expanded the business according to the demand for her food. To this day she does the work on her own.
She considers her business to be very profitable because of the earnings she gets from it, and because she almost always sells everything she prepares.
Furthermore, she reports that she enjoys her business, because she's skilled at cooking. She decided to start the business due to the need for an income and a trade of her own, because the child support wasn't enough for her children and she faced financial hardships. Now, as she sees good results, she wishes to keep her business going. This is her second loan with MFP. She's very glad to know that she has financial support, because that way she feels secure to move forward with her business. On her part, she pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner, as she has in her previous loans. Besides, she's very glad to be a member of her communal bank, since everyone is very responsible and supportive. With the requested amount of 1,500 nuevos soles she will purchase ingredients and supplies for making food and selling it at her stall. She'll get better prices for her purchases, and therefore she'll stay in business and increase her profits.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and supplies for making food.

loans.name: Diloso

texts.ru: Дилосо 42 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Детям 15, 18 и 21 года. Ее муж пенсионер, а она сама уже несколько лет работает в МЗО Имон Интернешенл. Она является одной из успешных работников. У нее очень хорошие и умные дети. Ее старшая дочь Азиза учится на 2 курсе Новосибирского Государственного Медицинского Университета. Зарплата Дилосо и пенсия ее мужа не хватает оплатить за учебы дочери. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы дочери в университете. Дилосо и Азиза ждут вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Diloso is forty-two years old and married. She has three very smart and kind children: they are 15, 18 and 21 years of age. Her husband's retired and she works for Imon International, where she is very successful at her job. 

Her oldest daughter is a second year student at the Novosibirsk State Medical University. Diloso's salary and her husband's pension aren't enough to cover the tuition costs, so she's asking for a loan in order to pay for her daughter's education. They thank you for your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter’s tuition.

loans.name: Dania Esperanza

texts.es:
Dania tiene 52 años de edad, tiene tres hijos. Desde hace cuatro años se dedica a la venta de ropa, lo aprendió por medio de una amiga. Antes de establecer su negocio solo realizaba los oficios domésticos en su casa; pero cuando su esposo la abandono, se vio obligada a tener una fuente de ingresos para su familia y decidió vender ropa de forma ambulante en diferentes colonias. La mercadería la adquiere en la capital del país, viaja cada ocho días en busca de mercadería  aun buen precio. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar más mercadería y para construir una habitación a su hijo mayor. Así, ella surtirá más su negocio y mejorara su vivienda, para que su familia viva dignamente, más cómoda y segura. Ella planea instalar una cerca al contorno de su propiedad para estar más segura.
texts.en:
Dania is 52-years-old and has three children. For four years she's been selling clothing, which she learned from a friend. Before starting her business, she had only done housework, but when her husband left her she found herself with no choice but to come up with a source of income for her family and decided to sell clothing as a mobile vendor in various communities. She buys her merchandise in the national capital, San Salvador, travelling there every eight days to look for merchandise at a good price.  

The loan she's requesting from the Fundación Campo [Kiva field partner] is to buy more merchandise and to build a room for her oldest son. In this way she will better stock her business and improve her home so that her family can live a more comfortable, safe, and dignified life. She also plans to install a fence around her property for greater security.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise and to build a room for her oldest son.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a 34-year-old married man living in Kasese, Uganda. He has four children, three of which attend school. He has a retail shop business, and is also in the motorcycle transportation business. With the income he's earned, he has been able to pay school fees for his children and reinvest in his business. Competition is his major challenge. 

His dream is to own a wholesale shop, since most of the traders who operate in retail purchase from wholesalers in the city.

Edward intends to use the loan to purchase posho, sugar, and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy posho, sugar, and rice to sell.

loans.name: Ulongani Group

texts.en:
Hassani, who is in his late 20s, is married with three children, two of whom go to school.  The third child is still young. Hassani has been running a general store for five years now. He works from 5:00 am to 11:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be his second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to buy a dip freezer and items missing from the store and has paid back his loan successfully.  He wants a loan to restock missing items again. His dream is to one day be able to start selling his items at wholesale prices.

He will share this loan with his loan group, "Ulongani", which has a total of 11 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to restock his general store

loans.name: Keila

texts.es:
Keila, de 44 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa con muchos deseos de superación.  Está casada con José quien se dedica al transporte y es padre de sus 3 hijos.  Vive en compañía de su esposo y sus 3 hijos a los que quiere mucho, habitando su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Keila es la venta de abarrotes  de primera necesidad para lo cual cuenta con una bodega instalada en su propia casa, donde vende también frutas frescas, para esto se levanta muy de temprano y se dirige a los mercados donde compra las frutas más frescas de los productores y los lleva a su bodega para venderlos a sus clientes, que en su mayoría son sus propios vecinos. Lleva dedicándose a éste negocio desde hace más de 1 años, tiempo que viene atendiendo de manera amable y cordial a sus clientes ganándose sus preferencias.
Le gusta sus negocios pues le permite estar en casa y cerca de sus hijos y así poder atenderlos,, además de brindarle una ocupación, mantenerla ocupada y generarle un ingreso económico para poder apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar y la educación de sus hijos. Además viendo los buenos resultados que está teniendo con su negocio tiene planes de continuar  e incluso hacerlo crecer, adquiriendo más mercaderías para surtir el negocio de su bodega. Este es el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta con la oportunidad de contar con una línea de crédito, por eso se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, para tener un buen record crediticio y tener acceso a más créditos en el futuro. Por otro lado comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera ser buenas personas.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de más mercaderías  para surtir su bodega, como abarrotes de primera necesidad a precio por mayor  para así tener mayores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Keila is 44 years old, a hard-working, dedicated woman and eager to get ahead. She is married to Joseph who makes a living in the transport industry and is the father of their 3 children. She lives with her husband and their 3 children, whom she loves so much. They live in their own house.

Keila makes a living selling staple groceries. She has a grocery store in her home, where she sells fresh fruits. She wakes up very early and goes to the markets to buy fresh fruits, from the producers, and takes them to her store to sell to her customers, who are mostly her own neighbors.

She has been in this business for over 1 year, during this time, she has been providing a friendly and cordial service to their customers earning their preferences. She likes her business because it allows her to be at home and close to her children and as well to attend them. In addition it gives her a job, which keeps her busy and helps her to generate an income to help her husband with the household expenses and the education of their children.

Seeing the good results is having with her business, she plans to continue and even to make it grow, buying more goods to stock the business.

This is her second loan with the institution MFP, she feels happy with the opportunity of having a line of credit. This is why she is committed to punctually make the payments. So, she will have a good credit record and have access to more credit in the future.

She says that she is comfortable with her communal bank because she knowns its members and considered them to be good people. With the requested amount of 1500 new soles, she will invest them in the purchase of more goods to stock her grocery store, such as staples at wholesale price to have higher profit margins.

loans.use: to buy staple products to stock her store.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.es:
Vivian, de 35 años de edad, es una mujer con mucha experiencia en los negocios, además de ser alegre y amable. Es conviviente con Anibal quien es empleado y padre  de sus 3 hijos.  Vive en compañía de su pareja y  sus 3 hijos, a quienes quiere  mucho y son su motivación, habitando en una casa alquilada. La actividad que realiza Vivian es la venta de productos de belleza que compra por catálogo y los vende entre sus familiares, amistades y vecinos, a quien atiende de manera amable logrando hacerse conocida.  Esta actividad lo realiza en su propia casa, también lleva los pedidos al domicilio de cada cliente.  
Lleva más de 2 años en ésta actividad, al mismo tiempo vende ropas Se inició en ésta actividad por la recomendación de su pareja, realizando sola.
Considera a sus negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja, con el cual puedo apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar, le gusta socializarse hacer nuevas amistades y así incrementa mas su margen de ganancia. Antes de iniciar con esta actividad tenia muchos problemas económicos, el dinero que ganaba su esposo no le alcanzaba para los gastos del hogar.
 Por otro lado tiene planes de ampliar su negocio e instalar un local amplio en su propia casa para la venta de productos de belleza. Este es el  préstamo número  03  con la institución MFP, por tanto cuenta con su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por tanto se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza por catalogo buscando aumentar su stock de mercaderías disponibles para la venta y ropas de toda variedad y calidad, buscando hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Vivian, age 35, is a very experienced woman when it comes to business, as well as being happy and kind. She lives in a rental house with Anibal, who is employed and father of her 3 children, who she loves very much and are her motivation. Vivian's business is selling beauty products, which she buys via catalog and sells among her friends, family, and neighbors, who she attends to with much care, succeeding in making herself known. She undertakes her work in her own home, and also makes home deliveries to her customers.    

She's been doing this work for more than 2 years, selling clothing at the same time. She got started at the suggestion of her partner, but has done it on her own. She considers her business profitable enough given the good income it brings her, with which she is able to help her partner with household expenses. She enjoys socializing and making new friends as a way of widening her profit margin. Before starting this work, she had a lot of economic troubles, as the money that her husband makes isn't enough to cover household expenses.  

She plans to grow her business and set up a spacious store in her own house to sell her beauty products. This will be her third loan with Microfinanzas Prisma [Kiva field partner], which she counts on to keep making progress on her goals. Given that, she is committed to being punctual with her payments, as she has been with her previous loans. With the requested amount of 1,500 nuevos soles, she plans to invest in more catalog beauty products and increase her stock of available merchandise in clothing of all kinds and quality, thus growing her business.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products.

loans.name: Efren

texts.en:
Efren is a farmer who is raising his family in a rural community. He is 41 years old and has three school-age children. His ambition in life is to improve their standard of living and educate all his children. As a way of gaining income, he cultivates their farm land by planting rice and vegetables for sale. Due to high cost of commodities and school fees, he also engages in hog-raising business to generate additional income. 

He plans to improve the hog-raising business and make it viable source of income. Due to financial difficulty, he is asking for additional capital of PHP 17,000 to buy feed, vitamins, additional piglets, and materials needed to improve the pig pen. He believes that this financial assistance will be a great help for him to improve the business and make it viable in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, additional piglets, and materials needed to improve the pig pen

loans.name: Milka

texts.es:
Milka Paulina, de 24 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa decidida a salir adelante.  Es separada del padre de sus 02 hermosos hijos  a quienes quiere mucho, habitando cómodamente en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Milka Paulina es la venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, la cual compra en la ciudad de Lima realizando viajes periódicos para realizar la compra de su mercadería, para luego venderlo desde su casa y en forma ambulatoria a sus vecinos y amistades, a quienes atiende muy bien, logrando que la recomienden con otras personas que luego se vuelven en sus clientes habituales.
 Realiza éste negocio desde hace 7 años  lo cual lo viene realizando sola.
Considera su negocio bastante rentable pues logra vender todas las ropas que trae y le dejan buenas ganancias. Le gusta su negocio pues le ha generado un oficio, además de conocer muy bien el negocio lo cual le da las facilidades de manejar bien sus ventas logrando vender cantidades considerables al mes y gracias a ello puede dar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
Por eso tiene planes de abrir una tienda  de venta de ropas, para así no tener que caminar mucho buscando clientes. Este es préstamo número 02  con la institución MFP. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal pues considera a sus miembros ser personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de más ropas de diversos modelos a precio por mayor buscando menores precios por su compras al contado y en volumen trayendo desde la capital.
texts.en:
Milka Paulina, who is 24 years old, is a hard-working woman and determined to succeed. She is separated from the father of her two beautiful children, who she loves a lot. She lives comfortably in her own home. The activity performed by Milka Paulina is the sale of clothing for women, men, and children, which she buys in the city of Lima making periodic trips to make the purchase of her merchandise. Then, she sells it from her home and as a street peddler to her neighbors and friends. She attends them very well, so they recommend her to other people who later become regular customers.

She has worked in this business for seven years, doing it alone. She states her business is quite profitable because she manages to sell all the clothes she brings, achieving great profits. She likes her business because it became her job and also let her know the business very well. That gives her facilities to manage her sales achieving a significant quantity of monthly sales. As a result, she can give a better quality of life to her children. 

For this reason, she has plans about opening a shop selling clothes, so she doesn't have to walk a lot looking for customers. This is her loan number two with the MFP institution. She expects some collaboration, so she can make her plans concrete. Also, she says she feels very good with her communal bank because she considers its members responsible and supportive people. 

With the requested amount of 1,000 nuevos soles, she will invest in the purchase of more clothes of various designs at a wholesale price. She is looking for lower prices due to her purchases in cash and in volume from the capital.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Mshikamano Group

texts.en:
Maulid, who is in his early 20s, is married with a baby. He has been a fruit vendor for five years now. He is doing great with his family. He works from 5am to 10pm daily and he is able to make a good monthly profit.

He requests a 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to purchase more fruits, a plot on which he expects to build his own house, a TV, a radio, a sabufa (kind of music system), and paid household expenses. He has paid back all his loans successfully.  He hopes for a loan to buy more fruit to resell. His dream is to one day be able to build his own nice house on the purchased plot.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Mshikamano" which totals 12 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to resell.

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Swine-raising is nothing new to Armando because he had runs this type of business for more than 30 years. He started raising swine at very young age. He and his wife Veronica work together to increase the income they generate from their swine raising and retail store business. The couple was blessed with five children. Two of them are married; two are working, and the youngest is still studying. Armando hopes to let his youngest child finish his studies so he can find better opportunities someday.

Armando always makes sure that their swine raising business is free from any diseases so that the swine maintain their good health and minimize his expenses in buying vaccines. He plans to make his raised swine healthier upon reaching their optimum growth but he struggles for shortage of capital. He requests a loan of PHP 30,000 allowing him to buy necessary feed, vitamins, and vaccines for his livestock business. He knows that this amount of loan would make his dream possible.

loans.use: to buy necessary feed, vitamins, and vaccines for his livestock business

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a widower with four grown children who are settled in marriage and living separately from her.

Delia owns a home-based retail store where she offers different kinds of merchandise within her local community. For the six years she has been running her home-based retail store, she has been able to increase her sales and profits. Gained profits go to her daily needs, allowances for her grandchildren and monthly electric bill. Delia also offers rice, vegetables and charcoal because it is marketable within her local community. Delia is thankful to lenders because her previous loan had a great impact in making her retail store grow.

Delia would like to have continuous growth of her home-based retail store, so she requests a loan of PHP 50,000, allowing her to purchase volumes of merchandise. She knows that through re-stocking her retail store she can continue to obtain greater income, which will enable her to improve her living conditions, help with her grandchildren's education and save for her emergency purposes when she gets weak.

loans.use: to purchase  merchandise for her retail store

loans.name: Candida Gloria

texts.es:
Candida tiene 61 años de edad, tiene seis hijos, de los cuales solo dos mujeres viven con ella. Desde hace un año que instalo una tienda en su casa y lo hizo por iniciativa propia. Los productos que necesita los compra en un supermercado que esta a tres kilómetros de su casa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar más mercadería y aumentar el inventario que posee satisfaciendo la demanda de sus clientes. Con la inversión podrá tener dinero suficiente para trasladarse a la ciudad para comprar los productos a un mejor precio. Ella pretende aumentar su negocio cada día más.
texts.en:
Candida is 61 years old and has six children, of whom just two women live with her. A year ago she set up a store in her house, and she did it on her own initiative. She buys the products that she needs in a supermarket that is three kilometers from her house. 

The loan that she is requesting from Fundación Campo is to purchase more merchandise and increase the inventory that she has, satisfying her customers’ demand. With the investment, she will be able to have enough money to go to the city to buy products at a better price. She aspires to expand her business more each day.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise and increase the inventory that she possesses, satisfying the demand of her customers.

loans.name: Jiungeni Group

texts.en:
Burton, who was born in 1979, is married with three children who are in school. He has been a motorcycle driver (bodaboda - taking passengers to different places around town) and he has also owned a motorcycle spares shop for one year now.  He works from 6am to 8pm daily and he is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be his first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which he wants to use to buy motorcycle spares parts to resell. His dream is to one day be able to build his own nice house.  

He will share this loan with his loan group "Jiungeni," which has 10 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy  motorcycle spares parts  to resell.

loans.name: Dilshod

texts.en:
Dilshod is a hardworking person who is married and has 2 children. He has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 6 month. Thanks to the animals' good condition, he has managed to win a large quantity of customers for his business. He sells his animals in the local market and has many customers. 

Dilshod is looking for a loan to buy young cattle. Each month he will make his payments on time. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Marco

texts.es:
Marco de 46 años de edad, es un hombre   trabajador  y empeñoso, además de muy jovial y sociable, con muchas ganas de progresar. Es soltero sin hijos. Vive solo, habitando cómodamente en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Marco Antonio es una copiadora  para eso cuenta con un local alquilado lo cual esta instalada en el interior de un colegio, desde donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes que en su mayoría son los estudiantes.  Iniciándose hace 08 meses  con un capital propio viendo la necesidad de contar con un ingreso económico para sustentarse, ésta actividad lo realiza solo  en la atención a sus clientes.
Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Le gusta su negocio pues le permite estar en la comodidad, así como el tiempo libre que lo puede emplear en otras actividades , le gusta mucho ser sociable , igualmente los ingresos económicos que le genera los cuales usa en los gastos de su hogar. Por otro lado, lo que no le gusta es que a veces tiene que estar parado todo el día. Tienen planes de implementar más su negocio y así seguir creciendo y generar más ingresos económicos y tener su propio local. Este es el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP. Por ello cuenta con su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por tanto se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en el crédito anterior.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, ya que lo invirtió en la compra de una maquina copiadora valorizada en S/ 1200 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Marco is 46 years old, a hardworking and dedicated person. Moreover, he is very cheerful and sociable, eager to get ahead. He is single without children. He lives alone and comfortably in his own home.

Antony has a copy shop, for this, he has a rented room which is located on the inside of a school, where he very kindly attends to customers who are mostly students. Began eight months ago with his own capital seeing the need for an income to support himself.

He considers that he has a profitable business because of the good profits he makes. He likes his business because it allows him to be in comfort, as well as the free time that he can use in other activities. He likes the business because he can interacts with other people, also the income that generates which he uses to cover the expenses of his home.

On the other hand, what he doesn't  like is that sometimes he has to stand all day. He has plans to continue growing the business and generate more income and have his own building. This is his second loans with the institution MFP. For this new loan, he relies on your collaboration so that he could achieve his plans. Therefore he promises to punctually make his payments as he did with the previous loan. With the requested total of 1000 new suns, he will buy a photocopier machine valued in 1,200 of new soles (peruvian currency).

loans.use: to buy a photocopier machine.

loans.name: Khoeurn

texts.en:
Khoeurn is a rice farmer who lives in Prey Chor district with his four single children while another one is living away. He is 52 years old and a widower. In fact, Khoeurn is a father of seven children, but unfortunately only five children are till alive. Being a hard-working father, Khoeurn works tirelessly at his rice field to make his main income for bringing up and educating his four school-aged children. He has been in this occupation for almost 30 years and gets help from some of his children.

Khoeurn used his previous loan from Kiva lenders to rebuild his house for his family members. Now he is asking for another loan for the purpose of purchasing a motorcycle for home use. Khoeurn hopes that he can satisfy the needs of his family and improve his living conditions gradually through loans of generosity. He is very thankful and promises to pay it pack punctually as scheduled.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for home use.

loans.name: Rehmat

texts.en:
Ms. Rehmat is a dedicated mother of two children. She is efficiently doing a business of selling milk and has done this for many years. She earns a good profit from this business. 

As she wants to enhance her business, she has requested for a microloan of PKR 20,000 to buy a new buffalo. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She has shown excellent repayment behavior. Both of her kids are going to school, and she wants them to get higher education, that is why she is helping her husband by doing this work at home so that their household income increases. 

She is a very hard working woman and always ready to support her husband and family. The woman in the red shawl is her mother, who helps her in the business.

loans.use: to buy a new buffalo.

loans.name: An

texts.en:
An is a hardworking mother from Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She is 32 years old and married with a young child. Aside from helping her husband with their farming business, she also raises piglets for fattening to sell in times of need. And it has become a main supplementary business for her family. She has been raising pigs for about two years. With her experience in this field, An hopes to improve her business gradually and she intends to expand her pig farm someday if she can afford to do it. She mentioned that the significant thing in this growth is based on finance.

As of now, An would like to maintain her hog raising business; that is why she decided to borrow additional capital of 500 USD to buy additional piglets to raise, along with food and vitamins for sustainability. She believes that this investment will return her a good income in the near future.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise, along with food and vitamins for sustainability.

loans.name: Santos Erasmo

texts.es:
El señor Erasmo es una persona de 33 años de edad vive junto con su esposa y sus dos hijos. se dedica a la agricultura desde su niñez, aprendió este oficio de su padre quien fue su ejemplo a seguir ya que trabajando muy duro la agricultura él pudo mantener a toda su familia. Por eso, Erasmo trabaja muy duro también para poder salir adelante con su familia y con todos los gastos del hogar y a podido notar que si se esfuerza mucho al final tiene su recompensa con el trabajo que realiza a podido hacer realidad muchos proyectos en su casa y con su familia pero por el costo de la vida; hoy en día siente que los ingresos ya no son los mismos y por eso desea adquirir crédito  para cultivar mas tierras y obtener mas ingresos al vender la producción. 
 Don Erasmo, compra los insumos que necesita para sus cultivos en la ciudad mas cercana a unos  3 kilómetros  de su casa; pero como no hay transporte publico tiene que cancelar a un vehículo que se los traslade o de lo contrario tiene que trasladarlo en su espalda desde la tienda hasta su casa y esto le produce un desgaste extra.
 El crédito será invertido en la compra de abonos, venenos e insecticidas para poder aplicárselos a sus cultivos de maíz y fríjol a tiempo, para tener una excelente cosecha.
 La principal necesidad que será satisfecha es que podrá comprar todos los insumos por junto y así obtener un mejor precio, tener un ahorro en la compra y en la aplicación a los cultivos será en el tiempo justo que lo necesiten.
 Su vida mejorara grandemente ya que con la compra de todos los insumos y al aplicarlos a tiempo en sus cultivos la producción será muy buena y a la hora de venderla le generara más ingresos.
 En el futuro desea poder ver realizado su sueño de tener un cultivo muy prospero y abundante teniendo la fe en DIOS y con la ayuda de el crédito para poder comprar los insumos que el necesita para aplicar a sus cultivos, también desea que sus hijos sean personas de bien para la comunidad y que aprendan un buen oficio para poder desempeñarse en el futuro.
texts.en:
Erasmo is 33 years old and lives with his wife and his two children.  He has worked in agriculture since his childhood.  He learned this trade from his father, who was his example to continue, since by working very hard in agriculture he could sustain his family.  Because of this, Erasmo works very hard to get ahead with his family and with all of the household expenses.  He has been able to note that if he gives a lot of effort, in the end he has his reward.  With his work he has been able to make many projects in his house, and with his family, a reality. But, with the cost of living these days he feels that his income isn't the same now and because of this he wishes to acquire a loan to be able to cultivate more land and obtain a higher income upon selling his output.

Don Erasmo buys the inputs he needs for his plants in the closest city, 3 kilometers from his house.  But, as there is no public transportation he has to pay for a carrier that moves it or, on the contrary, he has to move on his back from the store to his house and this produces extra wear.

The loan will be invested to buy fertilizers, poisons and insecticides to be able to apply them to his corn and bean plants on time, to have an excellent harvest.
 
The first necessity that will be satisfied is that he will be able to buy all of the inputs together and thus obtain a better price, have savings in the sale, and the application to the plants will be just in the time that they need them.

His life will improve greatly, since upon buying all of the inputs and applying them on time to his plants, the production will be very good and when it's time to sell them more income will be generated.

In the future he wants to be able to carry out his dream to have a prosperous and abundant harvest, having faith in God, and with the help of the loan to be able to buy the inputs that he needs to apply them to his plants. He also wants his children to be good people in the community and learn a good trade to be able to carry out in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, poisons and insecticides to be able to apply them to his corn an bean plants on time.

loans.name: Eustequia

texts.en:
Eustequia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

NWTF is relisting Eustequia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara lives in Shahumyan village, Ararat region, with her husband, son and daughter. Because of the high rate of unemplyment in the region, Tamara's husband has left abroad to work and sustain his family. Her son serves in the army at present. 

To help her husband to make ends meet, Tamara runs a farm, where she cultivates wheat, grows fruit trees and keeps a grape orchard. In order to earn more income from agriculture, Tamara plans to purchase calves and start cattle breeding. With the loan help she will buy three calves. Tamara also wants to purchase wheat to feed the cattle, as the wheat she cultivates is not enough for it. This loan will also help her to purchase wires for the grape orchard. 

Tamara is full of hope that she will significally increase income from agriculture after starting cattle breeding. This is important for her to cover the family's costs and live a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for three calves, wheat, and wires for her grape orchard.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena is a dedicated mother of three children. She is efficiently doing a business of running a shop and sells daily use grocery items. 

She has three children and is keen to play her part in providing basic necessities for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she has requested a microloan of PKR 40,000 to buy new stock from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her 5th loan cycle with good credit history. She earns a good profit from this business.

loans.use: to buy new stock from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Ms. Nusrat is 34 years old and a vigorous, married woman. She has had a business doing hand embroidery for the past 10 years. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. 

Her husband is employed as a teacher in a private school, but he does not earn enough to support his family well. Nusrat's embroidery patterns are very popular in her area, and she is the best earning resource in her household. 

She is a mother of six children. She wants to grow her business. She requested a loan of 15,000 Pakistan rupees (Rs) to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. 

She shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her area. She would teach embroidery skills, so they can help her expand her business and also earn money for themselves. She is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Ms Zainab is a married woman and she has been successfully running a small grocery store in her community. She sells various goods for daily use. She has rich experience and good customer handling skills; which is why she is doing this business effectively. 

She is a mother of four children, who are going to school. She is motivated to provide basic necessities for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she has requested for a micro-loan of PKR 25,000 to buy new stock from the market at lower rates. She, then, would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently.

loans.use: to buy new stock from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Bindu

texts.en:
Bindu is 42 years old and lives in the Kakata town area. She is married and has four children aged one to 21. All of whom live at home and are presently in school. 

For the past three years she has been involved in the sales of drinks, water, and other items. She is a requesting loan to purchase more alcoholic drinks, water and other items for her business. The problem she’s faced with is the rainy season. She started this business by helping her mother selling. She makes a lot of profit, and she has more customers every day. It makes her proud to have money in her home every day. She hopes to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more alcoholic drinks, water, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Jusu B.

texts.en:
Jusu is 47 years old and lives in Kakata. He is married, and his wife sells clothes in the market. They have seven children, ages 2 to 18, who live at home and attend school.

For the past 15 years, he has been operating a shop where he sells many items like poplin cotton fabric, cloth, floor mats, etc. He makes a lot of profit and intends to make his business bigger. He is requesting a loan to purchase more goods (poplin cotton fabric, cloth, floor mats, etc.) for his business. He hopes to buy a bus in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more goods (poplin cotton fabric, cloth, floor mats, etc.) for his business.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Ms. Surriya is a married woman and mother of five kids who are all school-going. She is in the business of cloth and bangle selling and is doing it successfully. When she wanted to expand her business, she faced financial problems but she didn’t lose hope and contacted Kashf Foundation upon the advice of her neighbor to initiate her own business. She buys clothes and bangles of different designs from the market in bulk at lower rates and sells them in her community. Most of her clients are her neighbors.
