She has gradually improved her business, and now she requested a loan of 30,000 Pakistan rupees. She is going to use this loan to buy an ample variety of clothes and bangles in a larger quantity to add to her current ones. She intends to use the earned profits on her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy an ample variety of clothes and bangles in a larger quantity to add to her current ones.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is a hardworking entrepreneur with a business of making fishing boats in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy hardwood, nails, paint and other supplies needed for making fishing boats. Ma. Theresa has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income from sales in her timber business.

Ma. Theresa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy hardwood, nails, paint and other supplies to make a fishing boat

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 30-year-old farmer in the Nkubu area in Kenya. She lives with her husband and four of her children, of which three are in school. She has been in farming for five years producing milk, which she sells to the people around her local area. She also runs a retail shop as an additional source of income.

Elizabeth is requesting 50,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry that will bring her extra income to help in educating her children. She believes she will grow to open her own wholesale shop in the future.

Pests and diseases are the main challenges she faces in farming.

Elizabeth thanks Juhudi Kilimo because she believes it has helped her to be where she is today.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Ms Parveen is a 29 year old lady, separated from her husband. She has been successfully running a small beauty parlor in her community for the last 10 years. She offers various beauty goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. 

She is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she has requested a loan of PKR 30000 to buy stocks of cosmetics. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her third loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of her revenue for personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of cosmetics, lotions, make-up kits, hair colors etc.

loans.name: Al-Sonds Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Sonds, which consists of five ladies who live in Hadramout, Yemen. Zhra is a 42-year-old married woman with four children who live in Hadramout. She started a business selling fruits and vegetables to help support her children and herself. 

Now she is working on expanding her business by bringing in additional kinds of fruits, vegetables and other foods from the market. That is why she has applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB.

loans.use: to buy additional kinds of fruits and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora, de 48 años de edad, es una mujer  trabajadora  y empeñosa, además de muy jovial y sociable, con muchas ganas de progresar, es madre soltera. Vive en compañía de su sobrino de 12 años de edad a quien quiere mucho. Habitando cómodamente en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Dora es la venta de abarrotes de primera necesidad para eso cuenta con un bodega instalada en su propia casa, desde donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes, iniciándose hace mas de 01 año con un capital propio, viendo la necesidad de contar con un ingreso, esta actividad lo realiza sola  en la atención a sus clientes.
Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Le gusta su negocio pues le permite estar en la comodidad de su casa, atender a su hija ,así como el tiempo libre que lo puede emplear en otras actividades, igualmente los ingresos económicos que le genera los cuales usa en los gastos de su hogar. Por otro lado, lo que no le gusta es que algunos de sus clientes le solicitan créditos por sus compras a lo que ella se niega pues ya tuvo malas experiencias con este tipo de compra, por lo que todas sus ventas son al contando, y puede ver más rápidos sus ganancia.
Tienen planes de implementar más su negocio y así seguir creciendo y generar más ingresos económicos. Este es el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por tanto se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de abarrotes a precio por mayor para así tener mayores márgenes de ganancias.
texts.en:
Dora is 48 years old. She is a hardworking and earnest woman- and additionally very cheerful and sociable- who greatly hopes to progress. She lives with her 12 year old nephew who she loves very much.  She is living comfortably in her own house. Dora works selling basic grocery items. To do this, she relies on a small store set up in her own house, from which she very graciously serves her customers. She started it more than 10 years ago with her own capital, seeing the necessity of having an income to count on. She does this work of customer service alone.

She considers her business to be profitable because of the excellent earnings that it provides her.

She enjoys her business because it allows her to be in the comfort of her home taking care of her daughter, as well as having free time that she can spend on other activities just as much as the economic revenue generated, which she uses for her household expenses. On the other hand, what she doesn’t like is that some of her customers request credit for their purchases, which she refuses, as she has already had bad experiences with this type of purchase. Because of this, all of her sales are in cash, and she can see her earnings faster. 

She has plans to expand her business more, and therefore continue growing and generating more economic revenue. This is her second loan with the MFP organization; because of it she hopes for their collaboration so that she will be able to fulfill her plans. Therefore, she is committed to complying with the payment of her installments.  

With the requested loan of 1000 nuevos soles, she will invest it in the purchase of wholesale groceries, in order to have a greater margin of earnings.

loans.use: to purchase products in bulk.

loans.name: Ocsy

texts.en:
Ocsy is a 49 year old man and is married to Farah, a 46 year old lady. In their marriage, they are blessed with four children: Kasmawati, 24 years old and attending college; Tino, 18 years old and graduated from high school; Medeline, 12 years old, is in the sixth grade of elementary school; and Cledine, seven, is in the second grade of elementary school. 

Ocsy owns a public minivan business. The income from the business really helps Ocsy in covering his family's living expenses and the school fees of his children. Last week, he bought another second-hand minivan at a low price, to generate more income for the family. Unfortunately the car's engine was broken and had to be repaired. He is requesting a IDR 10,000,000 loan from TLM to buy new spare parts to fix the engine.

loans.use: to purchase new spare parts for a car engine.

loans.name: Seyran

texts.en:
Seyran is involved in cattle breeding and agriculture. He raises cows and lambing ewes. Currently he keeps three cows and 15 lambing ewes. Seyran also cultivates wheat. Seyran would like to add more lambing ewes to his farm, for which he has applied for this loan. With the requested amount he plans to purchase 15 lambing ewes. This will allow Seyran to gather more milk and make more cheese from it. Seyran will earn additional income, which he plans to invest in the further expansion of his farm. 

Seyran lives with his parents and brother. He dreams of starting his own family and sustain it with prosperous life. Development of agriculture will allow  Seyran to earn sufficient income and make his dream come true.

loans.use: to pay for 10 lambing ewes.

loans.name: Xuyen's Group

texts.en:
Xuyen was born in 1987. She has one child who is little and is learning in kindergarten. Her husband is an exported laborer. Huong cooks traditional foods for a living. She earns 3,500,000 VND a month from this business. Her family’s total earnings are about 7,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2012. In this first loan cycle, she would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy tables, chairs, cooking utensils and cooking ingredients to open a small breakfast food stall in the market to increase her family’s income. Her dream is for her children to go to school until they have a higher education.

Other members who are part of Xuyen's Group include the following:

Tom, 56 years old, has three children. She sells cooked food for a living. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to maintain her food stall in the market. 

Dung, who is 46 years old, has two children. She runs a grocery store for a living. She wants to borrow 7,630,000 VND to buy more rice, noodles and canned food for her store.

Thao is 53 years old. She has two children. She raises chickens for a living. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to raise more chickens.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, cooking utensils and cooking ingredients

loans.name: Khachik

texts.en: Khachik lives in Vayk town in the Vayots Dzor region with his father and brother. Khachik works as a driver, but his salary is too low to meet their needs. So Khachik also helps his family with beekeeping. Currently, they keep 15 colonies of bees. Khachik would like to increase the number of bee colonies in order to gather more honey. Khachik hopes to earn additional income form the honey sales, which will help him to improve living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy colonies of bees

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 32-year-old married man and father of one child. He has owned a bookshop since July 2010. Hassan is working hard to improve his business and to improve his family's living conditions.

This is his second loan as an Al Majmoua borrower. His previous loan helped a lot in improving his business income. He is applying for a loan from Al Majmoua to buy school bags and newly released stationary items, especially since we are in the back-to-school season and he must have attractive items to fulfill customers' needs.

Hassan hopes to keep on expanding and improving his business.

loans.use: to buy school bags and stationary items

loans.name: Gulandom

texts.ru: Гуландому 27 лет.  Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Ее муж Насимджон получает маленькую зарплату. Это зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами. Гуландом  решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она хочет организовать бизнес шитьем женской одежды, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 600 сомони для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Gulandom is 27 years old, married, and has 2 children.  Her husband, Nasimjon, makes little money: his salary is not enough to provide his family with all the necessities of life.

For the well-being of her family, Gulandom has decided to help her husband and has enrolled in a course entitled "Achieving success" organized by the Business Women's Association.  She has obtained a certificate.

Since Gulandom is an experienced seamstress, she would like to start a sewing business and make women's clothing. 

She is requesting a loan of 600 somoni to buy the equipment necessary to start her new business.  She is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine to start a new business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal FUENTE DE VIDA, él banco se encuentra situado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia tiene 66 años de edad, 07 hijos y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio  de venta de carne, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone a su negocio cada día, la socia vende su mercadería al por mayor a sus clientes que le solicitan como mercados y emporios, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de mas carne al por mayor.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member is part of the Communal Bank “Fuente de Vida” (Fountain of Life) which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco. She is 66 years old, married, and has seven children. The member divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling meat. She has been in business for a long time and has done well thanks to the effort she puts into her work each day. She sells her products wholesale to her customers, including markets and emporiums that request them. The member is a responsible and industrious person who works so that her family can move forward.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more meat at wholesale. The member is grateful for the loan that has been granted and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy more meat at wholesale.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Шахнозе 23 года. Она разведена и на воспитании имеет одного ребенка. Она с детства была любительницей тортов и булочек и всегда мечтала иметь собственную кондитерскую.  Теперь пришло время реализовать ее детскую мечту. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере, но не имеет средства, чтобы купить продукты как муку, сахар и т.п. для того чтобы печь кондитерские изделия и продать. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  2000 сомони для покупки продуктовых товаров, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Shahnoza is 23 years old, divorced, and is raising one child.  

She has loved cakes and pastries since childhood and has always dreamed about opening her own pastry shop. Now she may see her dream come true. 

Shahnoza has earned a certificate from a course she has attended, entitled "Achieving Success" and organized by the Business Women's Association.  

Now she can start her business for good and become a successful entrepreneur.  However, she does not have the means to buy supplies such as flour, sugar etc. to begin making pastries and sell them.  

She is requesting a loan of 2,000 somoni to buy the necessary supplies to start her new business.  

Shahnoza is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy flour and sugar to start a new business.

loans.name: Indatwa Group

texts.fr:
Claudine fait partie du groupe Indatwa  et  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle a 32 ans et est mariée à Emmanuel,  un agriculteur. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants, âgés de 4 à 16 ans dont 5 étudient.

Elle est  commerçante de produits vivriers (patates douces, manioc, haricot) depuis  12 ans. 

C’est son premier crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et introduire le commerce de farine de maïs en achetant 2 sacs  à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait acheter une machine à coudre et une parcelle.
texts.en:
Claudine is a member of the Indatwa group and lives in Bujumbura. She is 32 years old and married to Emmanuel, a farmer. Together, they have 6 children aged 4 to 16, 5 of whom attend school. 

For the past 12 years, she has been involved in the commercial activity of a variety of food products (sweet potatoes, manioc, beans). 

This is the first loan she is asking for from Turame. She will use this loan to add the buying/selling of maize flour to her activity, through the purchase of two bags of flour. 

In the future, she hopes to purchase a sewing machine and a plot of land.

loans.use: increase her capital and introduce commercial activity of maize flour by purchasing two bags to re-sell

loans.name: Mansata's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de 16 femmes très actives dans ce banc villageois créé 11 juillet 2008. Elles sont toutes issues du même village et ont une bonne entente entre elles. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Mansata (assise à l’extrême droite dans la photo) est l'emprunteuse vedette du groupe,  âgée de 53ans, elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants (06 garçons 01 fille). son activité consiste à l'achat de produits alimentaires et autres de consommation courante pour la revente en détail dans le village. Elle a 4 années d’expérience dans ce domaine.

Elle achète et revend du savon, de l’huile et du thé qu’elle revend dans son village et les villages environs. 
-	Elle achète 01 cartons de savon et un sac de sucre pour le  revendre en détail.

Les bénéfices de son activité lui permettront d’acheter de la nourriture et d'assurer la prise en charge sanitaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group is composed of 16 women, who are very active in the banc villageois created on July 11, 2008. They are all from the same village and share a good rapport. Their primary business is small-scale commerce. 

Mansata (seated on the far right in the photo) is the featured borrower of this group. 53 years old, she is married and a mother to 7 children (6 boys and 1 girl). 

Her business consists of buying food products and consumer goods to resell a retail basis in the village. She has four years experience in this area. She buys and resells soap, oil, and tea in the village and surrounds. [With this loan], she will buy a carton of soap and a sac of sugar to resell. Income from this business will allow her to buy food and take care of her children.

loans.use: to buy a carton of soap and a sac of sugar to sell on a retail basis

loans.name: Nyambere Group

texts.fr:
Gisèle fait partie du groupe Nyambere et  habite à  Gitega. C’est une veuve de 62 ans .Elle a  un  seul enfant de 30 ans. 

Elle est  commerçante de  bananes depuis  7 ans. 

Elle est à son douzième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bananes à revendre  pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait acheter un terrain cultivable pour son enfant.
texts.en: Gisèle is a member of the Nyambere group and lives in Gitega. She is a 62 year old widow with one child now aged 30 years old. She has been involved in the commercial activity of bananas for the past 7 years. She is asking for her twelfth loan from Turame, which she will use to purchase a large quantity of bananas to re-sell. In the future, Gisèle hopes to purchase a plot of land for her child to use for agricultural purposes.

loans.use: purchase a large quantity of bananas to re-sell

loans.name: Ndiare Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois de ndiaré est créé le 30 décembre 2009. Le groupe est constitué de 19 membres qui habitent ensemble et entretiennent de bonnes relations. 

Maguette, la présidente de ce groupe, est une femme mariée de 26 ans et mère de 03 enfants dont 02 garçons. Elle fait du petit commerce des ustensiles de cuisine. Elle achète ses marchandises au marché hebdomadaire de sa localité et revend dans le village.Sur la photo elle est tout à fait droite en bleu-rose.

Avec son prêt elle prévoie d'acheter une valeur de 100000f d'ustensiles et avec le reste de son argent elle va acheter un mouton pour préparer les fêtes de tabaski.

Avec ces bénéfices elle voudrait augmenter ces épargnes afin d'augmenter son prêt.Elle subvient aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The village lending group Ndiaré was created on December 30, 2009. The group is made up of 19 members who live together and maintain good relations.

Maguette, the group's president, is a 26 year old married woman and mother of three children, two of whom are boys. She does business selling kitchen utensils. She buys her merchandise at the weekly market in her area and resells in the village. In the photo, she is at the far right in blue and pink.

With this loan she foresees buying 100,000 CFA francs worth of utensils and with the remainder of the money she is going to buy a sheep to prepare for  Eid al-Adha, an important Muslim holiday. With the profits she would like to increase her savings in order to increase her loan. She provides for her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils and one sheep.

loans.name: Nelly Emerita

texts.es:
Nelly tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Se dedica a la agricultura desde los 10 años de edad; su papá fue quien le enseño, ya que las llevaba a trabajar junto con él. Hoy en día ella trabaja junto con su esposo, además posee una pequeña granja de pollos desde hace 10 meses. Ella se levanta muy temprano para preparar el desayuno a su esposo y a sus hijos. Luego sus hijos se van para la escuela y ella queda atendiendo a sus pollos, más tarde se traslada a ayudar a su esposo con la agricultura. Posteriormente regresa a casa a preparar el almuerzo y a atender nuevamente a sus pollos. Los productos que necesita los adquiere en la ciudad, para llegar hasta ahí camina a pie desde su casa durante unos quince minutos, para abordar un vehiculo hasta llegar a la carretera litoral, a abordar un autobús que tarda una hora y media de camino y en vehiculo una hora. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 3 sacos de abono para sembrar maicillo y dos quintales de concentrado para la granja. Al efectuar la inversión, ella podrá sembrar en buena época, para que su cosecha sea productiva y pueda obtener muy buenas ganancias. Con sus ganancias ella desea brindarles a sus hijos la educación para que se conviertan en unos profesionales y personas de bien para la sociedad.
texts.en:
Nelly is 34 years old, is married and has four children. She is engaged in agriculture since she was ten years old. Her father taught her, because he took her to work with him. Today, she works with her husband, and she additionally has a small chicken farm for ten months. She gets up very early to prepare breakfast for her husband and children. Later, her children go to school and she takes care of her chickens. After that, she goes to help her husband with farming. Later, she returns home to prepare lunch and take care of her chicken again. 

She acquires the products she needs in the city. To arrive there, she walks from her home for about 15 minutes to take a vehicle to the coastal road, where she takes a bus for one hour and a half or a vehicle for one hour. 

The loan she is requesting to Fundación Campo is to buy three bags of fertilizer to plant sorghum and two quintals of concentrate for the farm. Because of the investment, she will be able to plant in good time, so her harvest will be productive and she will obtain good profits. With her earnings, she wants to provide education to her children so they can become professionals and good people for the society.

loans.use: to buy three bags of fertilizer to plant sorghum and two quintals of concentrate for the farm.

loans.name: Laïdou Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Laïdou, sont toutes des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne de 29 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, Région de Koulikoro.
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de parfums, de condiments, des habillements et du lait.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Laïdou sont à leur dixième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des céréales, des ingrédients pour le parfum, des condiments, des habillements et du lait.                                                                                                                                                                                               
ADA, deuxième personne à partir de la droite, compte acheter, 3 sacs de riz avec les grossistes de Niono, 4 sacs d’oignons secs et 5 Kg de sel de cuisine  avec les grossistes de Bamako pour ensuite les vendre sur place en détail, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour les besoins de la famille et une partie est réinvestie dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The women belonging to the Laïdou group are all married women, who average 29 years of age, have on average four children each and live in extended traditional families in the town of Fana in the Koulikoro region. They got to know each other through relatives, neighbors and friends. They trade in cereals, perfumes, condiments, clothing and milk. 

The women in the Laïdou group are on their tenth group loan, which will be used to buy cereals, ingredients for making perfume, condiments, clothing and milk.

Ada, the second person from the right of the photo, is planning to buy three sacks of rice from wholesalers in Niono, four bags of dried onions and five kilos of table salt from wholesalers in Bamako, so that she can then resell them locally on a retail basis to a customer base made up of women and men. She expects to make an average monthy profit of 40,000FCFA which will be used for family needs; part will also be reinvested in her trading activity.

loans.use: to buy a variety of items.

loans.name: Mariama Mina's Group

texts.fr:
Membres fondateurs du banc villageois, ces deux femmes sont des exemples que beaucoup de femmes dans ce groupement aimeraient copier. Elles n’ont cessé d’accroître leurs activités et de croire à la fiabilité du système. Commerçantes très expérimentées elles ont eu à bénéficier de tous les produits qu’offre l’institution.

Madame Mariama  (debout avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 49 ans, elle est  mariée et mère de 06 enfants (03 garçons et 03 filles). Elle fait de la restauration activité qu’elle mène depuis plus d’une décennie, elle emploie quelques personnes comme aide dans la gestion du restaurant. parallèlement, comme activité secondaire, elle vend de la crème glacée dans son quartier

Ce nouveau lui permettra d’approvisionner en quantité en sac de riz à 15 000 FCFA le sac en huile  pour 10 bidons de 20 litres et des condiments cependant les légumes seront achetés au jour le jour suivant le plat du jour. 

Avec les bénéfices tires de cette activité elle compte construire une maison pour mieux assurer la suivie scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
These two women are founding members of the local Banc Villageois, and they have set an example that many would like to follow. They have worked steadily at expanding their activities and never stopped believing in the system. They are highly experienced merchants who have availed themselves of all that the MFI has to offer.

Mrs. Mariama (with her hand raised in the photo), is the featured member for the group. She is 49 years old and married with six children, three boys and three girls. She has been running a restaurant for over 10 years, and she has a few employees to help her manage the business. As a side business, she sells ice cream in her neighborhood. 

This new loan will help her to stock up on rice at 15,000 FCFA per bag. She will also buy ten 20-liter jugs of oil, and some condiments. She buys her vegetables on a day-to-day basis depending on the daily special.   

She will use her profits to build a house to better  help her children pursue their studies.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil and condiments for her restaurant.

loans.name: Sinsindagbe Group

texts.fr: SINSINDAGBE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Raïmath (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 36 ans et est mariée à un certain Raoufou. Le couple a deux enfants dont un scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Raïmath vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges des enfants. Raïmath n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a quelques années que Raïmath mène comme activité la vente des condiments à son domicile. Raïmath exerce cette activité passionnément, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Raïmath s'approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Raïmath sollicite un quatrième crédit avec les autres membres du groupe SINSINDAGBE. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits. Les crédits précédemment reçus ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
SINSINDAGBE is a group made up of three members who live in the same neighborhood. 

The group's representative, Raïmath, is the one raising her hand in the photo. She is a 36 years old and married to a man named Raoufou. Raïmath and Raoufou have two children, one of whom goes to school.  Both their children are their dependents.  Raïmath lives with her husband and children and shares with her husband the various expenses associated with raising their children.   

Raïmath never attended school.  For the past few years,  she has been selling condiments from her home.  She is passionate about her work, which allows her to meet her needs as well as those of her children. She buys her goods in a town located in Benin.

To ensure the satisfaction of her customers,  Raïmath is requesting a fourth loan, along with the other members of the SINSINDAGBE group. This loan will help them to better meet their customers' expectations and to increase their profits.  Previous loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Marie Therese

texts.fr: Marie Therese est une femme de 40 mère de famille. Elle exerce une activité de commerce en détail où elle vend des vivres frais et secs (elle tranforme le manioc et le maïs en farine ) dans un marché de la place . Elle aimerait augmneter son stock de marchandises(filet de  mais et des sacs de maniocs)  en grande quantité, ça lui évitera les ruptures de stocks qu'elle a tout le temps. ce crédit lui permettra non seulement de satisfaire sa clientèle déjà grandissante, mais aussi d'augmenter ses bénéfices. Bénéfices qui lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille nombreuse dont elle a la charge et avec le temps, d'agrandir son fond de commerce
texts.en:
Marie Therese is a 40-year-old woman with children. She runs a retail business selling fresh and dried foods (she processes cassava root and maize into flour) at a local market. She would like to substantially increase her stock of supplies (sacks of maize and cassava root) to avoid the recurring shortages that she has been experiencing. 

This loan will allow her not only to meet the needs of a growing customer base, but also to bolster her profits. These profits will help her to provide for her large family, which she supports. In the long term, she will also expand her business.

loans.use: to increase her stock of supplies (sacks of maize and cassava root).

loans.name: Aissatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de solidarité faisant partie du Banc Villageois de Ngokol a été crée le 13 décembre 2008. Il est composé de membres habitant la même localité et exerçant toutes la même activité qu'est le petit commerce de détail. 

Assise à droite de la photo, Aïssatou la vedette est âgée de 55 ans. Elle est veuve et mère 08 enfants dont 06 filles et 02 garçons. 

Avec son prêt reçu, elle achète du poisson à 5000 frs le panier et du mil à 150 frs le kg et va revendre à 7500 frs en détail le panier et à 250 frs le kg de mil dans sa ville. 

Avec les bénéfices générés par son activité, elle renforce l'activité avec une partie et l'autre améliore les conditions de vie de sa progéniture.
texts.en:
This solidarity group, which is part of the "banc villageois" Ngokol, was created on December 13, 2008. It consists of members living in the same region and all practicing the same business which is retail shopkeeping. 

Sitting to the right in the photo, Aïssatou is the featured borrower and is 55 years old. She is a widow and mother to 8 children of whom 6 are girls and 2 are boys.

With the loan she received, she is buying fish at 5,000 frs per basket and mil [African cereal] at 150 frs per kg. She is going to resell retail for 7,500 frs per basket of fish and 250 frs per kg of mil in her town.

She strengthens her business with one part of the profits generated by her business, and improves the living conditions of her family with the other.

loans.use: to buy fish and mil [African cereal] to resell retail.

loans.name: Fatou  Pathe's Group

texts.fr:
Ces deux femmes font partie du grand groupe de Banc Villageois qui a été crée le 13 Décembre 2008. Elles habitent le même village et exercent la même activité qu'est le petit commerce. 

Debout à droite de la photo, Fatou la vedette est âgée de 60 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de 08 enfants dont 04 garçons. 

Avec le prêt reçu, elle va acheter le sachet de biscuits à 2000 frs, le sachet de bonbons à 400 frs, le kg de piment à 200 frs, celui de l'oignons à 500 frs. 

A la vente elle gagne en terme de bénéfice 500 frs pour les bonbons, et 700 frs pour le reste. 

Les bénéfices sont utilisés pour acheter du bétail à élever et revendre après pour les besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
These two women are part of the large group of "Banc Villageois" which was created on December 13, 2008. They live in the same village and practice the same business which is shopkeeping.

Standing to the right of the photo, Fatou is the featured borrower and is 60 years old. She is a widow and mother to 8 children of whom 4 are boys.

With the loan she received, she is going to buy a package of biscuits at 2,000 frs, a package of candy at 400 frs, a kg of pepper at 200 frs, and a kg of onions at 500 frs.

Upon reselling she makes a profit of 500 frs for the candy, and 700 frs for the rest.

The profits will be used to buy cattle to raise and later resell for the needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as biscuits, candy, onions and peppers to resell retail in her canteen.

loans.name: Boffel Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est constitué de deux femmes qui habitent le même village, elles sont très solidaires et leurs activités principales sont l'agriculture, l'élevage et le commerce.

Madame Anta la responsable, trésorière du Banc Villageois est âgée de 42 ans, c'est une femme mariée mère de deux filles .Elle s'active dans le commerce ,elle a une boutique à domicile et travaille en collaboration avec son mari; elle fait aussi de l'élevage.Elle capitalise une bonne expérience de plus de 20 ans. Sur la photo, elle est debout à droite habillée en bleu et a levé la main gauche.

Elle achète ses produits (sucre, riz, huile, café, biscuit.....) en ville et revend dans son village.


Avec son prêt elle souhaite acheter 2 vaches à 100000 F l'une, 5 moutons pour embouche bovine et ovine; renforcer la boutique  et compte les vendre dans 5 mois pour préparer son remboursement.


Avec ses bénéfices elle participe aux dépenses familiales(santé,nourriture, habillement); renforce son épargne et rembourse son prêt.
texts.en:
This group consists of two women who live in the same village. They stand by each other and their main businesses are agriculture, breeding and shopkeeping.

Anta is responsible for the group, treasurer of the "Banc Villageois" and is 42 years old. This is a married woman and mother to two daughters. She is active in shopkeeping, she has a boutique in her home and works in collaboration with her husband; she also breeds. She capitalizes on a good experience of more than 20 years. On the photo, she is standing to the right dressed in blue and has raised her left hand.

She buys her products (sugar, rice, oil, café, biscuits.....) in town and resells in her village.

With her loan she hopes to buy 2 cows at 100,000F each, and 5 sheep for bovine and ovine fattening; strengthen her boutique and plans to resell the animals in 5 months to prepare her repayment.

With her profits she contributes to the family expenses (health, food, clothing), strengthens her savings and repays her loan.

loans.use: to buy 2 cows and 5 sheep for bovine and ovine fattening.

loans.name: Nionkoly's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 24 femmes est créé le 06 juin 2001. Ces membres sont toutes de la localité et font du commerce comme activité.
Mme Diarra est l'emprunteur en vedette. Elle est âgée de 46 ans et mariée avec 06 enfants dont 02 garçons et 04 filles. Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 12 paniers de poissons secs à 3.000 Frs et payer le transport et les taxes. Sur la photo, elle est debout à droite avec la main levée.
Avec les bénéfices, elle voudrait aider son mari dans la prise en charges des enfants pour la santé et les études.
texts.en:
This group of 24 women was created on 6 June 2001. Its members are all from same area, and work in retail.

Diarra is the featured borrower, and is 46 years of age. She is married and has six children, two boys and four girls. With this loan she plans to buy 12 baskets of dried fish at 3,000 francs, as well as to pay for transportation and taxes. Diarra is pictured standing on the right with her hand raised in the photo. She plans to use her profits to help her husband provide for her children’s healthcare and education.

loans.use: To buy dried fish for resale.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
Milagros, de 42 años, es una mujer valiente, luchadora y muy responsable, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos de 23, 21, 19 y 15 años quienes aun viven con ella en su casa propia que pudo comprarse con bastante esfuerzo y sacrificio, solo el mayor de sus hijos es independiente y le ayuda en algunos gastos del hogar y ella como madre soltera lleva la responsabilidad de trabajar para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos menores. El trabajo de Milagros consiste en la venta de ropa. Realiza su trabajo por las diferentes calles de la ciudad o entre sus amigos, vecinos y familiares o también de manera ambulatoria en los diversos mercados de la ciudad. Trae prendas de vestir desde otra ciudad hasta donde se dirige personalmente para seleccionar las vestimentas de mejor calidad y de los mejores diseños. Lleva trabajando así ya por 4 años, lo hace sola ya que al separarse de su pareja tuvo que encontrar la manera de poder generar el dinero que necesitaba para enfrentar los gastos que requería la manutención de sus hijos, durante éste tiempo de trabajo ha aprendido a conocer los gustos y preferencias de sus clientes y es por eso que tiene siempre el diseño o modelo preciso que sabe que le gusta y encanta a las personas que se acercan a comprarle. Le gusta de su trabajo pues tiene tiempo a disposición para que pueda hacer algunas otras actividades, además gracias a los lugares concurridos donde eventualmente vende siempre consigue vender gran parte de su mercadería, ella sabe que tiene que esforzarse mucho para conseguir las cosas y gracias a esa perseverancia y empeño puede sustentar a su hogar, espera en algún momento tener su tienda de ropa en donde pueda atender mejor y con mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Este es el préstamo número 6 con MFP, agradece a aquellas personas que le brindan el crédito que requiere para aumentar su capital de trabajo, se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, está contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que son muy solidarios y responsables. 
Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará mayor cantidad de prendas de vestir conformada por camisas, polos, blusas, pantalones y faldas para continuar vendiendo a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Milagros is 42 years old and is a brave, responsible, and hardworking single mother with four children, ages 23, 21, 19, and 15.  They all live with her in the home that she was able to buy with great effort and sacrifice.  Only her oldest son is on his own and he helps her with some of the household expenses.  She, as a single mother, is responsible for working to bring a better quality of life to her minor children.

Milagros sells clothing and works along various streets around the city or with her friends, neighbors, and family members.  She also sells at different markets around the city.  She brings articles of clothing from other cities and personally selects the best quality and best designs.
 
She’s been doing this for four years on her own because she had to find a way to make money to support her children after she separated from her husband.  During this period of work, she has learned her customers’ likes and preferences, so she always has the styles and designs that her customers desire and enchants those who go to buy from her.

She likes her work because it leaves her time to do other things.  Also, thanks to the places she goes, she eventually sells most of the items she has.  She knows that she has to work hard to acquire things and thanks to this perseverance and effort she can sustain her household.  She hopes to set up her own clothing store soon, where she can serve her customers in a more comfortable atmosphere.  This will be her sixth loan through MFP and she appreciates those who provide her the loan she needs to increase her working capital.  She promises to make her payments on time.  She is happy to belong to the communal bank because the members are responsible and united.

She will use the 1,500 PEN from this loan to buy clothing in quantity, including shirts, polo shirts, blouses, pants, and skirts, so that she can continue to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Neyda

texts.es: Neyda, de 31 años, es una señora valiente y luchadora, está casada y junto a su esposo es madre de dos niños de 8 años y 10 meses de edad, a quienes brinda los cuidados necesarios ya que aún son muy pequeños, vive en casa de sus suegros junto a ellos y a su esposo. Neyda, durante mucho tiempo trabajo en diversas actividades, pero desde hace algún tiempo se dedica a la venta de muebles al por menor, se encarga de comprar muebles al por mayor en los distintos talleres de carpintería, los transporta hasta su casa donde esta ubicado su local y se encarga de distribuir los muebles al crédito que empieza a cobrar semanal, quincenal o mensual, de acuerdo a  las posibilidades de pago que tenga su cliente. Lleva trabajando en esta actividad más de 3 años, tiene el respaldo y la ayuda de su esposo ya que juntos iniciaron esta labor que les brinda la posibilidad de dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Lo que le gusta de su función es que siente que es muy divertido trabajar a lado de su esposo, además tiene la disponibilidad de usar su tiempo libre para atender a sus hijos, el negocio le va bien porque vende productos de calidad y ahora es muy solicitada por sus clientes porque saben que reciben un buen producto, desea consolidar su negocio y empezar a formar su propio taller de carpintería en donde pueda elaborar ella misma los muebles con ayuda de su esposo u otras personas. Este es el crédito número 14 con MFP, es por eso que agradece a todas las personas que hacen posible su crédito para continuar realizando su trabajo con mejores resultados. Por otro lado se compromete una vez mas a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal por que todos los integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará algunas herramientas de carpintería como cinceles y pulidoras manuales, la mayor parte del dinero lo invertirá en la compra de maderas para que empiece a fabricar los muebles que pone a la venta.
texts.en:
Neyda is 31 years old and is a brave and hardworking woman.  She’s married and has two children, ages 8 and 10, whom she cares for because they are very young.  She lives with her in-laws, along with her children and her husband.

Neyda has worked in different activities, but for some time she has been selling furniture in small quantities.  She buys large quantities from different furniture makers, takes them to her house where she has a small shop, and sells it on credit.  She collects weekly, bi-weekly, or monthly, based on the customer’s ability to pay.

She’s been working at this for three years and has her husband’s backing and help, since this work makes it possible for them to provide a better quality of life for their family.  What she likes is that she considers this work fun.  It also gives her free time to care for her children.  Business is good because she sells quality products and she is well sought after by her customers because they know that they get a good product.  She would like to consolidate her business and start her own woodworking workshop where she can make the furniture herself, with the help of her husband and others.

This will be her 14th loan through MFP, and she appreciates all the people who make this loan possible, so that she can continue working with better results.  She promises to make her payments on time, as with the previous loans.  She also likes being part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible and united.  She will use the 2,000 PEN from this loan to buy some carpentry tools, such as chisels and hand sanders.  She will invest most of the money in lumber so that she can begin making the furniture.

loans.use: to buy tools and lumber.

loans.name: Kunama Group

texts.fr:
J. Bosco fait partie du groupe Kunama  et  habite à  Cibitoke. Il a 35 ans et est marié à Espérance,  une  cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 4enfants, âgés de 2 à 11 ans, dont 2 étudient.

Il est  commerçant du riz depuis   5 ans. 

Il est à son quatrième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de riz, à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait pratiquer l’élevage, construire sa propre maison, il voudrait en outre voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
J. Bosco belongs to the Kunama group and lives in Cibitoke. He is 35 years old and married to Espérance, a farmer. They have four children together, whose ages range from two to 11 years old; two of them attend school.

He has been a rice trader for the past five years and is on his fourth loan from Turame. With the KIVA loan he is granted he is going to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of rice to resell and make more money.

In the coming years he would like to do livestock farming, build his own house and also see his children study.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of rice to resell and make more money.

loans.name: Pc1 Thieo Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe crée depuis le 27 Décembre 2010 il regroupe des femmes du même village s'activant toutes dans le commerce .Elles sont unies par de liens sociaux et partagent le même groupement depuis longtemps. Madame Marie Coumba est une femme mariée âgée de 34 ans et mère de trois enfants dont deux garçons et une fille .Elle s'active dans le commerce par la vente de lait caillé et de petit déjeuner. Elle de debout à l’extrême droite de la photo la main levée habillée en noir. Avec son nouveau crédit de150000 elle va se procurer du lait au près de ses bailleurs qui se trouvent être les bergers de son village  pour le revendre au détails au niveau de son village ,sur la nationale et à Thiès à des clients qui travaillent dans des structures.
Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent de payer ses intérêts et d'épargner au niveau du banc villageois mais de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires vestimentaires et sanitaires de ses enfants.
texts.en: This group, which was set up on 27th December 2012, is made up of women from the same village, who are all active traders. They are united by social links and have been part of the same group for a long time. Maria Coumba is a married woman, who is 34 years old and mother to three children: two boys and a girl. She sells curdled milk and breakfasts. She is standing on the far right of the photo, dressed in black and raising her hand. With her new loan of 150,000 francs she is going to get milk from her suppliers, who are shepherds, in her village and resell it on a retail basis in the village, on the highway and in Thiès, to customers who work in organisations. The profits she makes will allow her to pay the interest on her loan and to save money with the Banc Villageois, but also to provide for her children's food, clothing and health.

loans.use: to buy curdled milk.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: La socia es la señora Sabina, casada y madre de 4 hijos, ella continúa con su actividad de lavado de vehículos. Sabina en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para cercar su terreno en el cual ella lava los carros y asi proporcionar mes comodidad y seguridad a sus clientes. Sabina está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, para fortalecer su actividad económica la cual le permite ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en: This member's name is Sabina. She is married and is the mother of 4 children. She is still doing her activity of carwashing. At this time, Sabina is asking for the loan to fence in the land where she washes cars, thus offering more comfort and security to her customers. Sabina is very grateful for the help from KIVA to fortify her economic activity. This has allowed her to offer her family a better quality of life. She belongs to the “KANCHARY” communal bank in the city of Cuzco, Peru.

loans.use: to fence in her land

loans.name: Gbegnonhin

texts.fr: Aviculteur de profession, Mr Gbegnonhin âgé de 35ans est marié à une coiffeuse et ils ont 01 enfant de 08ans qui va à l’école. Son activité qui se déroule à domicile lui procure des revenus lui permettant d’assurer les besoins primaires de la famille. Il est dans ce domaine il y a 04ans et sollicite ce troisième crédit de WAGES pour s’approvisionner en pondeuses. Il veut avec les profits, diversifier l’activité, la rendre pérenne et assurer une meilleure vie à la famille.
texts.en: Gbegnonhin, who is a poultry farmer by trade, is 35 years old and married to a hairdresser; they have one child, who is eight years old and attends school. His activity, which he carries out at home, procures him sufficient income to provide his family's basic needs. He has been working in this field for the past four years and is requesting a third loan from WAGES to get fresh supplies of hens. With the profits he makes he would like to diversify his business, make it perennial and provide for a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy hens.

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es:
Cruz, de 54 años de edad, es una mujer  trabajadora y dinámica, además de alegre y sociable, es conviviente  con  Julián quien es empleado y  padre  de sus 2 hijos, a quienes quiere mucho y son su inspiración. Juntos habitan cómodamente su propia casa. La actividad que realiza cruz es la elaboración y venta de golosinas, lo cual lo elabora en un local propio ubicado en su propia casa contando con materiales adecuados para la elaboración, y lo vende en la puerta del colegio al medio día, logrando ganarse muchos  clientes por su buena atención y variedad de golosinas.
Dedicándose a dicha actividad hace más de 08 años, lo cual lo realiza con la ayuda de sus hijos  
Considera rentable su negocio por la demanda que tiene y las buenas ganancias que le deja. 
Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el ingreso económico que le genera, y poder apoyar a su familia con los gastos  de su hogar, también le gusta el tiempo libre que tiene y lo puede usar en otras actividades. Antes de iniciar con esta actividad  tenia muchos problemas económicos, lo que ganaba su pareja no le alcanzaba, es por esa razón que ella se dedica a este negocio.
 Por otro lado la venta de  sus golosinas, nos  comenta que en ésta actividad no se pierde por ser un producto de bastante consumo, siempre tiene demanda, por eso tiene planes de hacer crecer su negocio. Este es el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta y agradecida por la oportunidad de contar con una línea de crédito para poder avanzar con su negocio, por eso se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
Con el monto solicitado de1000 nuevo soles, los invertirá en la compra de golosinas de toda variedad y calidad   buscando aumentar el stock de sus mercaderías disponible para la venta y así tener más acogida e ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Cruz is 54 years old. She is a hardworking and dynamic woman who is also cheerful and sociable. She lives with Julián, who is employed and is the father of her 2 children. She loves them very much and they are her inspiration. They live comforatbly together in their own house. Cruz' activity is making and selling snacks. She makes them in a locale in her own house, with the materials she needs to make them, She sells them at the entrance to a high school at noon and is able to gain many customers because of her good service and variety of snacks. She has done this activity for more than 8 years and does it with the help of her children. She considers her business to be profitable because of the demand she has and the good earnings it brings in. 

What she likes about her activity is the income it generates, and being able to help her family with the household expenses. She also likes the free tome she has whcih she can spend doing other things. Before staring this activity, she has a lot of financial problems. What her spouse made wasn't enough. That is why she works at this business.

She sells her snacks and she tells us that this activity doesn't lose money because it is a popular product. There is always a demand for it, and that is why she has plans to grow her business. This is her second loan with the MFP institution. She feels happy and grateful for the opportunity to have a line of credit to advance her business. That is why she is committed to making her payments.

With the amount she has asked for, 1000 nuevo soles, she will invest in buying all types of snacks and increase her available merchandise for sale to have more customers and income.

loans.use: to buy all types of snacks.

loans.name: Vicentina

texts.es: La socia es la señora Vicentina, ella continúa con su actividad económica de venta de materiales de construcción como yeso, cemento, piedra, arena  etc. pero adicionalmente ahora también está incursionando en la crianza de animales menores como gallinas y cuyes, esto para aumentar sus ingresos económicos y ayudar a su esposo con la primera actividad. Vicentina en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para capitalizar su segunda actividad y capitalizarla comprando gallinas y cuyes. Vicentina está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, por ayudarla a fortalecer su actividad económica la cual le permite ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en: This member's name is Vicentina. She constinues wither her economic activity selling construction materials such as plaster, cement, stones, sand, etc. Now she is also going into raising small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens. This is to increase her income and help her husband with the first activity. At this time, Vicentina is asking for the loan to capitalize her second activity by buying chickens and guinea pigs. Vicentina is very grateful to KIVA for helping her fortify her economic activity which has allowed her to offer her family a better quality of life. She belongs to the “KANCHARY” communal bank in the city of Cuzco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy chickens and guinea pigs

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel believes that, "Patience and hard work are the key to overcoming poverty." He is 35 years old and has two infant-aged children. He is a farmer who is raising his family in a rural community. He cultivates his farm lots by planting corn and vegetables for sale. He also engages in a hog-raising business to generate additional income. 

Emmanuel plans to improve the business and increase his income to satisfy his family needs and save for the future of his children. To improve the business, he is asking for an additional capital of P 10,000 to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. He is hoping that someday he will improve the business and make it profitable through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es: La socia es la señora Eulogia, casada y madre de 2 hijos, ella continúa con sus actividades de transporte público, venta de alimento para animales menores y la crianza y comercialización de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas y cerdos, actividades que lleva paralelamente  para obtener mejores ingresos económicos. Eulogia en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para capitalizar su trabajo y comprar más cerdos, gallinas y cuyes. Eulogia está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, por ayudarla a fortalecer su actividad económica la cual le permite ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KANCHARY”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
The member, Eulogia, is married and has two children.  She continues in her public transport business, while also selling fodder and raising and selling small animals such as guinea pigs, and hens.  She manages all of these activities at the same time to obtain the best possible income.

Now, Eulogia is requesting a loan to buy pigs, hens and guinea pigs.  She is very grateful to KIVA for the help, which has strengthened her business and improved her family's lifestyle.  The member belongs to the "KANCHARY" communal bank in the city of Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: To buy pigs, hens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Tsevelhuu

texts.en: Mrs Tsevelhuu is 45 years old and lives with her husband, two daughters, and son in a Mongolian yurt in Hovd province, Mongolia. Her husband, Jarantai, is 47 years old. She and her husband are invalids (impairment). Her older daughter works at a private company and her younger son and daughter are college students. Her daughter and son also work in addition to studying. Mrs Tsevelhuu is starting to make national clothes from this month at home with her husband. In the future, she is planning to expand her business operations by increasing her turnover and hiring one worker. She is a hardworking and well-behaved person. She is asking for 1 200 000 MNT to buy raw materials for her business.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her business

loans.name: Rahayu Jaya Group

texts.en:
Tri, widowed, lives in JatiRahayu in the east of Jakarta. In her daily life she works as a masseuse, but because she has one dependent she also sells herbal medicines. She already had customer massages around her neighborhood, but massage can not provide a fixed income, so she decided to sell the herbal medicine although she has been a masseuse for 15 years. 

Her dream is to have her own massage clinic. This group has already borrowed nine times and they are loyal customers.

loans.use: to pay school fees and expand her herbal medicine sales business

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine lives in Sinkor. She is 32 years old, single with a child aged one year old that is looked after by her boyfriend since she has to sell and get money before they cook for the day. Josephine said she has been running this cosmetics business for the past two years. The profit from the business is used on food and house rent. She started this business with money from her boyfriend. She said he is not employed but sometimes he gets contracts since he is a builder.

Josephine says, "Now my customers are complaining because I no longer sell good classic kinds of perfume, roll-on deodorant, body cream, powder, make-up, etc." She is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetics for her business. Her plan is to own a car for the business.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Ms. Safia is a 52-year-old married woman. She has been running a small general store in her community for the last ten years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and has regular customers. Her husband is working with her in the shop because due to long working hours and having it open seven days a week, it was not possible for her to run this store alone.
 
She is a mother of five children. She is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of Rs 30,000  to buy a stock of rice and flour, etc. from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is on her 2nd loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and also to increase business capital.

loans.use: To buy stock of oil, rice, flour, pulses (lentils), candy, biscuits etc.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Ms. Sughran is a married woman and has five children. She is striving hard to meet their demands including food, clothing, education and health. Her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. She started her business to contribute in the family income.

She has been in the embroidery business for many years. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf foundation. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. 

She requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy a stock of threads of different colors, buttons, needles, etc. With this, she will be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail. 

She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: To buy a stock of threads of different colors, buttons and needles.

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.en:
Ms Yasmin had a difficult time after her husband's business failure. She decided to work with her husband and to support her family for a better future. Two years ago she began stitching work in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. 

She is married and provides for three children. She is currently in her 3rd loan cycle and has borrowed PKR 30,000 from Kashf. She intends to use this loan amount to buy raw material including cloth, threads of different colors, laces, zips, etc., to create a means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy raw materials including cloth, threads of different colors, laces and zips.

loans.name: Lorina

texts.en:
Lorina, aged 47, lives at West Point. She is married with four children, aged between four and 28. Three of the children live outside the home, and are independent, only one of them stays with her at home and is in school. 

For the past three years, she has had a warehouse in her community where she sells coal wholesale to customers who then sell it on by retail. One of the difficulties she faces is transporting the coal to Monrovia. She makes a profit when she sells, and with the profit she buys more coal for the business and educates her child. 

She is requesting this loan to purchase more coal so she can increase her sales. Her plan for the future is to become a big business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more coal so she can increase her sales.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is involved in agriculture. He breeds cows and hens and grows fruit trees. Karen earns his main income from the sales of agricultural products in the local markets. In order to gather more milk, Karen has applied for this loan to purchase a cow. He also wants to buy forage to feed the cattle during winter. 

Karen lives with his parents and sister. Development of agriculture is absolutely vital for the family to earn additional income, make savings and create better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and forage.

location.town: Vernashen village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Ms Naseem is a 54-year-old married woman. She is very innovative and despite having no proper education she is very talented in creating art designs. Her husband works in a car repairing shop and earns insufficient funds to support his family alone. 

Because her husband’s income is too low to support the seven members of the family, so she started her own business. She does beautiful embroidery on bed sheets and towels and then sells them in the market. Her collection is very famous in her town. Her customer base is diverse and she serves her community well. In this way she is able to contribute to the family income. 

She is well satisfied and happy with the support of Kashf Foundation. She requested a loan of PKR 15,000 to buy more bed sheets and towels in bulk to increase her business. This will drive up her sales and will help in generating more income. She wishes to utilize the earned profit on the improvement of her house.

loans.use: To buy more bed sheets and towels in bulk to increase her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine lives in Sinkor. She is single with three children aged two, five and nine who all live at home and attend school.

For the past ten years now, she has been running a table stall in the market where she sells fish. She started this business with help from her father, and learned how to sell from her mother. She likes her business because it allows her to make profits and makes her popular.

She requested this loan to purchase more fish for her business. She wants to make more money to build her house as she has a piece of land.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Arkadia

texts.en:
Arkadia lives with his parents, wife and two school-age children in Malishka village, Vayots Dzor region. Arkadia breeds pigs and hens. He got involved in breeding four years ago. Currently Arkadia keeps four pigs and 12 hens. 

Arkadia would like to increase the number of pigs, for which he needs sufficient funds. Arkadia also plans to purchase forage for the pigs, as the forage he has reserved is not enough to feed more pigs. This loan will help Arkadia to implement these objectives and earn more income from the sales of pig meat.

loans.use: to pay for pigs and forage.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Luisa, de 45 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora, amable y le gusta los negocios.  Es casada con David quien es trabajador independiente y padre de sus 02 hijos.  Vive  en compañía de sus dos hijos  y su pareja, habitando en  la  casa que es de su propiedad. El negocio que tiene Luisa es la venta de suplementos nutricionales como ganoderma a base de café, iniciándose por la idea de una amiga que le hizo conocer el negocio, ahora  ella misma trae desde la capital, realizando viajes periódicos y en ocasiones encarga la  compra a un familiar que vive en la capital, para luego venderlo de forma ambulatoria y personalizada a sus vecinos, familiares y conocidos muchas veces al contado y otras a crédito.  
Lleva realizando éste negocio desde hace 08 meses y hasta el momento lo realiza sola.
Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Le gusta su negocio pues le ha traído muchas satisfacciones como el ayudar a muchas personas en el cuidado de su salud, también el ingreso económico con lo cual puede darles una mejor educación a sus hijos  y el sentirse una empresaria que cada día se va desarrollándose más y progresando. Al contrario le incomoda cuando alguno de su clientes se retrasan en el pago de sus créditos, pero aun así desea continuar y crecer en su negocio. Este es préstamo número 02  con la institución MFP. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal pues considera a sus miembros ser personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de un stock de mayor volumen de estos productos y a menos costo y a la vez comprará ropas de vestir para venderlas. Ella espera apoyar en el tratamiento de enfermedades de muchas personas con este productos y aumentar sus márgenes de ganancia.
texts.en:
Luisa, 45, is a hard-working, kind woman who likes business activity.  She is married to David, who is an independent worker and the father of their two children.  They live in their own house.  Luisa sells health supplements, such as coffe-based Ganoderma.  She started the business through a friend who gave her the idea.  She brings the merchandise from the capity city, which she visits periodically.  Sometimes she asks a relative who lives in the capital to make the purchase for her.  She sells the goods door-to-door to her neighbors, family and acquaintances on both cash and credit bases.  She has been in business for eight months and, for now, works alone.

She feels the business is good because of the profits she makes.  En enjoys what she does because of the satisfaction she receives by helping people care for their health.  The income also allows her give her children a better education, while making her feel like a business woman who is evolving more and more each day.  What she is uncomfortable with is when a customer gets behind in his or her credit.  But she still wants to continue and grow her business.

This is her second loan through MFP.  She hopes you will help her meet her goals.  She also says she likes her communal bank because the members are responsible, supportive people.  The loan in the amount of 800 PEN will be used to buy a larger stock of products at a lower cost.  She will also buy clothing to sell.  She hopes to be able to help people cure their illnesses with these products, and increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy health products and clothing.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Ms Rehana is married and has three children. She had a difficult time after her husband's business failure. She decided to work with her husband and to support her family for a better future. Two years ago she began salon work in her house. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. 

She is currently in her 4th loan cycle and has borrowed PKR 30,000 from Kashf. She wants to use this loan amount to buy raw material including facial cream, hair straightener, a hair dryer etc, to meet her customers’ demand. This will mean she can increase her revenues and generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy raw materials including facial cream, hair straightener and a hair dryer.

loans.name: Naziran

texts.en:
Ms Naziran is 50 years old, living in a village of Khudian. She has been in the milk-sales business for a few years. Her husband is involved with agriculture and doesn’t earn enough to fulfil the needs of the family members alone. She has three children and there are a total of five members in her home and her husband is the sole earner of the family. 

Therefore she decided to help her husband in earning. For this purpose she purchased a buffalo five years ago and started selling the milk in her community. Now her customers have increased and she wants to purchase another buffalo. For this reason she wants the loan of PKR 20,000. 

She is satisfied with the support of Kashf foundation as she has taken several loans for the growth of her business. She is hopeful to earn more income and intends to use it on providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: To purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Siftan

texts.en:
Ms Siftan is a 38-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last many years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. 

She is a mother of six children. She is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy stocks of rice and flour and other general items from the market at lower rates. She then will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her 2nd loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: To buy stocks of rice, flour, oil, tea and soaps.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha lives in Sinkor with five children aged between two and 17 years old. Her children live at home and attend school. She stopped her education in the 6th grade. 

For seven years she has been selling door paint, nails, hinges, etc in her community. She started this business with a loan from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase more door paint, nails, hinges, etc for her business. She enjoys the way her customers buy from her. In the near future she want to own a car and become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more door paint, nails and hinges for her business.

loans.name: Manah

texts.fr: Dame de 46ans, madame Adjovi est mariée à un revendeur. Ils ont 04 enfants tous sur les bancs de l’école. L’ainé est âgé de 22ans et le dernier 11ans. C’est depuis 2006, qu’il a démarré son activité de vente de cartes de recharges dans une boutique. Elle veut élargir son activité et aider son conjoint dans les charges du foyer c’est pour cela, elle sollicite un premier prêt à WAGES pour s’acheter des marchandises (cartes de recharges) auprès des sociétés de communication afin de tirer profit et atteindre son objectif.
texts.en: Adjovi is a 46 year old woman who is married to a re-seller. They have four children, all of whom spend their days on the wooden benches of school. The oldest is 22 years old and the youngest is 11 years old. Since 2006, Adjovi has been selling top-up cards of mobile credit in a small store. She hopes to expand her activity and help her husband take care of the home expenses. In order to do so, she is asking for her first loan from WAGES to purchase larger quantities of merchandise from communication companies in order to increase her sales and be more profitable.

loans.use: purchase top-up cards for mobile credit

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.fr: Mr Gilbert est âgé de 42ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse et est mère de 03 enfants. Les deux âgés de 12 et 08ans sont scolarisés. Quant au dernier de 02ans, il ne va pas encore à l’école. Il est éleveur de porcs et exerce l’activité il y a 08ans. Il vend ses porcs aux charcutiers et aux restaurateurs dans sa ferme et une personne l’aide dans l’exécution de ses travaux. Il sollicite un second prêt à WAGES pour acheter des porcs et les nourritures leur permettant de les engraisser. Avec les profits, il veut avoir une grande ferme et voir sa famille s’épanouir.
texts.en: Mr Gilbert is a 42 year old man, married to a re-seller, with whom he has three children. Their children are aged 2, 8 and 12 years old, the two oldest attend school. He has been raising pigs and selling pork products for the past 8 years. He sells his pork to butchers and restaurants, and has one person working on the farm to help him with his work. He is asking for a second loan from WAGE in order to purchase more pigs and feed them, thus enabling them to gain more weight. He plans to use his profits to increase his farm and see his family enriched.

loans.use: purchase pigs

loans.name: Munawar

texts.en:
Ms. Munawaris is a passionate woman who works selling cosmetics and ribbons. She works day and night to give her family all the basic necessities of life. Her collection of cosmetics and ribbons is very famous in her town. She offers a variety of ribbons in different colors and designs to her customers and makes enough money to lead a decent life.

She is a loving mother of four kids who are all going to school. She is in charge of providing her family with good food, health and education. She has steadily improved her business by taking loans from the Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy a new stock of cosmetics and ribbons of different colors in various designs. She hopes to have more profits and hence better support for her family.

loans.use: To buy new stock of cosmetics and ribbons of different colors in various designs.

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Ms Shagufta is a 40-year-old active, married woman. She is efficiently doing a milk-selling business. Most of her clients are her neighbors. She makes enough to lead a decent life. Her husband is employed in a small general store and one of her sons works in a repair shop. However, their income is very unpredictable and not enough to cover everyday expenditures. 

She is a loving mother of three children. She is in charge of providing her family with good food, health and education. She has slowly but surely improved her business by taking loans from the Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of PKR 15,000 to buy another cow to meet the increasing demand from her customers. She hopes to have more profits and hence better support her family and will spend a part of her earnings on the education of her two daughters.

loans.use: To buy another cow to meet the increasing demand from her customers.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a very hard-working woman and supports her family very well. Her cloth business is good. She is a passionate woman and has been doing stitching work for one year.

She is a loving mother of one child. She is in charge of providing her family with good food, health and education. She has steadily improved her business by taking loans from the Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy a stock of fancy cloth of different colors and various designs with lace and patterns in thread etc. She hopes to have more profits and hence better support her family.

loans.use: to buy a stock of fancy cloth of different colors and various designs with lace and thread patterns.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a larger volume of clothes.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is married and has five children. Since she is from a low-income household, she decided to start her own business. Now she is supporting her household.

Both Suriya and her husband earn money to cover the family's daily expenses and to provide a better future for their children.
 
She has been familiar with stitching techniques from a young age. At the moment, she has a big client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community.

Suriya is requesting a loan of Rs 20,000 to stock up on coloured threads, buttons, needles, etc. This way, she will be able to meet the demands of her customers and continue the business without fail.
