She says “I started my business because I love to cook food of all kinds, Spanish, Mexican, Chinese, however here we only know Mexican food and therefore I sell Mexican snacks. My only difficulty was when I started because I did not have a fixed place where I could sell my snacks, however now I have a space in front of the town hall where I put my vendor’s cart. I open from three in the afternoon until 12 at night.”

Carmen’s goal is for her daughter to finish her university studies. She does not want to tell her that she cannot finish her studies due to lack of money.

All of the members are very grateful and are working with FRAC because the loan will be a great help since it enables them to expand their businesses, such as Jose, Josefina and Saturnina, who will invest in clothing, Araceli in her store, Jessica in gifts, Rosa Celia in woven goods, Lidia in pigs, Maria Felisa in calves, Yolanda in the sale of tortillas and Erica in quilts, sheets, bedspreads and towels to sell. (Erica does not appear in the photo because she was working).

loans.use: to buy gas, vegetables, salt, oil, etc.

loans.name: Affiwa

texts.fr: Affiwa est une femme âgée de 56ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur. Affiwa travaille comme revendeuse de tissus coupons depuis 2005. Elle vend à ses clients au Grand Marché, achète les produits au Port de Lomé. Affiwa a requis son quatrième cycle de prêt à WAGES afin de renforcer son activité des tissus. Elle veut rendre l’activité pérenne et assurer ses propres besoins.
texts.en:
Affiwa is a 56-year-old woman. She is married to a chauffeur. 

Affiwa has worked retailing cut fabrics since 2005. She buys her goods at the Port of Lomé and sells them to customers at the Grand Market [of Lomé]. 

Affiwa requested her fourth loan with WAGES in order to strengthen her fabric business. She wants to make her business sustainable and ensure her needs are met.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Jesus Emigdio

texts.es:
Jesus posee una tienda general donde ofrece productos de consumo a sus clientes como bebidas, dulces, snack y otros más. La ventaja que posee es que su tienda está ubicada en una atracción turística en su municipio, la cual son unos charcos y ríos, y esto le ha permitido venir teniendo ventas con las que solventa sus gastos y los de su familia. Pese a que su negocio lo tiene hace muy poco tiempo, y que no cuenta con un gran capital ni surtido, su negocio ha venido creciendo y es por esto que ahora Jesus tiene la oportunidad de buscar un préstamo para comprar gaseosas, bebidas, dulces y otros productos más para surtir su tienda.

Su sueño es poder convertir este negocio en un restaurante y aprovechar la atracción turística. Además, aspira a ofrecerles a su esposa y sus 2 hijos una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en: Jesús has a general store where he offers consumer goods like beverages, candy, snacks and others to customers.  His advantage is that the store is located in one of his city’s tourist attractions: pools and rivers.  This has made it possible for him to make sales that allow him to cover household and family expenses.  Despite being in business for a short time and lacking capital and wide selection of stock, his business has been growing and this is why Jesús is now looking for a loan to buy soft-drinks, beverages, candy and other products to stock his store.  His dream is to turn the business into a restaurant to take advantage of the tourist attraction.  In addition, he hopes to provide his wife and two children with better quality of life and better economic opportunities for making progress.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, beverages, candy and other products to stock his store.

loans.name: Djamilatou

texts.fr: Djamilatou vit avec son mari et leurs 04 enfants. Trois des enfants sont scolarisés. Le conjoint de cette dernière est mécanicien auto. Quant à notre cliente, elle est revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale.  L’activité qu’elle exerce depuis 1996 se déroule à domicile et elle s’approvisionne à Lomé.   Afin de mieux servir les clients dans leurs demandes, elle fait un premier  prêt à WAGES pour s’approvisionner en marchandises. Comme perspectives d’avenir, elle veut assurer l’épanouissement de la famille et rendre son activité pérenne et durable.
texts.en: Djamilatou lives with her husband and her four children. Three of the children go to school. Her husband is an auto mechanic. As for our client, she resells food products. The business that she has been doing since 1996 takes place at home and she buys her stock in Lomé. In order to better satisfy the demands of her customers, she requests a first loan from WAGES to buy merchandise. As a future prospect, she wants to ensure that her family thrives and make her business sustainable and long-lasting.

loans.use: To buy food products.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de femmes catholiques créé depuis le 13 décembre 2008. Elles vivent une parfaite entente et solidarité. Elles ont accepté aussi de s’ouvrir à d'autres dans le soucis d'élargir le Banc Villageois.
Sophie âgée de 35 ans est célibataire, elle est mère de 4 enfants. Elle a en charge ses frères et sœurs,une famille de plus de 10 personnes.Elle a comme activité le commerce, elle vend divers produits de fruits de mer, de l'huile de palm, du jus de citron.
Avec le prêt reçu elle compte acheter 20 litres d'huile de palm, 20 litres de jus de citron,et prend une somme de 10 000 pour achat de fruits de mer.
Les bénéfices générées lui permettent d'assurer la dépense quotidienne de la famille, leur nourriture. Elle gère aussi les frais de scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
This group of Catholic women has been together since December 13, 2008. Together, they share deep understanding and solidarity. They have recently decided to open their group up to others with the hope of expanding their Banc Villageois.

Sophie is a 35-year-old single mother of four. She is also responsible for her brothers and sisters, resulting in a family of more than 10 dependents. Sophie is an entrepreneur who has a business selling palm oil, lemon juice, and various types of seafood. With this loan she plans to spend 10,000 XOF to purchase seafood. She will also be able to purchase 20 liters of palm oil and 20 liters of lemon juice. The income she earns from her business will allow Sophie to pay for her family's daily expenses, including their food. It will also permit her to to pay for the children's school tuition.

loans.use: to purchase seafood, lemon juice and palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Nelvy

texts.es:
Nelvy, de 30 años, es una mujer emprendedora y my trabajadora, convive con Frank y con él tiene 3 hijos de 11. 9 y 5 años de edad respectivamente. Vive en su casa propia junto a todos los miembros de su familia y día a día se esfuerza por ser la mejor y brindarles todo lo mejor. Nelvy, se dedica desde muy joven a la venta de comida. Trabaja todos los días en la vereda de su casa en donde instala una mesa, sillas y una cocina en donde realiza los más ricos “anticuchos”  y “juanes” que son el deleite de sus clientes. Eventualmente ofrece otro tipo de platillos para salir de la rutina pero sin dejar de lado los sabores de la cocina peruana. Lleva realizando este negocio por más de 2 años y lo hace con ayuda de su cónyuge en algunas ocasiones, pero principalmente trabaja sola.  Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que puede tener un ingreso económico que ella misma genera que le permite solventar las necesidades de su hogar y colaborar con su pareja en la repartición y manejo de los gastos básicos, espera tener con el paso del tiempo un restaurante bien implementado en donde trabaje con mas ganas y atienda con mayor comodidad. Este es el crédito número 4 con MFP, agradece a quienes le brindan la oportunidad para acceder a este crédito financiero que le brinda la seguridad para continuar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual ya que no desea dejar una imagen negativa en los miembros de su grupo que se caracterizan por la puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos.
Con el préstamo de 800 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de ingredientes e insumos que usa en la preparación de sus potajes como arroz, aceitunas, huevos, condimentos, vinagres, palitos de anticuchería, carnes entre otros.
texts.en:
Nelvy, age 30, is an enterprising and very hard-working woman.  She lives with Frank, and they have three children, ages 11, 9, and 5.  She lives in her own house with all of the members of her family.  She puts forth great effort day after day in order to be the best and to provide them with all of the best.

Nelvy has been selling food since she was a young woman.  She works every day on the sidewalk of her house, where she sets up a table, chairs, and a cooking area where she makes the most delicious “anticuchos” [kebabs] and “juanes” [a regional dish of rice and meat, wrapped and cooked in a bijao or banana leaf].  They are a delight to her customers.

She occasionally offers other types of dishes to get out of the routine, but she does this without leaving behind the flavors of the Peruvian kitchen.  She has had this business for over two years.  Her husband helps her at times, but she primarily works alone. 
 
What she likes about her business activity is that she is able to have income that she generates herself.  This allows her to pay for the household necessities and to work with her life partner in the distribution and management of the basic expenses.  She hopes that with the passage of time she will have a well-established restaurant where she works more enthusiastically and carries out her work more comfortably.

This is her fourth loan with MFP.  She is grateful to those who provide her this opportunity of a loan.  This gives her the security to continue working.  She pledges, once more, to make her payments punctually because she does not want to give a negative impression to the members of her group who are known for their punctual and responsible payments.

She will use this loan for 800 soles to buy ingredients and supplies to use in the preparation of her meals.  She will buy things like rice, olives, eggs, condiments, vinegar, kebab sticks, and meat, among others.

loans.use: to buy rice, olives, eggs, condiments, vinegar, kebab sticks, and meat, among others.

loans.name: Money Finders Group

texts.en:
Baby is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Baby was born in Lunsar town, about 30 years ago. She is married to a house builder and the couple has 4 children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Baby sells market food – palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), pepper, fish, etc. She has been a businesswoman for many years now. 

With the help of this loan, Baby and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Baby will use her share of the loan to buy palm-oil, onions, margi, pepper, fish, etc. at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm-oil, margi, salt, rice, oil, tomatoes, salts, etc., at wholesale to add to her current inventory

loans.name: Aminatou

texts.fr: Âgée de 23ans, madame Aminatou est mariée à un infirmier et ils n’ont pas encore des enfants en charge. En 2009, elle revend dans un marché de la place des ignames et d’autres produits. Son lieu d’approvisionnement se situe entre Lomé et les villes environnantes du pays.  Afin d’assurer le bien –être de la famille et augmenter le fonds de commerce de son activité, elle sollicite un premier prêt pour s’acheter des ignames, vendre aux clients et pour pouvoir attendre son objectif.
texts.en: Twenty-three years old, Aminatou is married to a nurse and they don't have any children yet. In 2009, she began reselling yams and other products in a market of her locale. She gets her supplies in Lomé and in the surrounding villages of the country. In order to ensure the well-being of her family and increase the goodwill of her business, she is requesting a first loan to buy yams, resell them to clients and be able to attain her goals.

loans.use: to buy yams and other products.

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr: Revendeuse de pagnes de façon ambulante, madame Awussi âgée de 46ans est mère de 03 enfants dont 02 scolarisés. Son conjoint est électricien. Elle est en manque de fonds c’est pour cela, elle sollicite de WAGES un troisième crédit pour s’acheter des pagnes en différents motifs. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité et assurer l’épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en: Reseller of 'pagne' cloth as an intinerant saleswoman, Awussi is 46 years old and mother to 3 children of whom 2 go to school. Her spouse is an electrician. She lacks funds and because of this, she is requesting a third loan from WAGES to buy 'pagne' cloth of different patterns. She wants to reinvest in her business and ensure the self-fulfillment of her family.

loans.use: to buy 'pagne' cloth.

loans.name: Al-Lwa Al-Akhthr Group

texts.en:
This group is called AL-Lwa Al-Akhthr which consists of five members. They live in Sana`a, Yemen. they applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB.
Asmhan is 32 years old and is married. She has three children. She is a seamstress who designs high-end fashion. She receives orders for women’s blouse, skirts and dresses. She is working in her home. She is an industrious individual who has been working from five years of age. Thanks to her efforts, she has acquired many customers. 

She is requesting a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB so that she can buy household appliances. She is grateful for the assistance she has received, which will be very advantageous.

loans.use: to buy appliances for her house.

loans.name: Kmal

texts.en:
Kmal is 30 years old, married with one child who is 5 years old. He works selling stationery supplies, writing materials, books, etc.

He sells a variety of products according to the season. He has added with his bookstore a small phone calling center. He lives in Sana, Yemen. He is asking for a loan in order to stock up on merchandise including the purchase of school supplies for his bookstore. He is a person who meets his payments and is trustworthy and hardworking. He dreams to own a house and expand his business to big stationary.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies for his bookstore.

loans.name: Tchotcho

texts.fr: Madame Tchotcho âgée de 40ans, vit avec ses enfants à Lomé. Elle est revendeuse de profession et vend des appareils électro ménagers sur étalage depuis 2008. Pour agrandir son activité, elle sollicite de WAGES un premier prêt pour s’approvisionner en marchandises afin de mieux répondre aux besoins de clients. Avec les profits, elle voudrait acheter une moto et assurer les besoins primaires de la famille.
texts.en: Tchotcho is 40 years old and lives with her children in Lomé. She is a reseller by profession and has been selling electric household appliances which she displays since 2008. To expand her business, she is requesting a first loan from WAGES to stock up in merchandise in order to better respond to the needs of her clients. With the profits, she would like to buy a motorcycle and ensure the primary needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy electric household appliances.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Hace varios años Gerardo trabajaba en una empresa de vigilancia, pero debido a la separación de la madre de sus 2 hijos, se vio obligado a dejar su trabajo para poder cuidar de sus hijos. Con la necesidad de conseguir un empleo o generar ingresos para su hogar, un amigo suyo le ayudó para ubicarse en un puesto del centro de la ciudad donde ya lleva unos 11 años vendiendo productos de uso personal, y gracias a este negocio genera los ingresos que requiere en su hogar para ofrecer una buena calidad de vida a sus 2 hijos. Gerardo necesita aumentar sus ventas para poder tener mejores ingresos, pues uno de sus hijos se encuentra muy enfermo y no ha podido tener acceso a la salud, por esto es que busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal y ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes y aumentar sus ventas, para poder ofrecerle la salud a su hijo.

Su sueño es tener un mejor negocio, cada vez más grande y en un futuro ubicarse dentro de un local para generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas. También aspira a ofrecerle a sus 2 hijos una mejor educación y una mejor calidad de vida en el hogar.
texts.en:
Gerardo worked for several years for a security company.  However, due to the separation from the mother of his two children, he felt obliged to leave his work in order to be able to take care of his children.

He needed to find work or generate income for his household, and a friend helped him establish a stand in the center of the city.  He has been there for 11 years selling personal use products.  Thanks to this business, he generates the income needed for his household in order to provide his two children with a better quality of life.

Gerardo needs to increase his sales in order to be able to have better income.  One of his children is very ill, and he has not been able to have access to health care.  That is why he is looking for a loan to buy personal use products and to offer his customers a greater variety of products.  He wants to increase sales in order to be able to provide his son with health care.

His dream is to have a better business that continues to grow.  In the future he dreams of being in a place and generating employment for those who need it the most.  He also aspires to give his two children a better education and a better quality of life at home.

loans.use: to buy personal use products in order to increase sales so that he can provide his son with health care.

loans.name: Najeeb

texts.en:
Najeeb is 33 years old. He is a joyful man and full of life. He is married and has three children. He is raising them very lovingly and wants to provide them with the best quality of life so that they have a future with no financial problems. 

Najeeb's work is selling sweets. He has been in this business for four years, and during this time he has honed his distributing skills and improved his customer service. He likes his job because it allows him to stay physically active and, at the same time, generate financial income to cover home expenses. He applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy sweets, and he wants to keep working and to continue advancing his business in the future by having a store selling larger quantities of sweets and improving the infrastructure of his food business.

loans.use: to buy sweets for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains, meats, chicken, bananas, plantains, vegetables, oil, and fruits to make juices with on a daily basis

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits cosmétiques au marché, Ayawa âgée de 29ans est mariée à un revendeur et a 01 enfant de 02 ans qui ne va pas encore à l’école. En 2003, elle a démarré son activité qui lui va bien car cela l’aide à prêter main forte à son conjoint dans les charges du foyer. Comme les demandes deviennent de plus en plus importantes, elle fait recours à WAGES par un troisième prêt pour s’acheter des produits cosmétiques. Comme perspectives d’avenir, elle voudrait élargir son activité tout en prenant soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Reseller of cosmetics at the market, Ayawa is 29 years old. She is married to a reseller and has one child who is two years old who does not go to school yet. 

In 2003, she started her business which is going well because it helps her to lend a hand to her spouse in taking care of the household responsibilities. 

As the demands are becoming greater and greater, she is requesting a third loan from WAGES to buy cosmetics. For the future, she would like to expand her business while taking care of her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Tursun

texts.ru: Турсуну 49 лет. Она вдова и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Ее дети несовершеннолетние  и поэтому она единственная кормилица в семье. Более 15 лет она работает в телекоммуникационной организации и получает маленькую зарплату. Она решила организовать  бизнес для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей  скота. От полученного дохода она планирует улучшить условию жизни. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 500 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Tursun is 49 years old, a widow and raising two children.  Her children are not of age yet, and this is why she is the sole provider for the family.  Tursun has been working at a telecommunications organization for over 15 years and earning a small salary.  She decided to organize her own business to improve the family's welfare.  With this goal in mind, she completed the "Achieve Success" course, organized by the Association of Business Women, and obtained a certificate.  She wants to start a business of buying and selling livestock.  She plans to use the resulting income to improve her life conditions.  Tursun is requesting a loan in the amount of 500 somoni to buy livestock in order to organize her new business.  She relies on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to organize her new business

loans.name: Luz Amalia

texts.es:
Luz Amalia tiene un almacén donde ofrece productos de uso personal a sus clientes y gracias al cual puede generar los ingresos que requiere su familia. El negocio lo inició hace un tiempo cuando su padre le ofreció un local que construyó en su vivienda y desde entonces Luz Amalia trabaja para cooperar junto con su esposo para los ingresos de la familia. Gracias a su negocio, la calidad de vida en su hogar ha mejorado considerablemente y es por esto que siempre busca que su negocio siga creciendo para que su familia pueda seguir teniendo un mayor bienestar en el hogar. Debido a que se acerca la temporada de amor y amistad, donde sus ventas aumentan considerablemente, Luz Amalia busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal para surtir su almacén y mejorar sus ventas.

Su sueño es seguir con este negocio para seguir ofreciendo una mejor calidad de vida en su hogar. Además, sueña con poder comprar su casa propia y ofrecer a su familia un hogar más estable.
texts.en:
Luz Amalia has a small neighborhood shop where she sells personal use products to her customers. Thanks to her shop, she is able to generate income that her family needs.

She started her business a while back when her father offered her a space that he had built in his residence. Since then, Luz Amalia has worked to help her husband with the family income. Thanks to her business, the quality of life in their home has improved considerably. That's why she is always looking for ways to grow her business: so that her family will be able to continue enjoying a better sense of well-being at home. Because the season of love and friendship is approaching, when her sales will increase considerably, Luz Amalia is seeking a loan so that she can buy personal use products to stock in her store and improve her sales.

Luz Amalia's dream is to continue with this business to continue providing her household with a better quality of life. In addition, she dreams of being able to buy her own house and to give her family a more stable home.

loans.use: to buy personal use products to stock her neighborhood shop and improve her sales.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.es:
Amparo se encuentra casada y tiene 2 hijos, y debido a que los ingresos que estaba generando su esposo no eran suficientes para el sostenimiento de los gastos del hogar, desde hace 3 años decidió montar su propio negocio de confecciones desde su vivienda. La actividad la aprendió de una familia suya que se la enseñó hace un tiempo y desde entonces viene confeccionando ropa deportiva y vestidos de baño para mujeres y hombres. Pese a las dificultades económicas que presenta en su hogar, su esfuerzo le ha permitido ir saliendo adelante y ahora tiene muy buenos pedidos, por esto busca un préstamo para comprar insumos como telas, hilos, resortes y otros más para confeccionar los pedidos que tiene por parte de sus clientes.

Su sueño es poder sacar este negocio adelante y poder ubicarlo en un lugar más cómodo, preferiblemente si es fuera de su casa para poder ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a sus 2 hijos.
texts.en:
Amparo is married with two  children, and three years ago, when the income that her husband was making was insufficient to sustain their home, she decided to start her own garment business from her home. She learned this trade from a family member awhile back and since then has been making sportswear and bathing suits for men and women. Facing the economic difficulties from home, her efforts have allowed her to get ahead and now she a good amount of orders. For this reason she is requesting a loan in order to purchase supplies such as fabric, thread, elastic, and other items in order to complete the orders she has for her clients. 

She hopes her business will continue to grow and that she will be able to move her work to a more comfortable place, preferrably outside her home, so that she can provide a better quality of life for her two children.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as fabrics, thread, elastic, and other items to be able to complete orders she has for clients.

loans.name: Thiaba

texts.fr: Madame Thiaba  est une femme divorcée qui vit au Sénégal. Elle s’active depuis plus de 30 ans dans le secteur du commerce et pratique la vente d’habits, de chaussures et de de sacs a mains. Elle consacre huit de temps de la journée a son activité. Les revenus que lui génère son activité lui permettent de supporter la dépense quotidienne ainsi que les frais d’électricité de sa famille. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’UIMCEC. Elle sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs prévu pour  l’achat de marchandises qu’elle commercialise. Son intention est de renforcer son fond  de roulement mais aussi  de diversifier les articles qu’elle vend afin d’accroitre ses bénéfices. Ainsi elle pourra  épargner	 de l’argent et en meme temps améliorer les conditions alimentaires de sa famille. Son projet futur est de voyager vers d’autres destinations plus intéressantes en matière d’approvisionnement  en marchandises.
texts.en:
Thiaba is a divorced woman who lives in Sénégal. For more than 30 years she has been active in shopkeeping and sells clothing, shoes and handbags. She devotes eight hours a day to her business. The income that her business generates allows her to pay for her daily expenses as well as the electricity bill for her family. 

She is a member of one of the branches of the UIMCEC. She is requesting a loan of 400,000 frs to buy merchandise that she will resell. Her intention is to strengthen her working capital but also to diversify the items that she sells in order to grow her profits. Thus she will be able to save money and at the same time improve the nutritional conditions of her family. Her future project is to travel to other destinations that are more interesting as far as supplying merchandise.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes and handbags to resell.

loans.name: Nodira

texts.ru: Нодире 36 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Она очень трудолюбивая женщина. Она умеет вязать разные вещи как носки, шапки, шарф, безрукавка и т.п. Она хочет организовать свой бизнес и использовать свое ремесло. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 500 сомони для покупки нити для пряжи, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nodira is 36 years old, married and raising four children.  She is a very hardworking woman.  She can knit various things, such as socks, hats, scarves, vests and the like.  Nodira wants to organize her own business and use her skills.  With this goal in mind, she completed the "Achieve Success" course, organized by the Association of Business Women, and obtained a certificate.  Nodira is requesting a loan in the amount of 500 somoni to purchase yarn thread in order to start her own business.  She relies on your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase yarn thread in order to start her own business

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es:
María Eugenia es una joven de 25 años de edad, madre soltera de dos hijas hoy en día estudiante, trabajó como mesera en un restaurante, ha pasado dificultades con sus pequeñas cuando se enferman, al no tener la ayuda del padre, pero he salido adelante. 
Su casa es sencilla de tabla de madera y laminas de zinc, pero propia, ha querido hacerles mejora pero no ha tenido el dinero suficiente para lograrlo hacer, ya que tiene que cubrir la alimentación, pago de gastos básicos, estudios, medicina, pasaje.
Es atraves del financiamiento que está optando para poder cambiar su zinc, ya que está malo con hoyos y se le está pasando el agua, en esta temporada de invierno. Materiales a comprar: diez laminas de zinc, seis perlines, golosos para hacer la mejora. y estar en mejores condiciones habitacional e higiene.
texts.en:
María Eugenia is a young woman of 25 and a single mother of two daughters currently students. 

She has worked as a waitress in a restaurant. She has been through some difficulties with her daughters when they get sick, as she doesn't have any help from the father, but she has kept moving on. 

Her house is simple, with wooden boards and metal sheeting, but it is her own. She has wanted to improve them, but she hasn't had enough money to be able to do it, since she has to cover the costs of food, basic expenses, school, medicine, and fares. 

It is through the loan that she’s requesting to change her sheet metal, as it’s gone bad from holes and the water is coming through in this winter season. She is glad to be able to make this change that is being made possible only through AFODENIC. The materials to buy are: ten metal sheets, six support beams and screws to make the improvement, and to be in better living and hygienic conditions.

loans.use: to purchase sheet metal, support beams, and screws for fixing her roof.

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es:
Luz Dary es una madre soltera cabeza de hogar de sus 2 hijos de 6 y 15 años de edad, y debido a que ella sola debe responder por todas las obligaciones de su hogar, la situación económica de su familia constantemente tiene grandes dificultades. Sin embargo, Luz Dary siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajadora y en el momento trabaja en su propio salón de belleza, donde además tiene ubicado un almacén donde ofrece productos de uso personal. Como no cuenta con mucho capital, ha tenido que ver como sus ventas disminuyen por no poder ofrecer los productos que necesitan sus clientes; es por esto que ahora busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal y surtir su negocio para aumentar sus ventas.

Su sueño es poder tener separado el almacén y el salón de belleza de su casa, para así tener una mejor calidad de vida en su hogar. Además, continuar haciendo crecer su negocio y mejorar los ingresos para que su familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luz Dary is a single mother head of household with two children, ages 6 and 15.  She has to take care of all the household obligations because she's alone.  Her family's financial situation always has big problems.  Nevertheless, Luz Dary always has been hardworking.

At the moment she works in her own beauty salon where she also has a store where she sells personal products.  She doesn't have a lot of capital, so she has seen her sales decline because she doesn't have the products her customers need.

This is why she's looking for a loan to buy personal products to supply her business to increase her sales.  

Her dream is to be able to separate her store and beauty salon from her house so she has a better quality of life at home.  She also wants to continue growing her business and improving her income so her family has a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy personal products to supply her business

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Koffi est marié à une employée de société. Ils ont 03 enfants tous sur les bancs d’école. Le premier est âgé de 11ans et le dernier 05ans. Il est rebobineur de formation. En plus de son activité, il vend  des CD et projette des films et des jeux vidéo. Cette activité qu’il mène à domicile lui permet de s’occuper de la famille. Avec ce quatrième prêt, qu’il a WAGES, il va s’acheter des CD et des accessoires de jeux vidéo. Il veut plus assurer l’épanouissement de la famille et rendre pérenne l’activité.
texts.en:
Koffi is married to a corporate employee. They have three children, all in different grade levels. Their oldest child is 11 years old, and their youngest is five. He is a winder by training.

In addition to his occupation, he is an entrepreneur who sells CDs and holds movie and video game screenings. This business, which he runs from his home, allows him to care for his family. With this, his fourth loan through WAGES, Koffi will be able to purchase CDs and video game accessories. He would like to make his business sustainable for the long term, as he wants to be sure that his family is able to develop to their fullest potential.

loans.use: to purchase CDs and video game accessories.

loans.name: Ku-Mem Group

texts.en:
Kadie is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Born in Mano, she is 40 years old, married to a medical officer and the mother of seven children, four of whom are attending secondary and tertiary institutions. Kadie sells gara lappers (locally dyed clothes) and Bamako clothes (clothes dyed in Mali). She has been a businesswoman for many years now.

With the help of this loan, Kadie and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales, and thereby improve their living conditions. Kadie will use her share of the loan to buy gara lapper-making materials – ink, caustic soda, powder, white cotton clothes, etc. in order to produce a larger quantity of clothes for sale.

loans.use: to buy gara lapper-making materials – ink, caustic soda, powder, white cotton clothes, etc. in order to produce a larger quantity of clothes for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a coverstitch machine

loans.name: Flor Silvestre Group

texts.es:
El grupo Flor Silvestre lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas Flor quien compra y vende muebles desde hace 6 años negocio en el que invertirá el crédito con la compra de sillas,  silla campana, sillas brisas, y muebles rústicos.
Las otras integrantes son Raquel quien tiene una pulpería desde hace 2 años y Blanca tiene un taller de mueblería en el que invertirá el crédito con la compra de madera, cellador, lija…etc.
texts.en:
The group Flor Silvestre is made up of three people who are hard workers and entrepreneurs.  One of them is Flor, who has bought and sold furniture for the last 6 years.  She will invest this loan into the purchase of chairs, wide rocking chairs, narrow rocking chairs, and rustic furniture.  

The other members are Raquel, who has owned a store for 2 years and Blanca who has a furniture workshop in which she will invest the loan into the purchase of wood, sealant, sandpaper, etc.

loans.use: to purchase furniture, primarily rustic-style wooden chairs

loans.name: Gloria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Gloria del Carmen es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien se dedica a la marroquinería, es decir elabora carteras, billeteras, pulseras, fajas…etc. de cuero. Este negocio lo inicio con su esposo y poco a poco ha ido mejorándolo.
Ella ha participado de las capacitaciones que dio adim y es una de las mujeres empoderadas que saben distribuir su tiempo, su dinero y los oficios es por ello que fue la propuesta de ADIM a ASOMIF para que fuera a exponer a V Conferencia Centroamericana de Microfinanzas. Además ha sido beneficiada con los planes de negocio lo que le ayudo a mejorar su taller.

El crédito lo invertirá en cuero, pega, hilo y mano de obra
texts.en:
Gloria del Carmen is a hardworking and enterprising woman who makes a living in leather goods, that is to say, she makes wallets, billfolds, bracelets and belts, for example, out of leather.  She started this business with her husband and little by little it has been improving.

She has participated in three trainings that ADIM gave and is one of the empowered women that knows how to distribute her time, her money and services.  For that reason it was the proposal of ADIM to ASOMIF that she go to exhibit at the Fifth Central American Microfinance Conference.  In addition, she has benefited with business plans that helped her to improve her workshop.

She will invest the loan in leather, glue, thread and labor.

loans.use: to buy leather, thread, glue, etc.

loans.name: Al-Ahood Group

texts.en: This group, called Al-Ahood, consists of five women who live in Hadramout, Yemen.  Fatoom is a 31-year-old married woman with one child.  She has been running a fruit and vegetables business.  She started with a small amount of working capital.  Her hardships are the seasonal nature of the business and the inadequate capital to purchase stock.  Her personal goal is to educate her child, to expand her business, and to own a wholesale operation.  She wants a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy more vegetables for sale.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for sale

loans.name: Asem

texts.en: Asem is a 23-year-old single man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen.  For the past three years, he has had a store where he sells mobile phones for customers.  This has been a profitable project and the only source of income for him, but he needs more help to cover the costs. Asem started his business with limited income that he gained from people who employed him.  His family was relying on him for help with expenses.  This is the second loan which will be provided from Kiva.  He is requesting a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to cover the costs of purchasing an additional collection of mobile phones in order to provide better choices to his loyal customers.

loans.use: to purchase more items including chargers, rechargeable phone cards, and mobile phone covers for his business.

loans.name: Murad

texts.en: Murad is an IDP (internally displaced person) from the city of Fuzuli.  He and his family currently live in the greater Fuzuli region.  Murad is 36 years old and is married with 2 children. He loves his work and enjoys spending his time thinking of ways to improve his business.  Murad now needs a loan of 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijani new manat) in order to buy new, Azerbaijan national musical instruments (tar, kamancha, balaban, etc.) for resale.  Murad has run his shop to sell Azerbaijan national and other musical instruments for five years.

loans.use: to buy new musical instruments

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es:
Luis aprendió la actividad de la agricultura por parte de sus padres quienes siempre se dedicaron a esta actividad, y gracias a esto ahora cuenta con una gran experiencia que le permite tener productos de muy buena calidad. Ahora que Luis se encuentra casado y tiene 2 hijos de 12 y 13 años de edad, tiene esta actividad del cultivo de verduras como su fuente de ingresos y la cual le permita ofrecerle a su familia una calidad de vida digna. Debido a que está padeciendo fuertes problemas económicos, Luis busca el apoyo en un préstamo para comprar insumos como semillas y abonos para sacar adelante sus cultivos y aumentar sus ventas.

Su sueño es tener un gran cultivo y seguir generando sus ingresos por este medio. Además de poder ofrecerles a sus 2 hijos en el futuro el acceso a una educación universitaria.
texts.en:
Luis learned agriculture from his parents, who always did farm work, and now he has the considerable experience he needs to produce high quality products. Luis is married and has two children, ages 12 and 13. Growing vegetables is his source of income for providing his family with a decent standard of living. 

Since he has financial problems, Luis is seeking a loan to buy supplies like seeds and fertilizer to plant his crops and increase his sales. He dreams of producing a great harvest and, therefore, continuing to generate income. He also wants to be able to send his children to the university in the future.

loans.use: to buy supplies like seeds and fertilizer to plant his crops and increase his sales.

loans.name: Tesnesa Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Tesnesa” group from Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 700,000 for each member. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Alhaji is the leader of this group. The 40-year-old is married to a trader. They have four children: two in primary school and two in secondary. Alhaji has been a businessman for 17 years. He buys and sells scrap metal. He has requested this loan in order to buy more scrap metal for resale.

loans.use: to buy more scrap metal.

loans.name: Sabenty Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Sabenty” group from Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 700,000 for each member. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Baby is the featured leader of this group. The 42-year-old is married and has five children: two in primary school and three in secondary. Baby has been a businesswoman for 25 years.  She sells soft drinks. She is going to use her share of this loan to buy crates of soft drinks for resale.

loans.use: to buy crates of soft drinks.

loans.name: Promise To Pay Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Promise to Pay” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each member to invest in their businesses. 

Abubakarr is the leader of this group. Abubakarr is a 27-year-old man, married with one child who is not yet old enough for school.  Abubakarr sells shoes and clothing and has been in this business for 10 years. With the help of this loan, Abubakarr will invest in his business by buying different kinds of shoes and clothing in large quantities to resell.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of shoes and clothing in large quantities.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en: Lita is an active micro-fiance member of PMPC. She 46 years old and is married with 4 adult-age children.  She lives in Pisong B, in the province of Siquijor. She engages in sari-sari store (small general store) business for a period of 4 years earning PHP 700 a month.  She is requesting a loan from PMPC in the amount of PHP 5,000 intended to purchase additional grocery stocks for sale. She plans to use the money to support family needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery stock for sale

loans.name: Ta-Ram Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Ta-Ram” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders for a loan of SLL 1,000,000 for each member of the group in order to invest in their businesses. 

Maseray is the leader of this group. Maseray is a 40-year-old woman, married with four children: three in primary school and one in secondary school. Maseray sells beans, rice, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), and other food products. She has been a businesswoman for 20 years. With the help of this loan, Maseray will invest in her business by buying food for resale.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, palm oil, etc..

loans.name: Genin De Jesus

texts.es:
Genin es una persona muy trabajadora que durante muchos años viene trabajando como empleado en una carpintería, pero debido a que los ingresos que allí genera no son suficientes para sostener su familia, ahora busca poder trabajar de manera independiente. Pese a su esfuerzo diariamente, las dificultades económicas en su hogar no han podido superarse, y es esto lo que ha motivado a que Genin busque un préstamo para comprar una motosierra y pueda comenzar la actividad de la carpintería de manera independiente.

Su sueño es poder tener mejor estabilidad económica en el hogar y ofrecerle a su esposa y sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, por esto espera que trabajando por su cuenta estas condiciones mejoren y pueda cumplir su sueño.
texts.en:
Genin is a very hardworking person who has been employed for many years in a woodworking shop, but because the income he makes there is not enough to sustain his family, he is now interested in working for himself. Despite his daily efforts, he has not been able to overcome the economic difficulties in his home, and that is what has motivated Genin to seek a loan so that he can buy a power saw and be able to start working independently as a carpenter.

His dream is to be able to have better economic stability in his home and to provide his wife and children with a better quality of life. He hopes that by working on his own, these conditions will improve and he can make his dream come true.

loans.use: to buy a power saw and be able to begin working independently as a carpenter.

loans.name: Aylen Group

texts.en:
Aylen is the leader of her group.   She is 40 years old and lives in Catadman, Ozamiz City.  Aylen has been operating her general store for almost 2 years.  She is married and has 3 beautiful and gorgeous daughter.

Aylen has requested a loan to purchase rice, sugar, salt, snack food, noodles, canned goods, beverages, soft drinks, spices, etc.  She hopes to expand her bussiness as soon as she can.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
This is Melody, 40, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Reynaldo, an employee, and mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Melody operates a cell-phone retailing business. What she basically does is buy cell-phone units from a supplier and sell them with a little profit. Her products are mobile handsets. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional stocks of mobile and cell-phone units to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Melody hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years and dreams to give her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of mobile phones to sell

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 51 years old and lives in Pulot, Ozamiz City. She is married and has 5 adult children.

Luzminda is operating a general store at her place.  She has been doing this for almost 6 years and earns approximately PHP 2000 every week. She requested a loan to purchase more stocks for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste, and beverages.

Luzminda has been a member of PMPC for almost 4 years. She hopes to expand her business next year.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Fedila

texts.en: Fedila is 39 years old and lives in Tinago, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has 4 school-aged children. Fedila has a store and earns approximately PHP 2000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 14900 to buy sacks of rice, sugar, salt, snack foods, noodles, canned goods, spices, etc.  Fedila has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Samphors

texts.en:
Samphors is 23 years old. She is married and resides with her parents and one child in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a homemaker. Her husband (who is with her in the picture) runs a business selling ice cream and ice coffee. He earns about $3 per day. 

In order to improve her husband’s business, Samphors is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase a motorbike and a trailer for her husband to carry ice cream and ice coffee to sell around the village. This purchase will help him generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand the business and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: buy motorbike and trailer to sell ice cream

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela is widow with 1 child.  Marcela is 53 years old and lives in Guingona, Ozamiz City.

To earn a living Marcela has a general store.  She earns approximately PHP 3000 a month. She has requested a loan of PHP 5000 to purchase more stock for her general store such as shampoo, toothpaste and beverages. 

Marcela has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, she hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Sokea

texts.en:
Sokea is 43 years old. She is married and resides with her three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than three years, earning approximately $5 daily. Her husband runs a sawing service (he cuts down the trees to make firewood).  He earns about $8 per day. 

Sokea is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase rice seeds, fertilizer and pesticides to use for farming. This purchase will help her crops grow well and provide a high yield. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: buy rice seeds, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is an active member of PMPC under the micro-finance program.  She is 52 years of age, married and has 2 school-aged children.  Her major economic activity is making and selling snacks.  She has operated the business for over 10 years, earning a monthly average of PHP 2,000. 

Saturnina took a loan from PMPC to purchase raw ingredients to make snacks for sale.  She hopes to earn more to invest in the business and to support her family needs.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make snacks to sell

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
This is Maribel, 33, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Joseph, an electrician, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Maribel operates a buy and sell business. She buys silver accessories then sells them to customers with a profit. Her customers are her neighbors and people in the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 3000 in sales every week.

To help her continue the operations of her business, Maribel is requesting a PHP 30, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Maribel dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education and hopes that her business would grow through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy jewelry to resell

loans.name: Thet

texts.en:
Thet is 45 years old. She is married and resides with her four children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in cultivating rice and cassavas for more than ten years, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband is a traditional musician who earns about $5 each day. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $5 per day. 

Thet is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase a walking tractor to use for tilling her farmland. This purchase will help her reduce farming expenses. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn their bachelor’s degree. Moreover, she hopes to build a new bigger house.

loans.use: to a walking tractor to till her land

loans.name: Erdenechimeg

texts.en: Ms. Erdenechimeg is 48 years old and lives with her husband and 7 children in a yurt in Tosontsengel soum of Zavhan province. She has been operating a clothes sewing business with her family for 7 years.  In the future, she will teach her daughters about needlework and buy additional needlework equipment. Her family is nice and polite. She is requesting 550,000 MNT to buy a modernized warm insulation cover for her yurt.  She said: "(the) loan is very helpful for our life."  She is a hardworking and cheerful person.

loans.use: to buy a modernized warm insulation cover for her yurt

loans.name: Pech

texts.en:
Pech is 26 years old. She is married and resides with one child in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in an agricultural business and selling palm juice for more than three years, earning approximately $6 per day. Her husband (who is joining her in the picture) helps her run the business.

In order to improve her family’s finances, Pech is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase piglets to breed and resell when they gain weight. By doing so, she would earn additional income to financially support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to breed and resell when they gain weight

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a microfinance member of PMPC.  She is 56 years of age and married with 8 adult children.  She is residing in Bonga, Maria, Siquijor.  She has been engaged in making and selling snacks for almost 5 years, with a monthly average income of 2,000 PHP.

Lately she decided to engage in raising pigs to have an additional source of family income aside from selling snacks. She took a loan from PMPC to purchase a piglet and feed.  She plans to use the profit to support the family's needs and to save for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase a piglet and feed

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 39 years old and married with 2 children.

Annabelle works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 24,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy grocery items like soft drinks, bread, biscuits and other grocery items.

Annabelle has borrowed and repaid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from selling cosmetic products.

Annabelle aspires to save enough money to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy grocery items like soft drinks, bread, biscuits and other grocery items

loans.name: Sierilyn

texts.en: Sierilyn is an active member of PMPC. She is 33 years old and married with one school-age child. She has been engaged in a piggery for a period of three years with an average monthly income of PHP 2,000. She took another loan from PMPC in the amount of PHP 14,500 to purchase feed and medicine for the raised pigs. She plans to use the profit to invest more capital for her livelihood activity.

loans.use: to purchase feed and medicine

loans.name: Francisco Eduardo

texts.es:
Francisco trabaja desde hace 10 años en la actividad de la venta de pescados y con esta ha venido generando los ingresos para su hogar donde convive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos. Gracias a su esfuerzo diario, ha podido ir superando las grandes dificultades económicas que padecen en su hogar, y esto ha permitido que sus hijos y su esposa puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida. Desde hace un tiempo comenzó a vender sus productos por las calles, caminando de puerta a puerta buscando sus clientes, y gracias a que de esta manera ha podido aumentar sus ventas, Francisco busca un préstamo para comprar pescado y responder a las ventas con sus clientes.

Su sueño es sacar este negocio adelante y que le permita en un futuro tener una vejez digna y también ofrecerles a sus hijos el acceso a una educación universitaria.
texts.en:
Francisco has worked in his business selling fish for 10 years. With this, he has has been generating income for his household, which consists of his wife and four children. 

Thanks to his daily effort, he has been able to gradually overcome the great financial difficulties that his household suffers, and this has enabled his wife and children to have a better quality of life. 

He began selling his products some time ago as a street vendor, looking for customers by going door-to-door. Thanks to the fact that he has been able to increase his sales this way, Francisco is seeking a loan to buy fish, to keep up with his sales to customers. 

His dream is to make this business successful, allowing him to have a decent old age, and also provide his children with access to a university education.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a microfinance member of PMPC.  She is 44 years old and married with 1 adult child and 2 school-age children.  Her primary source of income is making and selling snacks, which she has operated for over 31 years.

She took a loan in PMPC in the amount of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional raw ingredients to make snacks.  She plans to use the profit to invest in the business and to support the daily needs of the family.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients to make snacks

loans.name: Bazardari

texts.en: Bazardari is 24 years old and lives with his wife and son in a yurt (ger) in Uvs province. They are a young couple. He has lately started a woodwork industry (making up the roof, the opening and frame on top of a ger and door). He is planning to do this business constantly in the future. He is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy raw materials for woodwork industry. He said "I had already gotten order for my new business from clients in this month." He is a hardworking person.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for woodwork industry

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 34 years old and married with four children.

Mary Ann works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Mary Ann has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

Mary Ann aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Micelda

texts.en:
Micelda is 33 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Micelda has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from raising pigs and selling charcoal.

Micelda aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina de 55 años, está casada con César con quien tiene 6 hijos. Ella y su esposo viven juntos en una casa propia al lado de una nieta. Cristina es una mujer muy responsable. Se dedica a la atención a clientes en su fuente de soda donde ofrece, gaseosas, helados, tortas, pasteles, etc. Lleva como 15 años en esta actividad y menciona que le va muy bien, porque conversa con sus clientes quienes son vecinos y amigos, y se siente a gusto. Hace 4 meses, invirtió en la compra de computadoras, y así abrió otro negocio de cabinas de Internet. 
Ella y su esposo se encargan de atender ambos negocios. “Estoy contenta, porque a mi edad, todavía trabajo y gano lo necesario para vivir decentemente”, dice. Cristina antes se dedicaba a a la agricultura y gracias a su esfuerzo logró ahorrar e invertir en estos negocios.
Su principal urgencia es adquirir más bebidas y helados para su fuete de soda, que son muy solicitados por el intenso calor. Además necesita realizar el mantenimiento de sus computadoras. Éste es su crédito número 13 con MFP, y se muestra muy entusiasta con el desempeño en equipo, porque es una tesorera puntual. Su banco comunal “Los Pioneros de Capelo”, es uno de los más antiguos de la zona, ella es consciente de ello y se siente orgullosa. Invertirá el dinero en la compra de helados y bebidas gaseosas para su fuete de soda, también pagará por los servicios de mantenimiento de sus máquinas.
texts.en:
Cristina, 55, is married to César and they have six children.  She and her husband live together in their own house with a granddaughter.  Cristina is a responsible woman.  She tends to customers in her soda fountain where she sells soft-drinks, ice-cream, sandwiches, cakes, etc.  She’s been in this business about 15 years and mentions that she does very well because she chats with her customers who are neighbors and friends and she feels good.  Four months ago she bought computers and opened another business: Internet access booths.  She and her husband manage both businesses.  She says that she’s very happy because at her age she still works and earns what’s necessary to live decently.  Cristina used to work in agriculture and thanks to her efforts was able to save and invest in these businesses.

Her greatest urgency is to buy more soft-drinks and ice-cream that are in high demand because of the hot weather for her soda fountain.  She also needs to service the computers.

This is her 13th MFP loan and she’s very enthusiastic about her team’s work because she’s its punctual treasurer.  Her “Los Pioneros de Capelo” communal bank is one of the oldest in the zone; she’s aware of that and feels proud.  She will use the money to buy ice-cream and soft-drinks for her soda fountain and also to service her machines.

loans.use: to service computers and also to buy ice-cream and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Doña Guillermina de 39 años de edad, labora como sastra desde hace 8 años, en su casa de habitaciòn en el Barrio Linda Vista de Nueva Guinea, su esposo es maestro de Obra el cual la ayuda con sus gastos personales y con los compromisos adquiridos, esta familia es responsable y muy trabajadora, es reconocida en su barrio, tiene 2 hijas de los cuales se siente orgullosos.                                

Este crèdito lo requiere para mejorar su casa acondicionando su taller de costura y asi poderle ofrecer mejores condiciones a sus clientes.  Su sueño es mejorar sus condiciones de vidad, que sus hijas sean personas de bien y que no les falte lo basico en el hogar.
texts.en:
Guillermina is 39 years old. She has been working as a seamstress for 8 years in her house located in Linda Vista, a neighborhood of the town of Nueva Guinea. Her husband is a master builder and he helps her paying for their personal expenses as well as for the engagements they have undertaken. This is a responsible and very hardworking family: they are well-known in their neighborhood and they have 2 daughters they are very proud of.

The loan she is requesting will be used to make improvements to her house by equipping her sewing workshop in order to offer better serving conditions to her customers. She dreams of improving her standard of living, that her daughters become respectable people and that her household never lacks of basic commodities.

loans.use: To make improvements to her house.

loans.name: Jose Albeiro

texts.es:
Jose inició el negocio de la tienda general desde hace unos 2 años buscando mejorar la situación económica del hogar y ofrecer una mayor estabilidad para su familia. Pese a no contar con mucho capital, su esfuerzo le ha permitido ir superando grandes dificultades que se le han presentado y es así como poco a poco ha venido creciendo en ventas. Gracias a su negocio, su esposa y sus 5 hijos han podido ver como su calidad de vida mejora y es por esto que Jose cada vez se esfuerza más para seguir mejorando la calidad de vida en el hogar. Debido a que no cuenta con el capital suficiente, Jose busca un préstamo para comprar productos de la canasta familiar y una estantería para aumentar la variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener un gran negocio donde pueda generar empleo para las personas más necesitadas y para que su familia también salga adelante.
texts.en: José opened his general store about 2 years ago seeking to improve his home’s economic situation and to offer greater stability for his family.  Despite not having much capital, his efforts have allowed him to gradually overcome the great difficulties that have arisen and he’s thus been gradually expanding sales.  Thanks to his business, his wife and five children have been able to see their quality of life improve and this is why José strives more every day to continue improving his home’s quality of life.  Because he lacks sufficient capital, José seeks a loan to buy basic staples and a display case to increase the variety of products he stocks for his customers.  His greatest dream is to be able to have a business where he can generate employment for the neediest people and so that his family can also move forward.

loans.use: to buy basic staples and a display case.

loans.name: Modesto

texts.en:
Modesto is a father who runs a hog-raising business in his community to gain income for his family. He is 30 years old, married and has one infant child.  He and his wife aim to increase their income so that they can improve their house and save for the future of their child. In this regard, they plan to raise more piglets and chickens to sell in the future. 

Due to insufficient capital, Modesto is asking for a loan of PHP 33,000 to buy feed, vitamins, piglets and materials needed to improve the pigpen. They are hoping that this loan will make it possible for them to improve the business as they continue to work hard and strive for their goal.

loans.use: buy pig feed, vitamins, piglets and to repair his pigpen

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children.  She is from Getafe, Talibon, Bohol, Philippines.  Julieta has owned a motorcycle transport business for seven years now. This is used to transport passengers going from one place to another.

Julieta is in need of financial resources for her motorcycle. She is asking for a loan worth 5000 PHP to buy fuel and spare parts, and to pay for the repair and maintenance of the motorcycle.

In the future, Julieta wants to invest in new ventures to enhance her income so that she can continually support her children for their education.

loans.use: buy fuel, spare parts and repair her motorcycle

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is married and has seven children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  She is 47 years old and has five children who are in school.

Lucy has a fish vending business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 7 years.  She requested a PHP 29500 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

In the future, Lucy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy fish to sell

loans.name: Ma. Sol

texts.en:
Sol is 54 years old and married with 2 children.  She works hard to provide for her family.  Sol runs a general store in the Philippines and has been running it for 10 years.  She also earns an income from a restaurant.   

Sol requested a PHP 50000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell.  She has borrowed and repaid 28 loans from NWTF before this loan.  Sol aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy additional stocks to sell

loans.name: Magnolia

texts.en:
Magnolia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetables vending business in the Philippines.  She  has been in this business for 27 years. She also earns more income from Avon dealing and raising pigs.  Magnolia is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell for her vegetables vending business.  

Magnolia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a clothing sales business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 3 years.

Ritchel requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items like pants, bags, and other clothing to sell.  In the future, Ritchel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 40 years old.  She is married and has 3 children currently in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marlyn runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, canned goods, egg, spices, cooking oil, etc. Marlynn requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell.

In the future, Marlyn would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie is a member of PMPC under the micro-finance program.  She is 37 years of age, married and has 7 school-aged children.  She lives in Sabang, Larena, Siquijor.  She has been engaged in a sari-sari store business for 3 years, earning PHP 1,000 a month.  She took a loan from PMPC to purchase additional grocery stocks for resale.  She plans to use the profit to invest more capital into her business and support the needs of her family.

loans.use: restock her grocery store

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fishing net for her fishing business.

Perlita has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from raising livestock and selling dried fish.

Perlita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to repair and renovate her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing net for her business

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 54 years old and married with five children. Rosita works very hard to provide for them.

Rosita runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store.

Rosita has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, detergent and other groceries. 

In the future Rosita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Jenina

texts.en: Jenina is an active member of PMPC. She is 43 years old and a single mom with three school-age children. She lives in Bitaug, Enrique Villanueva, Siquijor. She has been selling fish for four years, earning a daily average income of Php 100. She took her second loan from PMPC to purchase a new weighing scale and fish for the business. She plans to use the profit to support her children's need.

loans.use: to purchase a scale and fish to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 54 years old and widowed with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items such as rice, soft-drinks and other groceries.

Susan has borrowed and repaid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 12 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Susan aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items such as rice, soft-drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Luis Argemiro

texts.es:
Luis es una persona muy trabajadora que ha sacado con gran esfuerzo su cafetería adelante, y pese a las grandes adversidades que se le han presentado, siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para superarlas y continuar progresando junto a su familia. Hace un tiempo su municipio fue víctima de un gran conflicto de violencia, y esto hizo que desde entonces sus ventas se vieran fuertemente perjudicadas, lo que a su vez hace que sus ingresos para el hogar no sean suficientes. Pero con mucho empeño ha venido sacando su negocio adelante y ahora que sus ventas están mejorando busca un préstamo para comprar surtido para su cafetería.

Su sueño es comprar su propio local y poder ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis is a very hardworking person who, after much effort, has been able to make his café successful, and despite the great challenges that he has faced, he has been strong enough to overcome them and continue prospering alongside his family. Some time ago, his municipality was the center of a violent conflict, which seriously hurt business and in turn, made Luis' earnings insufficient. However, through a lot of hard work and determination, he has been able to keep his business afloat, and now that sales are improving, he is seeking a loan to restock his café.

His dream is to be able to buy his own business space and offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase goods to restock his café.

loans.name: Ana Marleny

texts.es:
Desde hace 15 años Ana Marleny montó su tienda general desde su propia casa con el ánimo de ayudar en su hogar económicamente, pues los ingresos que genera su esposo no son suficientes para el sostenimiento de sus 4 hijos. A pesar de las grandes dificultades económicas que ha tenido, su esfuerzo le permite salir adelante y continuar luchando para sacar su familia adelante y ofrecer en su hogar una mejor calidad de vida. Gracias a que en los últimos meses ha venido teniendo mejores ventas, Ana Marleny busca un préstamo que le permita comprar productos de la canasta familiar para aumentar la variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes.

Ana Marleny sueña con tener un minimercado donde pueda generar empleo y desde el cual sus ingresos aumenten para ofrecerles a sus 4 hijos una mejor educación.
texts.en: Ana Marleny opened her general store at home 15 years ago aiming at helping her home economically because the income generated by her husband was insufficient to support their four children.  Despite the great economic  difficulties she’s had, her efforts have made it possible for her to move forward and to continue to strive to move her family forward and provide her home with better quality of life.  Thanks to improved sales in recent months, Ana Marleny is looking for financing to buy basic staples to increase the variety of products available for her customers.  Ana Marleny dreams with having a minimart to generate employment and increase her income to offer her four children a better education.

loans.use: to buy basic staples.

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar trabajó durante 12 años en la actividad de las ventas en diferentes empresas, y desde hace 1 año decidió independizarse y comenzar a vender por su propia cuenta productos de uso personal. Desde entonces, ha podido venir trabajando en mejores condiciones y sus ingresos a pesar de no ser los mejores, han podido irle cubriendo sus gastos y los de la familia. La principal ventaja que tiene es que ha conservado los clientes que tenía cuando trabajaba para una empresa, pero la dificultad es el poco capital con el que cuenta que hace que su negocio a menudo no pueda responder ante los grandes pedidos de sus clientes. Es por esto que Edgar busca un préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal y surtir su negocio para responder a los pedidos de sus clientes.

Edgar aspira a poder seguir creciendo con el negocio y abrir más sectores donde comercializa sus productos.
texts.en: Edgar worked as a salesman for various firms for 12 years and a year ago decided to become independent and start to sell personal use products on his own.  Since then, he’s been able to work in better conditions and his income, despite not being the best, has been enough to cover his and his family’s expenses.  His main advantage is that he’s retained the customers he’d gotten back when he was employed by a firm but the difficulty is the small amount of capital he has which often causes his business to be unable to respond to large customer orders.  This is why Edgar is looking for a loan to buy personal use products to stock his business and be able to fill customer orders.  Edgar hopes to continue growing with the business and to open more sectors where he can sell his products.

loans.use: to buy personal use products to fill pending customer orders.

loans.name: Luz Adriana

texts.es:
Luz Adriana inició hace unos 3 años su propio negocio con el objetivo de generar ingresos para contribuir económicamente junto con su esposo en la generación de ingresos para el hogar y poderles ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a sus 4 hijos. El negocio comenzó como un cibercafé donde ofrecía solo el servicio de Internet, pero gracias a requerimientos de sus clientes, ahora tiene una venta de celulares y accesorios para celulares. Desde que tiene su negocio las dificultades económicas de su hogar han podido irse superando y espera que así continúe para que su familia tenga una mejor calidad de vida. Buscando responder a los pedidos de sus clientes, Luz Adriana busca un préstamo para comprar accesorios para celulares y así mejorar sus ventas.

Su sueño es sacar adelante este negocio, que le permita en un futuro conseguir su casa propia y también ofrecerles a sus 4 hijos el acceso una mejor educación.
texts.en:
