El socio es el señor José, él sigue con su actividad económica como técnico dental, elaborando prótesis que generalmente los vende a los odontólogos. José está solicitando el préstamo para comprar  material que le permita elaborar sus prótesis  y accesorios dentales.
José está muy agradecido con KIVA por ayudarlo en el mantenimiento de su actividad económica. El pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en: José works as a dental technician, making dentures that he usually sells to dental surgeons.  He is requesting this loan to buy materials so he can make dentures and dental accessories.  José is very thankful for Kiva's help with his business.  He belongs to the communal bank, "El Templo del Inca" in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy materials to make dentures and dental accessories.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es: Adela tiene 62 años, es una mujer viuda; vive sola en su propia casa, ya que sus hijos viven independientemente. Adela, es una mujer de mucho provecho, se dedica con mucho esmero a la labor que realiza. Su trabajo es labrar la tierra en su parcela tiene cultivos de cacao y plantas de café, viene trabajando 32 años; y en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros; sus plantas mas rentables son el cacao y café; por lo cual las empresas acopiadoras de cuyos productos le remuneran muy bien por cada kilogramo. El problema de su trabajo radica en no poder combatir con los insectos quienes se encargan de dañar los frutos de las plantas. Este es su crédito número 04, sabe que tiene la responsabilidad de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesto a hacerlo. En su banco comunal siempre esta al tanto de todos los acuerdos a los que llegan. Los 1,000 nuevos soles, invertirá en la poda de cacao contratando a jornaleros para que le ayuden.
texts.en: Adela is 62 and a widow.  She lives alone in her own home, since her children live independently.  Adela is a very hard-working woman and puts a lot of effort into the work that she does.  She works on her land growing cacao and coffee plants, which she has done for 32 years.  At harvest time, she counts on the support of day laborers.  Her most profitable plants are cacao and coffee.  The wholesale companies who buy her products pay her very well by the kilogram.  The problem with her work lies in not being able to fight off the insects that harm her plants.  This is her fourth credit.  She knows that she has the responsibility of making all of her payments on time, and she is willing to do it.  In her communal bank, they are always on top of the agreements that they make.  She will invest the 1,000 PEN in the pruning of her cacao plants by hiring day laborers to help her.

loans.use: to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: Alejandro de 37 años de edad, de estado civil casado con Cleofé  de 35 años y tienen 02 hijos; viven en su casa propia que compraron gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano. Alejandro, es agricultor; viene trabajando en su propia chacra hace 12 años  donde cultiva plantas de cacao, plantas de café, plantas de estebia.  En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de los jornaleros. Sabe muy bien el dinero que obtiene es por producir buena calidad de frutos. Sus productos de cacao y café los comercializa en los centros de acopio de su comunidad, puesto que es donde mejores precios le ofrecen por la calidad de sus granos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos, ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es trasladar los productos desde la cosecha hasta el punto de secado. Para más adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras, para aumentar su producción; pero por ahora prioriza en terminar la construcción de su casa. Este es su crédito número 05, siente que el dinero del crédito le ayudara mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es muy querido por el resto de sus compañeros, ya que es muy solidario con ellos. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles comprará calaminas para el techado de su hogar.
texts.en: Alejandro is 37 years old and is married to Cleofé, who is 35 years old.  They have two children and live in their own home which they bought thanks to their daily efforts.  Alejandro is a farmer and has been working his own plot of land for the past 12 years.  He cultivates cocoa, coffee, and stevia plants.  At harvest time he counts on the help of daily harvest workers.  He knows very well that the money he obtains comes from producing high quality fruits.  His cocoa and coffee products are sold in the central markets of his community, since that is where they offer the best prices for quality grains.  What he likes most about his job is harvesting the fruits, since he feels that the months of arduous labor provide him with the payoff through high quality fruits.  He thinks the most difficult part is transporting his products from the field to the place where they dry.  In the future, he hopes to buy more land and to increase his production.  But for now he is prioritizing finishing construction of his house.  This is his fifth credit, and he feels that the money will help him greatly in the progress of his work.  In his communal bank he is very beloved by the other members, since he is very good to them.  With the 1,000 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) he will buy roofing tiles for his home.

loans.use: To purchase roofing tiles for his home.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix, 22, is single and lives in the Philippines. Felix has a food/retail shop (sari-sari store) that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. He's had this business for two years. 

Felix requested a loan of 5000 PHP to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Felix has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Felix hopes to improve his business so he can continue to study.

loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Cirilo

texts.es: Cirilo de 47 años, de estado civil casado con Flora de 34 años y tienen 03 hijos; juntos viven en su casa propia a base de madera. Cirilo se dedica a labora en su chacra; viene trabajando 26 años en sus propias tierras; cuenta con variedad de plantaciones como: plantas de café, plantas de cacao y estebia; ya que son plantas que le generan buenos ingresos. En tiempos de cosecha necesita el apoyo de la mano ajena y tiene que contratar jornaleros para avanzar con las extracciones de los frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los centros de acopio; lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus productos. Su prioridad es comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos. Este es su crédito número 07, le gusta realizar sus pagos puntualmente; además está conforme con el trabajo de su banco comunal porque son personas responsables. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará un terreno para seguir cultivando sus plantas.
texts.en: Cirilo is 47 and is married to Flora, who is 34.  They have three children, and they all live together in their own home, which is made out of wood.  Cirilo makes a living by working on his farm.  He has worked for 26 years on his own land.  He has a variety of crops like coffee, cacao, and stevia.  These are the crops that generate good income.  At harvest time, he needs the help of outside workers, and he has to hire day laborers to make progress with harvesting.  What he likes most about his job is harvesting the fruit since he feels that his months of hard work are rewarded by his fruit's quality.  He thinks that the most difficult part of his job is transporting his products from the farm to the wholesale buying centers, where he gets the best prices for his products.  His priority is to buy new land to increase his production.  This is his seventh credit.  He likes to make his payments on time.  He also agrees with the work of his communal bank because they are responsible people.  With these 1,000 PEN, he will buy land to keep growing his crops.

loans.use: to buy farmland.

loans.name: Norbey De Jesus

texts.es:
Norbey se encuentra casado desde hace un año y como gran emprendedor que siempre se ha resaltado, tiene un negocio de servicio de transporte el cual se esfuerza diariamente por sacar adelante. Pese a las grandes dificultades económicas que padece en su hogar, su esfuerzo permite que puedan salir adelante, además que su gran carisma le ha permitido tener buenos clientes que crecen poco a poco. Buscando mejorar las condiciones de trabajo y poder ofrecer un mejor servicio, Norbey busca un préstamo para renovar su coche y un equino, para así poder ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Su gran sueño es poder comprarse un vehículo con el cual aumente los servicios de transporte y así aumenten sus ingresos, de modo que en su hogar puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas.
texts.en:
Norbey has been married for a year and, like a great entrepreneur, has a transportation services business, where he works hard daily to get ahead.  Given the financial difficulties in his home, his efforts allow him to get ahead, and his charisma allows him to obtain good customers and increase the number little by little.  Norbey wants to improve his working conditions and offer better service to his customers, so he is asking for this loan so that he can renovate his car and equipment.

His great dream is to buy a new vehicle so that he can increase his transportation services and his income.  In this way his family can have a better quality of life and better financial opportunities.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Ana tiene 32 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos. Ella tiene mucha experiencia en el destazo de cerdos, esta actividad la ejerce desde hace 10 años. Los cerdos los adquiere en la misma comunidad donde vive. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar cerdos para el destazo y posteriormente vender la carne en la comunidad. Ella espera que la inversión sea de gran ayuda, para continuar con su trabajo y obtener ganancias que le sirvan para proporcionar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. Pues su objetivo, es poseer una casa propia para sus hijos y brindarles la educación que se merecen.
texts.en:
Ana is 32 years old and is a single mother with three children.  She has a lot of experience with quartering pigs, since she has been working in this area for 10 years.  She purchases the hogs in the same community where she lives.

The loan that she is requesting is for purchasing pigs for quartering and then for selling the meat to the community.  She hopes that the investment will be of great help in order to continue her work and obtain earnings that will allow her to give her children a better quality of life.  Her objective is to possess her own house for her children and to give them the education that they deserve.

loans.use: To purchase pigs for butchering.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de restaurant,la socia hace desayunos,almuerzos y cenas,la socia prepara platos como pollo al horno,sopa de pollo y carne asada,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,la socia tiene 5 años en este negocio,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio restaurant.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz,verduras,pollo y carne.

La socia esta contenta con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a realizar sus pagos en el plazo establecido.
texts.en: This group member continues to work in a restaurant.  She makes breakfast, lunch and dinner.  She prepares dishes like baked chicken, roast beef, and chicken soup. She works from 8am to 5pm and through her business she wants to get ahead.  She has been working in this field for 5 years.  She dreams of growing her restaurant.  She is asking for a loan in order to purchase products for cooking like rice, vegetables, chicken and beef.  She is happy with the loan that she has been offered and promises to comply with the established payment terms.

loans.use: to purchase products for cooking like rice, vegetables, chicken and beef.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
Noemí de 25 años, es una mujer  trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja Hubert de 33 años y sus 02  queridos hijos. Noemí y su pareja salen a trabajar sus campos, para ellos no existen los días de descanso, ya que tiene que trabajar continuamente su chacra para tener una buena producción. Sus principales productos de siembra son, la estebia (hierba medicinal) y el café; las cosechas de café los vende en los centros de acopio ubicadas  a dos horas de su pueblo y las hierbas de estebia los vende en los mercados de diferentes comunidades. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene trabajando en sus cultivos, ya que puede disfrutar libremente de sus verdes campos, lleva 05 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden aquejarlas. Para el futuro, planea comprar nuevas tierras, con las cuales pueda incrementar sus cultivos. Este es su crédito número 07, y espera ser muy puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará plantas de estebia para cultivar en su parcela.
texts.en:
Noemí, 25, is a hard-working woman. She lives in her own home together with her partner Hubert, 33, and their two beloved children. 

Noemí and her partner go out to work their fields. For them, days of rest do not exist since they have to work their ranch continuously to have good production levels. Their principal planting products are Stevia (medicinal herb) and coffee. She sells the coffee crops in the distribution centers located two hours from her town, and she sells the Stevia herbs in the markets of different communities. 

What she likes most about her work is the liberty she has working on her crops, since she can freely enjoy her green fields. She has been doing this for five years and she considers the most difficult thing to be protecting her crops from the pests that can attack them.

In the future, she plans to buy more land with which she can increase her crops. This is her seventh loan, and she hopes to be very punctual with her payments since she does not want to give problems to her communal bank, in which she feels very happy.

With the 1,000 nuevos soles she borrows, she will buy Stevia plants to be grown on her plot of land.

loans.use: to buy Stevia plants

loans.name: Federico

texts.en: Federico is 50 years old and a father of nine children. He is raising his family in a rural community, planting and harvesting rice, fruits and vegetables for sale. His wife helps him in managing their farming business to generate sufficient income for their family. They aimed to increase their yields and income so that they will continue sending their five youngest children to school. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, Federico wants to improve his citrus plantation to ensure a high production. He is asking for financial assistance amounting to P30,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides needed for the maintenance of his citrus plantation. Through patience and hard work, he is hoping that he will improve his farming business and have a fruitful harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides needed for the maintenance of his citrus plantation

loans.name: Emeliana

texts.en:
Emeliana works hard to support her family. Emeliana is married and has an E-loading business for mobile phones in the Philippines.

Emeliana requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more load and sell.  She has been in this business for 10 years.  In the future, Emeliana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more load and sell .

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida,la socia vende desayunos y almuerzos,ella prepara platos como pollo al horno,saltado de carne y sopas,ella vende en forma ambulatoria llevando a diferentes lugares como los obreros que trabajan en construccion,la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m,la socia se dedica a  este negocio 5 años y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos para cocinar como carne,pollo y verduras.

La socia se compremete a cumplir con los pagos correspondientes de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The borrower continues with her food-sales business. She sells breakfasts and lunches and prepares dishes such as roast chicken, salted meat and soup. 

She sells her food in a mobile manner, taking it it different places such as to construction worksites. She works from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m. She has had this business for 5 years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have a restaurant. She is asking for the loan to buy products for cooking such as meat, chicken and vegetables. 

She promises to make all of her loan repayments.

loans.use: to buy products to cook such as meat, chicken and vegetables.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel, de 55 años, un señor muy trabajador, es un hombre viudo; vive solo en su propia casa, ya que sus hijos son mayores se independientes. La labor que realiza Samuel,  es labrar la tierra, donde cultiva plantas de café. Hace 45 años tiene el conocimiento de la agricultura; es por ello que se hace conocido con los vecinos de su localidad, por tal motivo acuden al Sr.  Samuel,  para que les pueda ayudar con sus trabajos. Se siente muy comprometido con su labor; y gracias a ello  y a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta al ver que sus plantas le resultan productivas; puesto que así llega a obtener  buenas ganancias. El crédito solicitado es para la de compra de plantones de café para luego injertarlos y sacar buen provecho de sus frutos en menor tiempo. Este es su crédito número 02, se siente agradecido por el apoyo y en su banco comunal es muy colaborador. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará plantas de café para incrementar en su parcela.
texts.en: Samuel is 55 years old and is a very hard-working man.  He is a widower.  He lives alone in his own home, since his children are grown and independent.  Samuel works the land, where he grows coffee plants.  He has been working in this field for 45 years.  Because of his experience he is known by neighbors throughout the area and thus they call on Samuel so that he can help them with their work.  He feels very committed to his work.  Thanks to his daily efforts, today he enjoys seeing his plants be very productive, since that is also how he can earn good income.  The credit that he is requesting is for the purchase of coffee plant saplings so that he can plant them and benefit from their fruits in less time.  This is his second credit and he feels grateful for the support of his communal bank and is a very good collaborator.  With 1,000 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) he will buy coffee plants in order to grow his crop.

loans.use: To purchase coffee plants.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: Beatriz is a 55-year old resident of Lapinig, Kapatagan. Beatriz provides for her four children's needs from the little amount of 2,800Php she gains monthly from her own piggery business.  She has had the business for four years as an aid to the income gained from her husband. Since 2011, she's been a member of GDMPC, and she applied for a loan of 3,000Php to buy feeding supplies. Beatriz wants to make an expansion to her business someday.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Helen has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, where she sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Helen has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Helen hopes to improve her business to help with the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 31 years old, married, and has two children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Letecia has a basket weaving business in the Philippines. Letecia requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed for her basket weaving.

Letecia has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Letecia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her basket weaving.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed, 36, describes himself as a responsible, very hardworking person for his family’s well-being. Mohamed lives with his wife and four children in the city of Mombasa located in Coast Province.

Mohamed works alone buying and selling vegetables and fruit, a business that allows him to cover household expenses. He is currently asking Yehu for a loan to invest in buying more fruit and vegetables, and to cover the transport cost, which in this season has gone up considerably.  His income should improve, thus attaining a change in his family’s quality of life. He sells his goods at wholesale at the municipal market.  Mohamed dreams with having different outlets for his business.

loans.use: to buy more fruit and vegetables,and to cover the transport cost.

loans.name: Emlyn

texts.en: Emlyn is married and has six children. Emlyn is 46 years old and she resides at Taguitic, Kapatagan.  Emlyn owns and operates a fishing business, selling seafood products like crabs to earn a living. She's been in this business for six years. Each month, she earns 7,000 PHP.  She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy more crabs to sell.  Emlyn been a member of GDMPC since 2011.  In the future, Emlyn hopes to support her children in completing their studies.

loans.use: to buy more crabs to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for coconut meat needed in her business.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita works hard to support her family. Lolita is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Lolita requested a PHP15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell in her sari-sari store. Lolita has been in this business for 2 years.  In the future, Lolita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables to resell

loans.name: Kristina

texts.en: Kristina lives in Meghri town, Syunik region, with her 8-year-old son, Lyova. Kristina is the only breadwinner in the family, and it's hard for her to cover household costs with the salary she gets in a local factory. So Kristina also keeps cattle and gets additional income from the sales of agricultural products. Kristina keeps only one cow at present, and she wants to purchase a few more cows and a heifer to increase the number of cattle. This will allow Kristina to earn more income, which is vital for her to improve living conditions and ensure a better future for her son.

loans.use: to pay for cows

loans.name: Fidela

texts.en:
Fidela is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

Fidela has pigpen that sells grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for 7 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Php to buy animal feeds for the pigs.  Fidela has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Fidela hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds for the pigs

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: This time, Susan is borrowing 25,000 Philippines pesos (Php) to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. The general store business that she previously funded through NWTF, a Kiva partner, continues and provides for Susan and her family income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 52 years old and married with one child. Lydia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like bread, soft drinks, and other groceries to sell in her store.

Lydia has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income selling vegetables. Lydia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bread, soft drinks and other groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 55 years old and married with six children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Ruth is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Ruth has been farming rice for 38 years and also earns additional income from raising livestock. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en: Matilde is married, 57 years of age, and lives in Tagudalo, Aurora with her 10 children. Matilde is operating a clothing sales business to earn a living. She has been in this business for 12 years and earns 3,000 PHP every month. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to obtain more clothes to sell. She joined GDMPC in 2011. Matilde still wishes that her business will progress further.

loans.use: to obtain more clothes to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 44 years old and married with four children. For the past two years, she has been fattening pigs in the Philippines. Susan also earns additional income from rice farming. 

Susan is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan to buy additional piglets to raise. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise

loans.name: Giraldo Eduardo

texts.es:
El socio es el señor Giraldo, soltero con 25 años de edad y un hijo, él se dedica a la odontología.  Giraldo está solicitando el préstamo para comprar material odontológico como pastas y amalgamas, asi como medicamentos de uso odontológico para su consultorio.
Giraldo está muy agradecido con KIVA por ayudarlo en su actividad económica la cual le da los ingresos para mejorar en su atención y profesion, y por que esta ayuda le permitirá ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes. El pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Giraldo is 25 years old, single and has one son. He is a dentist. He is asking for this loan to buy dentistry material such as pastes and amalgams for medical use in his dental practice. 

Giraldo is very grateful to KIVA for helping him with his business which provides him with the income to improve his service and improve professionally. With this loan he will be able to offer his clients a better service. He is a member of the communal bank “El Templo del Inca” (Temple of the Incas) in the city of Cusco, Perú.

loans.use: to buy buy pastes and amalgams for medical use in his dental practice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 35 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Teresita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Teresita has been buying and selling livestock for seven years and also earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 38 years old and is married with one child. She lives in the Philippines. For the past six years, she has been running a motorcycle transport business with her husband as the driver. Norma has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.
 
Norma is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to pay for maintenance on her motorcycle. In the future, she hopes to improve her services.

loans.use: to pay for the motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Rosela

texts.en:
Rosela is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a sari-sari (retail) store in the Philippines. 

Rosela is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, and other items in her sari-sari. NWTF is re-listing Rosela's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, and other items to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 41 years old and is married with three children. She lives in Tagudalo, Aurora. For the past six years, Marlyn has operated a clothing business to earn a living and she earns 4,000 PHP every month. Marlyn joined GDMPC in 2010.

Marylyn is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to obtain more clothes to sell. She wishes that her business will progress.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 56 years old and has four adult children. Due to the hardship of earning a living, she helps her husband manage their citrus farming business to increase their yields. The couple hopes to uplift their standard of living and improve their house and continue to send their children to school. Evangeline's major business challenges are difficulties due to typhoons and calamities, but she still has the determination to pursue her business. She and her husband plan to expand their citrus plantation and increase their production but do not have sufficient capital.

Evangeline is requesting a 35,000 PHP loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide, and to pay the labor cost incurred in running her family's citrus plantation. Through her loan, she believes that she and her husband will improve their business and increase their production and income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide and pay labor costs incurred in running her family's citrus plantation

loans.name: Verginia

texts.en:
Verginia is 69 years old and married with 12 children.

Verginia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a firewood retail business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional firewood to sell.

Verginia has borrowed and paid back 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the firewood retail business for 8 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Verginia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional firewood to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in marketing services to help him promote his business

loans.name: Hayrapet

texts.en:
Hayrapet is a farmer from Masis village in the Ararat region. He keeps pigs and hens and grows beans, peppers, wheat and fruit trees. Hayrapet would like to breed cows, too, but he doesn't have sufficient funds. 

Hayrapet has applied for this loan to purchase two calves. He also plans to use the loan to buy forage for pigs and grass to feed the calves. He expects an increase in agricultural income after the calves grow up and give milk. This is important in order for Hayrapet to gather enough funds to purchase more cattle. 

Hayrapet lives with his wife, two little daughters and pensioner parents. Agriculture is the main source of income for Hayrapet's family, and its development will allow him to ensure improved living conditions for them.

loans.use: to buy two calves, grass and forage

loans.name: Sarou's Group

texts.en:
Sarou, 46, is a widowed mother of four children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. Her family lives in a rural area of the Preahnet Preah district of Banteay Meanchey province, Cambodia. The family's main source of income is rice farming on a three-hectare area of farmland. Sarou  has been rice farming for twenty-five years to make a living. Insufficient water supply is still the main challenge for her paddy-field. She can earn approximately 28,000KHR per day and manages to save about 8,000KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Sarou’s group consists of five members who live in the same village and this is the first loan for her with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is leading her group to request a loan. Sarou will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will help her to grow her rice healthfully and fruitfully so as to fulfill her dream to buy a tractor in order to help her rice-field business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Preahnet Preah district

loans.name: Marlita

texts.en:
Marlita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fishing nets and equipment for her fishing business.

NWTF is relisting Marlita's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and equipment.

loans.name: Arcily

texts.en:
Arcily is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Arcily has a store that sells fruits such as green bananas and pomelos. She has had this business for 6 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more fruit to resell.

Arcily has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Arcily hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to resell

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Crispina works hard to support her family.

She has a business of buying and selling rice in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store, banana and vegetable retail, and farming rice. Crispina is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice business.

Crispina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 30 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Miraflor

texts.en:
Miraflor is from Gubaan, Aurora. She is 40 years old. Miraflor is married and has four children. To make a living, she makes and sells food. She also runs her small sari-sari store. She has been engaged in her business for five years and earns about 5,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, she joined GDMPC. 

Miraflor is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase new supplies such as candies, milo, shampoo and soaps. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase new supplies such as candies, milo, shampoo and soaps

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a local eatery business in the Philippines.

Jenelyn has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

She has been in this business for 4 years.

In the future, Jenelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 39 years old and married with 6 children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Wilma is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farms supplies.

Wilma has been farming vegetables for 20 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried coconut meat.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farms supplies

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: La socia es la señora Cristina, ella continúa con su actividad económica de la artesanía, ella produce y comercializa principalmente elementos de joyería, los cuales comercializa en un puesto de un centro artesanal de la ciudad. Cristina en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para capitalizar actividad y comprar plata para elaborar algunas joyas como aretes, colares y pulseras. Cristina está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, por ayudarla a fortalecer su actividad económica la cual le permite ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y en el mantenimiento de la misma. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en: Cristina continues to make a living in arts and crafts. She mainly makes and sells jewelry pieces, which she sells at post at the city's artisan center. She is requesting the loan to purchase silver to make some jewelry like earrings, necklaces and bracelets. Cristina is very thankful for Kiva's help, which helped her strengthen her business to offer a better quality of life to herself and her family. She belongs to the "Templo del Inca" community bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to purchase silver.

loans.name: Aquila

texts.en:
This is Aquila. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy additional supplies of raw materials needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her family’s daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Aquila hopes her business grows and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Trabajadoras De Tuitzin Group

texts.es:
La señora Rosa esta casad, tiene 22 años de edad, cursó los 3 años de educacion primaria, tiene 1 hijos el cual aun o estudia, se dedica a la artesanía, al tejido de cortes típicos y guipiles, inicio este negocio juntamente con su esposo, con un telar y hasta el momento lleva 3 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien  realiza el mismo trabajo.

Organiza un grupo para poder compra hilos de varias clases y colores, y así mejorar su producción de cortes y guipiles, ya que en el futuro espera tener otros telares y poder tener compradoras de su producción al por mayor. Las demás integrantes se dedican a la artesanía de cortes y guipiles, agricultura de hortalizas, y a la comercialización de frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
Rosa is married, 22 years old, and has a third grade education.  She has one son who attends school.  She is an artist and weaves typical clothing and guipiles.  She and her husband started this business with a workshop and they have had it for three years.  Her husband helps her and he does the same kind of work.

She organizes a group so that she can buy various types of yarn in different colors, and improve her production this way.  In the future she hopes to have more looms and buyers for her wares.  The other members of the group also weave, raise vegetables, and sell fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy yarn.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 34 years old and married with 2 children.

Alma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Alma has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal retail business for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Alma aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Eng's Group

texts.en:
Eng lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is a 29-year-old mother of two dependent children, both of whom are too young to attend school. To support the family, she has been cultivating rice on a 4.5-hectare area of farmland for five years. For extra income, her husband uses his spare time to work for others for a fee. The current business earns her around 17,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. Drought is the main challenge for her rice-paddy.

Eng’s group consists of three female members-- all are the first-time borrowers with Kiva's partner; Eng is leading this group to apply for a loan in amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. She is going to use a portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes her crop yield will become more profitable so as to improve her standard of living’s condition.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is married and has three children. She is 48 years old and lives in Taguitic, Kapatagan. Teresita owns and operates a fishing business, selling seafood products like crabs to earn a living. She's been in this business for three years. Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more crabs to sell. Teresita has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, Teresita hopes to support her children in completing their studies.

loans.use: to buy crabs to sell

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is 39 years old and married with 3 children.

Amy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15500 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Amy has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from dry goods retail and raising pigs.

Amy aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Meline

texts.en: Meline lives in Aygavan village in the Ararat region with her husband, mother in-law, and 2 little sons. Meline's husband works at a local factory and helps Meline to run a farm where they cultivate tomatoes and peppers and grow appletrees. Meline has applied for this loan to purchase tomato and pepper seeds for cultivation. She also plans to hire workers to carry out the cultivation, as well as purchase fuel for the agricultural machine and pay for watering the land. Income from the sales of agricultural products is important for Meline to cover daily costs, so successfull implementation of land cultivation means financial stability and better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and fuel and to pay hired workers and for watering

loans.name: Tamila

texts.en:
Tamila is 47 years old. She lives in a small village of the Kareli District with her family: her husband – Vitali, two sons, mother-in-law, and a brother-in-law. According to the government's estimations the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category and they get monthly social assistance. Tamila’s mother-in-law is a pensioner. 

The family owns a truck. Vitali, his brother, and his sons take wood from the forest and sell it in their village and nearby villages. The family also runs a small dairy farm with a calf and a milk cow, from which they produce cheese. Part of the milk and cheese are used by the family and the rest is sold locally. They also own a plot of land where they grow various vegetables and fruits. Tamila is especially busy with the plot during spring and summer seasons in order to ensure a good harvest in late summer which they sell at the local open market. She seasonally sells fruits and vegetables at the capital city open market.

Tamila requested a loan to purchase various vegetables and fruits to resell them at the Tbilisi (capital city of Georgia) open market. She has 20 years of experience and the reason to start the business was poor living conditions.  She will run her fruits and vegetables trading business and increase the income of the family. Tamila awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase various vegetables and fruits for resell

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children.

Cresencia is selling ready to wear clothes like blouses, pants and short pants. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more ready to wear clothes.

Cresencia has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future,Cresencia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more ready to wear clothes

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 43 years old and married with 3 children who are currently going to school. Annie works very hard to provide for them.

Annie runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell. Annie has been in this business for 4 years.

In the future Annie would like to save enough to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Emerlita

texts.en:
Emerlita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling used clothing in the Philippines.

Emerlita requested a loan of PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more used clothing to sell. She has been in this business for three years. In the future, Emerlita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Sayora

texts.ru: Сайёра очень трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 33 года. Она вдова и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Сайёра старается обеспечить детей со всеми необходимыми средствами, чтобы они не почувствовали, что они сироты. Она решила организовать свой бизнес скотоводством. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2100 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Sayora is a 33-year-old widow who is raising four children.  She is a very hardworking woman.  She is trying to provide her children with all the necessities of life, so that they do not feel like orphans.

Sayora has decided to start her own animal husbandry business. To this end, she has earned a certificate from a course entitled "Achieving Success" and organized by the Business Women's Association.  

She is requesting a loan of 2,100 somoni to buy livestock, in order to start her new business.  She is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle to start a new business

loans.name: Seak's Group

texts.en:
Seak, a citizen from a rural area of the Mongkul Borey District of Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia, is age 42. She is the married mother of six children, four of whom still need her support as they are paid workers with a low salary. To make a living, she has been raising pigs for 15 years and supplements the family’s income by working as a paid worker in the area. Her current business earns her approximately 20,000 riels (KHR) per day and she manages to save about 10,000 KHR for future needs each day after paying for daily expenses.  

This cycle is Seak's first loan cycle with Kiva's partner VisionFund – the same cycle as her co-member in this group consisting of two members. She is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy pig feed for her pig-raising business. She hopes to fatten her pig to a healthy condition, so she can sell it for a good price. By doing so, she will be able to upgrade her living conditions greater than before.

loans.use: to buy pig feed.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, de 37 años, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Félix de 51 años y sus 04 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Elizabeth, es una mujer alegre y luchadora, se preocupa por el bienestar de su familia; hace 25 años que se dedica al labrar la tierra para después cultivar plantas de café. En tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, hijos y de algunos jornaleros quienes le ayudan a extraer los frutos de manera rápida. Para después llevarlas a vender a la ciudad de San Francisco, donde se encuentran lo centros de acopio que le remuneran buenas ganancias por cada kilogramo de café. Por lo tanto lo que prioriza ahora es poder sembrar plantas de cacao para que pueda incrementar en su parcela. Este es su crédito número 11, sabe que tiene que ser puntual con las cuotas de pago para que en otra oportunidad pueda acceder a otra solicitud de préstamo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy activa y responsable.
Con los 500 nuevos soles, comprará plantas de café.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 37, lives in her own house with her husband Félix, 51, and her four dear children, to whom she wishes to offer a better quality of life. 

Elizabeth is a cheerful and determined woman, who is concerned about her family's well-being. She has been working the land and growing coffee plants for 25 years.

At harvest times, she has help from her husband, her children, and a few day laborers who help her pick the berries rapidly, to then take them to the town of San Francisco to be sold. The collection centers there pay good earnings for each kilogram of coffee. 

Therefore, her current priority is to be able to plant coffee plants so that they can grow on her plot of land. 

This is her 11th loan, and she knows she has to be very punctual with her installment payments, so that on another occasion she can access another loan. 

In her communal bank, she is a very active and responsible member.  

With the 500 nuevos soles, she will buy coffee plants.

loans.use: To buy coffee plants.

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru: Мохира трудолюбивая женщина, ей 29 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании у нее  2-е детей. Ее дети несовершеннолетние. Она работает в школе учительницей. Её муж уехал в Россию на заработки. Условия жизни у них очень тяжелые. После занятий в школе она работает на поле, чтобы заработать деньги для  содержания семьи. Она участвовала в тренинге «Добейся успеха» организованной Ассоциации Деловых Женщин и после этого запланировала  заняться бизнесом по купле продажи скота. От данного бизнеса она намерена  получить доход, и улучшить условия проживания семьи. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 500 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mohira is 29 years old, and a very hardworking woman.  She is married and raising two children who are still minors.  She works as a school teacher.  

Mohira's husband left for Russia, to find some work.  The family's living conditions are very difficult.  After school, Mohira works in the fields in order to make enough money to support her family.  

Mohira attended a course entitled "Achieving Success", organized by the Business Women's Organization.  Her plan was to complete her course and get involved in buying and selling livestock.  Mohira would like to be involved in livestock sales in order to receive an income and improve her family's living conditions.  

She is requesting a loan of 500 somoni to buy livestock.  She is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle to start a new business.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia de 31 años, es una señora muy hacendosa, vive en propia casa junto a su pareja Juan de 31 años y su querido hijo Carlos de 06 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Sonia, una mujer compasiva dedicada a su trabajo en los campos de cultivo donde le brinda bastante cuidado a su cultivo de café; ya que su familia depende de la producción de sus frutos. Lo que mas le gusta de trabajo es poder realizar junto a su esposo e hijos quienes le dan motivo para seguir adelante con la obtención de las  plantas de café, a la vez considera difícil sobre las malezas que llegan crecen en medio de las plantas de sus sembradíos. Hasta ahora cuenta con el apoyo de los financistas de MFP ya que ellos apoyan la manera como trabaja Maribel en su campo de cultivo. Este es su crédito número 04, se orgullosa de saber que una vez mas contará con el apoyo financiero. En su banco comunal es responsable con las reuniones que realizan. Con los 500 nuevos soles, podrá comprar sacos de abono natural el mantenimiento de su plantación.
texts.en: Sonia is 31 years old and a very industrious woman. She lives in her own home along with her husband, Juan, 31, and their beloved 6-year-old son Carlos, for whom they want to provide a better quality of life. Sonia is passionately dedicated to her work in the fields, taking much care to cultivate coffee, since her family depends on the production. What she likes most about her work is being able to do it alongside her husband, who motivates her to keep moving forward to obtain coffee plants. At the same time, she considers the most difficult part to be dealing with the weeds that grow among her crops. She counts on the support of Kiva partner MFP, which helps her with her work in the fields. This is her fourth loan, and she is proud of knowing that once again she will have financial support. She is responsible for the meetings held at her community bank. With the loan, she plans to purchase sacks of natural fertilizers to maintain her crops.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Elita

texts.en:
Elita is 55 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by raising cows in the Philippines. Elita is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to purchase an additional cow to raise.

Elita has been raising cows for 10 years and earns additional income by selling dried coconut meat.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional cow to raise.

loans.name: William

texts.es:
William, de 29 años es un joven muy alegre y luchador, vive en su propia casa junto a su pareja Mizraem de 29 años y sus 02 queridos hijos,  a quienes desean brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Durante 13 años William, se dedico a la actividad agrícola; empezó ayudando a sus padres y ahora que tiene su familia pues llego a comprarse un terreno donde pueda plantar cacao. Asegura que es rentable por cada kilogramo que se llega a vender depende de la producción, es por eso que  se dedico a sembrar cacao en sus campos y ansiosamente espera los buenos resultados de siembra ya que siempre esta permanente en su trabajo. Por tal motivo acude a los bancos de MFP para solicitar un préstamo en la puedan ayudar con sus planes de trabajo, es decir, que gracias al crédito que le faciliten podrá realizar el mantenimiento de sus sembrios. Este es su crédito número 02, se siente contento por el apoyo  que le brindan ya que de esa manera seguirá con su objetivo. En su banco comunal se siente agradecido por elegirle como presidente de su grupo.
Con los 500 nuevos soles, podrá contratar jornaleros para que le ayuden a desyerbar y pasteurizar sus plantaciones.
texts.en:
William is 29 years old and is a very happy and hardworking young man who lives with his wife, 29 year old Mizraem, and his two loving children to whom he wants to provide a better quality of life.  For the past 13 years, William has been a farmer.  He started out by helping his parents and now has a family of his own.  He bought a plot of land where he could raise cacao.  He says that he will make a profit for every kilogram he sells, depending on his production.  It’s for this reason that he decided to plant cacao on his land and he anxiously awaits the good results.  He is always working.

It’s for this reason that he approached MFP to request a loan that can help him with his work plans.  Thanks to the loan, he will be able to maintain his crop.  This will be his second loan and he is grateful for the support that he is getting so that he can continue toward his objective.  He is happy to have been elected the president of his communal bank.

He will use the 500 PEN from this loan to hire field hands to help him week and clean up his crops.

loans.use: to hire field hands.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira previously accessed an 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products for her retail store. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in higher profit. Her profits from business will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and child’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Elvira hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams to be able to afford to give her child a high-quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and it's where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Urbana

texts.en: Urbana of Campo 5, Ramon Magsaysay, is 47 years old, married and has five children. To make a living, Urbana has grown rice for 12 years and earns 8,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Urbana joined GDMPC. Urbana is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is 52 years old, married and has three children. Her family lives in the village of Roxas Cordon. Lilia would like to increase her sales and income but capital for her general store is not sufficient. So, she asks for a loan of PHP15,000 which will be used to restock her general store. She hopes to get this loan amount to be able to send her youngest child into a higher level of education and continue to improve their way of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her general store.

loans.name: Agusta

texts.en:
Agusta is 48 years old and married with two children.

Agusta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (convenience) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell.

Agusta has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for seven years and also earns an income from shell crafting.

Agusta aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari sari store.

loans.name: Dania Marieta

texts.es: La socia es la señora Dania, ella continúa con su actividad como contadora. Dania en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para la implementación de su estudio cantable y comprará algunos útiles de escritorio y muebles como archivadores, para organizar mejor su oficina. Dania está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, por ayudarla a mejorar  su actividad económica la cual le permite ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
The borrower is Dania. She is continuing with her accounting business. On this ocasion, Dania is applying for a loan to operate her accounting firm. She will buy some office supplies, and furniture such as filing cabinets for better organizing her office. 

Dania is very grateful for Kiva's help and for assisting her to improve her business, which allows her to provide her family with a better quality of life.  She belongs to the "El Templo del Inca" communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: To buy office supplies and filing drawers.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SOLIDARIDAD - CCACHIMAYO,la socia continua con su negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia cria a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan ,la socia a la vez continua dedicandose al negocio de ganaderia de igual forma los cria para luego venderlos a sus clientes o en la ferias ,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de alimentos para sus animales como forraje,alfalfa y maiz.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
She is a member of the “SOLIDARIDAD – CCACHIMAYO” communal bank and continues with her business of raising small animals such as Guinea pigs and chickens.  She’s been doing this for years and puts in hard work each day.  She raises these animals to later resell them to her customers who request them and in fairs.  She is a responsible and hardworking woman and is the one who gets her family ahead.

She is asking for this loan to buy feed for her animals, such as hay, alfalfa, and corn.

She is grateful for the loan and promises to be on time with her payments.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals.

loans.name: Martha Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Martha, soltera con 36 años de edad y un hijo en la escuela, ella se dedica  a la atención de su restaurante, actividad que viene realizando hace algunos años y que le ha permitido sacar adelante a su hijo.
Martha está solicitando el préstamo para comprar insumos como carnes, verduras, menestras, arroz etc. para la producción de su restaurante. Martha está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, para fortalecer su actividad económica la cual le permite ofrecer una mejor educación a su hijo. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en:
Martha is single and has a son who attends school.  She takes care of her restaurant and has been doing so for a few years.  It’s allowed her to get ahead with her son.

Martha is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies, such as meats, vegetables, vegetable stews, rice, etc. for her restaurant.  Martha is very grateful for Kiva’s help in strengthen her business, which allows her to provide a better education for her son.  She is a member of the “El Templo del Inca” communal bank, located in Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SOLIDARIDAD - CCACHIMAYO,la socia continua con su negocio  de salchipapas,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vendé de forma ambulatoria en una de las calles del distrito de Cachimayo,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como papa,aceite,salchichas y mostaza.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The loan recipient is a member of the village bank "Solidaridad - Cachimayo". She continues with her business selling salchipapas [sausage and french fries]. She has been doing it for awhile and it's going well thanks to the dedication she puts into it every day. She sells her product on one of the streets in the district of Cachimayo. She is responsible and dedicated and this is how she gets her family ahead. 

She asks for a loan to buy ingredients like potatoes, oil, sausages and mustard. She is grateful for the loan awarded to her and promises to meet her repayment quotas.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like potatoes, oil, sausages and mustard.

loans.name: Tarcela

texts.en:
Growing corn has been the primary source of income for Tarcela's family. But with her livestock business, she has been able to improve their standard of living gradually through the help of her loving husband. The couple were blessed with four children. Tarcela had engaged herself into raising hogs and corn crops. Ten years ago she started to raise hogs while four years ago she started her vegetable garden. According to Tarcela, her eldest child is married; another two are studying and the fourth is single and working at their municipality.

Tarcela wants to take out a loan of PHP 11,000. She will use this loan to buy hog feed, vitamins and also to buy vegetable seeds for her backyard garden. She hopes that she could get this loan amount to be able to increase her profits and educate her children. Tarcela is looking forward to continuous growth of her livestock and a productive vegetable garden.Then she could obtain greater income which will serve her family's needs and help develop the livestock business.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed, vitamins and also to buy seeds for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Petra

texts.en: Petra is married and has two children. She has run her general store for five years. She is thankful to God because she is able to sustain their daily needs, send her eldest child to school and improve their way of living. She wants to have steady growth in her income so she can re-stock her general store. Her greatest dream is to offer her village a complete line of merchandise. To make her dream come true she applied for a loan of PHP 11,000 which she will use to buy more merchandise. In this way, she could generate more income which will enable her to sustain her family's basic needs, send her children into a higher level of education and have a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her variety store.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 49 years old and married with six children.

Josephine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her general store.

Josephine has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport and raising pigs.

Josephine aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married and has three children. He is the only provider for the family.

Ibrahim owns a small coffee shop. He established his business in 2009, and he specializes in tea as well as coffee. He now has one employee and a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $3000 loan to pay the annual rent for the shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his coffee shop

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Agnes will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will continue to educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing, which will increase her income and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de restaurant,la socia prepara desayunos,almuerzos y cenas,la socia preapara platos como arroz con pollo,saltado de carne y sopas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia tiene 6 años en este negocio,el sueño de la socia es tener un local mas amplio para su restaurant.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz,verduras,pollo y carne.

La socia se compromete a hacer sus pagos en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The loan recipient continues with her business, a restaurant where she prepares breakfasts, lunches and dinners. She makes dishes like arroz con pollo [chicken and rice], beef stir fry and soups. She works from 8:00am to 6:00pm. She has been in this business for 6 years and her dream is to have a bigger space for her restaurant.

She asks for a loan to buy food products like rice, vegetables, chicken and beef. She promises to make her payments in the established time period.

loans.use: to buy food products like rice, vegetables, chicken and beef.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SOLIDARIDAD - CCACHIMAYO,la socia continua con su negocio de venta de ropa interior y venta de zapatos, la socia lleva años en  este negocio el cual le va bien gracias el empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cada cierto tiempo le manda dinero a su hermana para que compre la mercadería  para de esta forma la socia pueda vender su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de zapatos para su negocio.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The loan recipient is a member of the cooperative bank Solidaridad-Cachimayo. She continues with her business selling underclothes and shoes. She has been in this business for years and it's going well thanks to the dedication she puts into it every day. Every so often the recipient sends money to her sister to buy merchandise - this way she is able to sell the merchandise to her customers who ask for it. She is responsible and dedicated, and this business is how she gets her family ahead.

She asks for a loan to buy shoes for her business. She is grateful for the loan awarded to her and promises to meet her established payments.

loans.use: to buy shoes for her business.

loans.name: Soeurt's Group

texts.en:
Soeurt lives in a rural village of the Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province, Cambodia. She is 60 years old and married with three children. She has earned a living through rice cropping on a three-hectare area of farmland for 35 years. She is able to earn about 28,000 KHR per day and save around 8,000 KHR each day after offsetting daily expenses. Low crop yield is the main challenge. 

Soeurt has been with Kiva’s partner VisionFund for three cycles and successfully paid back the past loans. She has wisely and successfully used the past loans to better support her family with sufficient food. Now she is leading her group of three to request a loan. Soeurt is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes her crop yield will become more productive and profitable so as to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. Erlinda is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Erlinda requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional netting and other materials for her fishing business.

Erlinda has been in this business for 11 years now.

In the future, Erlinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional netting and other materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Cresilda

texts.en:
Cresilda is 48 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Cresilda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy items for her general store. She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, canned goods and soft drinks. In the future, Cresilda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items for her general store

loans.name: Verginia

texts.en:
Verginia of Gapasan, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, has been raising pigs for more than three years and earns 3,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) per month. She’s 51 years old now, yet continues to hang on with her piggery livelihood to make an adequate life for her child. 

She's been a member of GDMPC since 2009. In order to enhance her livestock upon selling, she borrowed the amount of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to purchase feeding supplies. Verginia hopes that someday, her child will be successful in a career.

loans.use: to purchase feeding supplies.

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
Marleni tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Ella antes solo se dedicaba a realizar los oficios domésticos en su casa, luego estuvo elaborando panes con pollo para vender durante dos años. Posteriormente, inicio un trabajo como fotógrafa y toma de videos. Hoy en día ella esta iniciando el negocio de la crianza y venta de pollos de engorde, ya que viene la temporada navideña y es cuando hay más demanda. El año pasado hizo una prueba con 60 pollos y obtuvo una buena ganancia, ya que ella lo administra en su propia casa, al mismo tiempo que se ocupa de cuidar a sus hijos, un varón de 13 años y una niña de 8 años de edad. Para comprar los pollos y el concentrado, viajan a la ciudad en el vehiculo que posee su esposo y tarda unos cuarenta y cinco minutos en llegar. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar 5 cuartones de madera, 15 láminas, un rollo de tela ciclón, bloque, plástico negro, pago de instalación de energía eléctrica, 300 pollos, 5 sacos de concentrado, comederos y bebederos de agua. Con esta inversión Marleni comprara los materiales para ampliar la galera en donde tiene sus pollos e incrementara la cantidad de pollos. A fin de recibir buenas ganancias que le permitan reparar el vehiculo de su esposo que esta en muy malas condiciones y es el que les sirve para realizar los viajes. A demás le servirá para proporcionar a su familia todo lo necesario para mejorar su calidad de vida. Su gran deseo, es brindarle la oportunidad a sus hijos de que estudien, debido a que por provenir de una familia de escasos recurso económicos no pudo estudiar y ella desea que sus hijos si lo hagan.
texts.en: Marleni is 34 years old, married and has two children. She used to be only dedicated to her household duties, but then started baking bread with chicken two years ago. Later, she started working as a photographer and taking videos. Today she is starting a business raising and selling chickens, since Christmastime is coming and that is when there is the most demand. Last year she gave it a try with 60 chickens and made a good profit, and she ran the business from her own home while caring for her two children, a 13-year-old boy and a 8-year-old girl. She travels to the city to buy the chickens and the feed in her husband's car, and it takes about 45 minutes. She is requesting the loan to purchase five pallets of wood, 15 zinc sheets, a roll of fabric, cinder blocks, black plastic sheeting, 300 chickens, five bags of feed, and feeding and drinking bins, and to pay for electrical installation. With this investment, Marleni will be able to upgrade her chicken coop and increase the number of chickens it holds. After taking her profits she will be able to repair her husband's car, which is in poor condition. It will also help her provide her family with everything it needs to improve its quality of life. Her biggest wish is for her children to have the opportunity to get an education, because she came from a family with limited resources and could not afford to go to school, and she wants her children to have what she couldn't.

loans.use: to purchase wood, zinc sheets, fabric, cinder blocks, black plastic sheeting, 300 chicks, five sacks of feed, and feeding and drinking bins, and to pay for electrical installation.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 13,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy an additional pump boat for her fishing business.

Florenda has been in this business for three years. Florenda earns more income from a general store.

Florenda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional pump boat for her fishing business.

loans.name: Ladfy Esther

texts.es:
La socia es la señorita Ladfy, soltera con 19 años de edad, ella se dedica  a la venta de calzado por catalogo, actividad que viene realizando para poder ahorrar y continuar con sus estudios superiores.
Ladfy está solicitando el préstamo para comprar mercadería y estoquearse para la próxima campaña navideña. Ladfy está muy agradecida con la ayuda de KIVA, por ayudarla a fortalecer su actividad económica la cual le permitirá acceder a una mejor educación. La socia pertenece al banco comunal “El Templo del Inca”; de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú.
texts.en: Our member, Ladfy, is a single 19 year old.  She makes a living selling footwear from a catalog so that she can continue saving and paying for her studies.  Ladfy is seeking a loan to purchase merchandise to stock her business for the coming Christmas season.  She is very grateful to Kiva for helping her strengthen her business which allows her to access a good education.  Ladfy is a member of the communal bank "El Templo del Inca" in Cusco, Peru.

loans.use: to purchase footwear.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is 40 years old and a divorced man. He lives with his five children and takes care of them. Mohamed has a motorcycle taxi in which he makes journeys to different parts of town. He says that his job is too risky because he is at times forced to pass through dark alleys at night. There have been cases of insecurity over the past months. Despite these challenges, he is not faint of heart.
